column2: The Site Supervisor will play a crucial role in ensuring the successful execution of projects, overseeing construction activities, and ensuring adherence to safety and quality standards. If you are a skilled leader with a solid background in construction and a passion for delivering outstanding results, this position offers an excellent opportunity to grow your career within our dynamic organization.       Responsibilities:     1. Leadership and Management:   - Supervise and lead a team of construction workers, subcontractors, and other staff members efficiently and effectively.   - Assign tasks and duties to team members and ensure they are carried out to meet project deadlines.   - Lead by example, motivating and inspiring team members to strive for excellence in performance, productivity, and quality.   - Conduct regular performance evaluations, provide feedback, and mentor team members for continuous improvement.   - Develop and nurture a positive and collaborative work environment.     2. Project Planning and Execution:   - Collaborate with project managers to develop detailed project plans, considering project requirements, timelines, and resources.   - Coordinate and schedule construction activities, ensuring all parties involved are aware of their responsibilities and deadlines.   - Oversee the procurement and delivery of necessary equipment, materials, and tools.   - Monitor project progress, identify and resolve any issues or conflicts, and ensure projects are delivered on time and within budget.   - Conduct regular inspections, quality control checks, and enforce compliance with safety regulations and company policies.     3. Communication and Collaboration:   - Establish effective communication channels with project stakeholders, including clients, architects, engineers, and other contractors.   - Provide regular updates to project managers and other team members regarding project progress, challenges, and risks.   - Resolve conflicts or disputes that may arise during construction activities, ensuring open and transparent communication.   - Collaborate with the project management team to troubleshoot and find solutions to any unexpected challenges during construction.     4. Safety and Compliance:   - Ensure all construction activities comply with safety regulations, building codes, and legal requirements.   - Identify potential hazards and take immediate action to mitigate risks, maintaining a safe work environment for all workers.   - Promote and enforce a strong safety culture among all team members, emphasizing the importance of following safety protocols and procedures.       Qualifications:     - A minimum of X years of experience in construction, with a proven track record as a site supervisor or similar leadership role.   - Sound knowledge of construction processes, best practices, and building codes.   - Strong leadership and communication skills to effectively manage and motivate teams.   - Exceptional organizational and problem-solving abilities to manage multiple tasks simultaneously.   - Excellent attention to detail and ability to ensure the highest standard of quality.   - Ability to read and interpret project plans, blueprints, and technical drawings.   - Proficiency in using construction management software and technology tools.
column11: Procurement, Site management, Manager Quality Assurance, Project management, Billing, Project planning, Manager Quality Control, Continuous improvement, Construction management, Civil engineering

column2: The Site Engineer at Talrop will be responsible for overseeing day-to-day construction activities, ensuring compliance with project plans and specifications and maintaining a safe and efficient work environment on-site.      This role requires strong technical knowledge, excellent communication skills and the ability to collaborate effectively with project teams and subcontractors.            Responsibilities :              Oversee all on-site construction activities, including site preparation, excavation, foundation work, structural erection, MEP installations and finishing works, to ensure adherence to project plans, specifications and quality standards.                  Implement and enforce quality control measures to ensure that construction activities meet or exceed industry standards and client expectations.              Enforce strict safety protocols and ensure compliance with health and safety regulations to maintain a safe working environment for all personnel on-site.                  Coordinate construction activities to ensure that project milestones and deadlines are met and progress is tracked according to the project schedule.                  Monitor material deliveries, inventory levels and usage on-site and coordinate with procurement teams to ensure timely availability of materials and supplies as per project requirements.          Coordinate with subcontractors, suppliers and vendors to ensure timely mobilisation, effective collaboration and resolution of issues affecting construction progress.                  Maintain accurate records of daily construction activities, including site reports, progress photos, inspection reports and as-built drawings, in compliance with project documentation requirements.                  Identify opportunities for process improvement, innovation and efficiency enhancement on-site and contribute to lessons learned sessions to support ongoing organisational learning and development.          Skills required :              Strong technical knowledge of construction methods, materials and building codes.                  Proficiency in reading and interpreting construction drawings, plans and specifications.                  Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively with multidisciplinary teams and stakeholders.                  Familiarity with construction management software (e.g. Procore, Primavera, Microsoft Project) is a plus.                  Willingness to work on-site and adapt to changing work conditions and schedules.          Qualifications :              Bachelor's degree in Civil Engineering, Construction Management or related field.                  3+ years of experience in construction, supervision of projects.

column2: Amit Enterprises Housing Ltd is looking for Civil Engineer for Construction Site to join our dynamic team and embark on a rewarding career journey      Designing infrastructure projects:      The Civil Engineer must develop plans and designs for infrastructure projects, taking into account factors such as cost, safety, environmental impact, and construction feasibility      Analyzing data: The Civil Engineer must analyze data, such as survey reports, environmental impact studies, and geotechnical reports, to inform design decisions and ensure that projects meet relevant standards and regulations      Managing projects: The Civil Engineer must manage infrastructure projects from start to finish, including overseeing construction, coordinating with contractors and other stakeholders, and ensuring that projects are completed on time and within budget      Conducting site inspections: The Civil Engineer must conduct site inspections to ensure that construction work is being performed according to plans and specifications, and to identify and address any issues that arise      Ensuring safety and compliance: The Civil Engineer must ensure that infrastructure projects are designed and constructed to meet relevant safety standards and regulations, and that appropriate permits and approvals are obtained      Maintaining infrastructure: The Civil Engineer must oversee maintenance and repairs of existing infrastructure, ensuring that it remains safe and functional for its intended use      To be successful as a Civil Engineer, candidates should have strong analytical and problem-solving skills, as well as excellent communication and project management skills      They should also have a solid understanding of engineering principles and practices, and be familiar with relevant regulations and standards

column2: Job Description       ?Ensure quality and accuracy of designs. Offer suggestions to assist in the efficiency of works Produce Hand sketches & Carry out and check design calculations. Ensure compliance with project Design Criteria/Client Brief/Approved Concept. Check documentation complies with design. Attend design, clients, architects and site meetings. Ensure compliance with program constraints and budget; and maintain Quality Procedure Manual. Other duties and responsibilities as reasonably required by the Team Leader/Division Manager.      Job Responsibility As a result of the continuing growth of our Design and Engineering business, our Civil and Structural Engineering team in Bangalore, Chennai and Mumbai are seeking to recruit an experienced Principal Structural Engineer. This new appointment is part of our aspiration to develop and grow our structural team in India. This role will allow the right candidate to play a leading role in some of the most challenging and exciting engineering projects in the world. The successful candidate will have a proven track record in the management and production of engineering / technical deliverables on a range of multi-disciplinary projects of varying scales and levels of complexity. You will be responsible for overall Civil and Structural Engineering technical delivery within the Bangalore, Chennai and Mumbai Offices, providing all necessary technical direction, resourcing, mentoring and assurance of structural engineering within Bangalore, Chennai and Mumbai offices.      Credibility, competence, agility and technical excellence are a given as the role requires close working with our internal and external clients, decision makers, industry stakeholders and other consultants to develop robust design solutions through collaborative and proactive management of client demands - providing leadership from both a technical delivery and people management perspective is imperative. You will be a Structural Engineer with a proven track record of successful technical and commercial delivery of design projects from feasibility through to completion of construction/handover.      You will be required to demonstrate a developed understanding of the market and industry and ability to focus our business to take full advantage of market conditions and have experience in assisting with the preparation of bids and tendering opportunities, where required.      Our offices provides multi-disciplinary design and engineering services and integrated solutions across a wide range of sectors. This appointment offers a challenging and rewarding opportunity to apply knowledge, experience and problem solving skills to assist with leading and developing our business, from a technical perspective.     ?Desired Profile: --Candidate must possess at least a Bachelors Degree, Post Graduate Diploma, Professional Degree, Masters Degree, Engineering (Civil) or equivalent. --At least 5 years of working experience in the related field is required for this position. --Preferably Senior Executives specializing in Engineering - Civil/Construction/Structural or equivalent.

column2: We are looking for a well-organized site engineer with strong leadership skills to join our growing team. The site engineer s responsibilities include managing different parts of construction projects, supervising crew members, preparing estimates for time and material costs, completing quality assurance, observing health and safety standards, and compiling reports for different stakeholders. You should be able to work alongside various professionals and create work schedules that meet deadlines.     To be successful as a site engineer, you should demonstrate strong analytical and logical thinking skills. Outstanding candidates should display a superb work ethic and thrive under pressure.       Site Engineer Responsibilities:      Organizing materials and ensuring sites are safe and clean.     Preparing cost estimates and ensuring appropriate materials and tools are available.     Providing technical advice and suggestions for improvement on particular projects.     Diagnosing and troubleshooting equipment as required.     Negotiating with suppliers and vendors to ensure the best contracts.     Authorizing technical drawings and engineering plans.     Drawing up work schedules and communicating any adjustments to crew members and clients.     Gathering data, compiling reports and delivering presentations to relevant stakeholders.     Delegating tasks and scheduling meetings and training sessions where required.     Completing quality assurance and providing feedback to the team.         Site Engineer Requirements:      Bachelor s degree in engineering, construction, or similar.     A driver s license.     Sound knowledge of Engineering, construction, and design.     Great leadership and organizational skills.     Superb project management skills.     Ability to apply logical and critical thinking skills to projects.     Great written and verbal communication skills.     A willingness to learn.

We are looking for a skilled and experienced Civil Foreman to join our construction team      The Civil Foreman will be responsible for overseeing and coordinating construction activities, ensuring that projects are completed safely, on time, and within budget      The ideal candidate should have a strong background in civil construction, leadership skills, and a commitment to maintaining high-quality standards          Responsibilities:          Site Supervision:Oversee day-to-day activities on construction sites, ensuring compliance with safety regulations and quality standards      Coordinate and supervise the work of construction crews and subcontractors      Project Planning:Assist in the development of project plans, including work schedules, resource requirements, and material deliveries      Collaborate with the project manager to ensure project milestones are met      Quality Control:Monitor construction work to ensure it meets specified quality standards      Conduct regular inspections and address any issues or deviations promptly      Team Leadership:Provide leadership and guidance to construction crews      Train and mentor new team members as needed      Communication:Communicate effectively with project managers, engineers, and other stakeholders      Report progress, issues, and changes to the project manager      Material Management:Coordinate the delivery and use of construction materials      Ensure proper storage and handling of materials on-site      Problem-Solving:Identify and resolve issues that may impact construction schedules or quality      Collaborate with project teams to find effective solutions      Documentation:Maintain accurate and up-to-date records of construction activities, including daily logs and progress reports      Ensure compliance with project documentation requirements
column11: Material management, Civil construction, Construction, Quality standards, Compliance, Project documentation, Site supervision, Project planning, Manager Quality Control

column2: Reporting to the Construction Manager Project Management (Wind), the Wind Power Project Civil Lead is responsible for overseeing the civil engineering aspects of wind energy projects.      This role involves managing the design, construction and maintenance of the infrastructure and facilities necessary for wind farms.          Responsibilities        The responsibilities of this role include but are not limited to:        Project Planning    Collaborating with project managers and stakeholders to develop project plans, timelines, and budgets for the civil engineering aspects of wind farms          Site Selection and Assessment        Assisting in site selection by evaluating the suitability of land for wind farm development, considering factors such as topography, soil conditions, accessibility, and environmental impact          Design and Engineering        Overseeing the design and engineering of the civil infrastructure, including roads, foundations, substations, and electrical connections, to support the installation of wind turbines          Permits and Regulatory Compliance    Ensuring that all civil engineering aspects of the project comply with local, state, and federal regulations, including permits for construction and environmental impact assessments          Construction Management    Supervising construction activities, coordinating with contractors and subcontractors to ensure that civil infrastructure is built according to specifications, budget, and schedule          Quality Control    Implementing and managing quality control processes to ensure that civil infrastructure meets safety, reliability, and performance standards          Cost Management    Monitor and control project costs, identifying and addressing cost overruns or delays in civil engineering activities          Safety and Environmental Compliance    Prioritising safety protocols for construction and operation, and ensuring adherence to environmental regulations and best practices          Maintenance and Repairs    Develop and implement maintenance plans for the civil infrastructure to ensure its ongoing functionality and longevity          Team Leadership    Leading a team of civil engineers and technicians, providing guidance, direction and support as needed          Collaboration    Working closely with other project leads, such as wind turbine engineers, electrical engineers and environmental specialists to ensure overall project success          Requirements          M. Tech./ M.E/ B.E./ B. Tech/ MBA (Civil Engineering)          Minimum 8-10 years of experience, with at least 6 years in Wind or Hybrid Site construction management          Well-versed with Indian standards and design methodology          Civil equipment identification and required sizing for uninterrupted construction works          Knowledge of construction methods like design mix, cube sizing, testing, calibration, aggregate selections, levelling methodology and materials related to wind farm civil infrastructure          Understanding of environmental regulations and permitting processes          Excellent communication and leadership skills          Location          Job location for the above position is preferably Gujarat or Tamil Nadu, but based on projects and organisational requirements, candidate should be willing to travel to construction sites pan-India.
column11: Civil, Construction, Site selection, Turbine, Project planning, wind energy, Manager Quality Control, Construction management, Civil engineering, civil infrastructure

  Responsibilities        The responsibilities of this role include but are not limited to:        Project Support        Assisting the Lead Civil Engineer in developing project plans, timelines and column2: Designing infrastructure projects: The Civil Engineer must develop plans and designs for infrastructure projects, taking into account factors such as cost, safety, environmental impact, and construction feasibility.     Analyzing data: The Civil Engineer must analyze data, such as survey reports, environmental impact studies, and geotechnical reports, to inform design decisions and ensure that projects meet relevant standards and regulations.     Managing projects: The Civil Engineer must manage infrastructure projects from start to finish, including overseeing construction, coordinating with contractors and other stakeholders, and ensuring that projects are completed on time and within budget.     Conducting site inspections: The Civil Engineer must conduct site inspections to ensure that construction work is being performed according to plans and specifications, and to identify and address any issues that arise.     Ensuring safety and compliance: The Civil Engineer must ensure that infrastructure projects are designed and constructed to meet relevant safety standards and regulations, and that appropriate permits and approvals are obtained.     Maintaining infrastructure: The Civil Engineer must oversee maintenance and repairs of existing infrastructure, ensuring that it remains safe and functional for its intended use.To be successful as a Civil Engineer, candidates should have strong analytical and problem-solving skills, as well as excellent communication and project management skills. They should also have a solid understanding of engineering principles and practices, and be familiar with relevant regulations and standards.

column2: Role & responsibilities  -  you will be responsible for conducting surveys and providing accurate measurements and data for construction of road projects. This is a mid-level position requiring 4 to 5 years of experience. The job responsibilities will include -    Conduct detailed surveys of land intended for road construction, including topographic surveys and boundary delineation. Utilize surveying equipment such as total stations, GPS receivers, and drones to accurately measure and map terrain. Assess the suitability of land for road construction, identifying potential obstacles, drainage issues, and environmental concerns. Set alignment and grading for roads in coordination with engineering plans and specifications. Establish control points, benchmarks, and reference markers to guide construction activities. Measure and record quantities of materials required for road construction, such as asphalt, gravel, and concrete. Monitor construction progress to ensure compliance with approved plans and specifications. Conduct quality control checks on construction materials and workmanship. Maintain accurate records of survey data, construction progress, and any deviations from original plans. Preferred candidate profile  -   Bachelor's degree in surveying, civil engineering, or related field. Proven experience in land surveying, particularly in road construction projects. Proficiency in using surveying equipment and software for data collection and analysis. Strong knowledge of surveying techniques, principles, and practices. Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills. Attention to detail and accuracy in survey measurements and data interpretation. Effective communication and teamwork skills. Perks and benefits  -  Best in the industry  .

column2: An IT Recruiter is responsible for sourcing, attracting, and hiring top-quality IT talent for an organization. The primary responsibilities of this role include:      Sourcing and identifying potential candidates: The IT Recruiter is responsible for sourcing and identifying potential candidates through various channels such as job boards, professional networks, and employee referrals.      Screening and interviewing candidates: The IT Recruiter will screen and interview candidates to assess their technical abilities, work experience, and overall fit for the organization.      Building and maintaining a pipeline of qualified candidates: The IT Recruiter will build and maintain a pipeline of qualified candidates for current and future job openings.      Negotiating offers: The IT Recruiter will negotiate offers with successful candidates, ensuring that compensation and benefits packages are competitive and in line with industry standards.      Onboarding and integration: The IT Recruiter will support the onboarding and integration process for new hires, ensuring that they have a smooth transition into their new role and organization.      Reporting and data analysis: The IT Recruiter will collect and analyze data on recruiting metrics and provide regular reports to management on their findings.      The ideal candidate for this role should have strong interpersonal and communication skills, as well as experience in IT recruitment.      They should have a good understanding of various technical roles and technologies, and be able to quickly assess the technical abilities of potential candidates.      Experience in IT recruitment, sourcing, and talent acquisition.      Familiarity with various applicant tracking systems (ATS) and candidate sourcing tools is also desirable."
column11: Data analysis, Talent acquisition, Transition, Packaging, Management, IT recruitment, Recruitment

column2: The successful applicant will need to have a sound and relevant educational grounding and ideally have at least a few years of commercial construction experience as a QS or Estimator, or ideally, as both.     ?     You will need to be experienced with working on relevant projects, such as, commercial or residential refurbishment or fit-out. The candidate should be experienced with estimation, tendering, contracts, projects, coordination and material procurement. They must be be well versed with Construction Project Management Software like Microsoft Project or Costing.     The main role of a Quantity Surveyor is to provide commercial support to senior surveying staff on one or a number of projects to ensure that projects are procured, delivered within budget and to the highest quality whilst exceeding our customers expectations.      You will be responsible for the delivery of the project to meet its financial targets. You need to demonstrate good working knowledge of contract conditions, procurement of packages, demonstrate the management of project risks and ability to foster productive relationships and can thrive in a fast paced environment.     You will be accurately valuing, certifying and issuing any relevant payment notices for the subcontract works in accordance with the conditions of their subcontract.      Ensure that external valuations are submitted in accordance with conditions of the main contract and that payments are received by the due date. Complete CVC reports, ensuring they accurately reflect the current position on site and the final profit projection.           Responsibilities       Reviewing construction plans and preparing quantity requirements.         Scrutinizing maintenance and material costs, as well as contracts to ensure the best deals.         Liaising with site managers, clients, contractors, and subcontractors.         Preparing reports, analyses, contracts, budgets, risk assessment, and other documents.         Advising managers and clients on improvements and new strategies.         Keeping track of materials and ordering more when required.         Documenting any changes in design and updating budgets.         Establishing and maintaining professional relationships with external and internal stakeholders.         Traveling from the office to various sites as required.         Qualifications       Bachelors degree in Quantity Surveying, Engineering, Management, or similar.         Construction estimating or finance experienced is advantageous.         Strong analytical and critical thinking skills.         Sound knowledge of construction.         Excellent negotiating and interpersonal skills.         Ability to organize, plan, and strategize.         A valid drivers license.         Great networking abilities.

column2: We are seeking a talented Contracts Head with expertise in residential construction projects to lead our contract management efforts. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in negotiating and managing contracts related to residential development, ensuring compliance with legal requirements and project specifications. They will play a crucial role in maximizing project efficiency, minimizing risks, and fostering positive relationships with clients, contractors, and other stakeholders. Responsibilities: Develop and implement contract management strategies tailored to residential construction projects, including drafting, reviewing, and negotiating contracts with clients, subcontractors, suppliers, and other third parties. Collaborate with project managers, architects, engineers, and legal counsel to ensure that contract terms align with project objectives, budgetary constraints, and regulatory requirements. Conduct comprehensive risk assessments for each project, identifying potential liabilities, contingencies, and risk mitigation measures to safeguard the organization's interests. Monitor contract performance throughout the project lifecycle, tracking milestones, deliverables, and payments to ensure compliance with contractual obligations. Proactively identify and address contractual issues, disputes, and change orders, working closely with internal and external stakeholders to achieve timely resolutions. Develop and maintain contract management procedures, templates, and documentation, ensuring consistency, accuracy, and compliance with organizational policies and industry standards. Stay abreast of relevant laws, regulations, and industry trends affecting residential construction contracts, providing guidance and recommendations to internal teams as needed. Foster positive relationships with clients, subcontractors, and suppliers through effective communication, conflict resolution, and adherence to ethical business practices. Provide training and support to project teams and other departments on contract-related matters, promoting a culture of contract compliance and risk management. Collaborate with finance and accounting teams to ensure accurate billing, invoicing, and cost tracking for contracted services and materials.

column2: We are seeking a skilled and detail-oriented Estimator to join our construction team. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in construction estimating, with expertise in analyzing project requirements, developing cost estimates, and ensuring accuracy throughout the bidding process. As an Estimator, you will play a crucial role in helping our company secure profitable projects and deliver exceptional construction services to our clients.                                             ?                   Key Responsibilities:                                 Analyze project blueprints, specifications, and other documentation to understand project requirements and scope.                             Conduct thorough material takeoffs and quantity surveys to determine the materials, labor, and equipment needed for each project phase.                             Collaborate with project managers, engineers, subcontractors, and suppliers to gather accurate cost data and pricing information.                             Prepare detailed and accurate cost estimates, including labor, materials, equipment, subcontractor bids, permits, and overhead costs.                             Utilize estimating software and tools to develop comprehensive cost breakdowns, pricing schedules, and bid proposals.                             Review and evaluate subcontractor and vendor bids to ensure competitiveness and adherence to project specifications.                             Coordinate with project teams to clarify project requirements, resolve discrepancies, and refine cost estimates as needed.                             Present and defend cost estimates during internal review meetings and client presentations.                             Assist in negotiating and finalizing contracts with clients, subcontractors, and suppliers.                             Monitor project budgets, expenses, and changes to ensure cost control and profitability.                             Track industry trends, market prices, and cost factors to inform future estimating practices and strategies.                             Maintain accurate records of estimating data, project documentation, and bid correspondence.                             Collaborate with the procurement team to source and qualify new suppliers and subcontractors.                             Participate in pre-construction meetings, site visits, and project planning sessions as required. column2: Site engineers may require the following skills to perform their tasks effectively: Technical skills:  It is important for site engineers to have the necessary technical knowledge to work with designs, drawings and models and identify and find solutions for engineering problems. Project management skills:  They require project management skills to evaluate, allocate and oversee work tasks in a project and ensure compliance with relevant standards, regulations and laws. Communication skills:  Effective verbal and written communication skills are essential for site engineers to interact with clients, vendors, suppliers, other engineers, site supervisors and workers. Organisation skills:  Site engineers monitor and evaluate work progress, ensure compliance with project plans and design documents, organise project information and allocate construction resources. Budgeting skills:  They have to estimate the costs of materials and labour and use resources carefully. Leadership skills:  Since the site engineer is in charge of the project and responsible for its outcome, they ought to be decisive, confident and approachable, and able to lead and motivate those working under them. Collaboration skills:  Construction work involves teamwork, and site engineers collaborate with crew members and organise work duties to improve work efficiency. Problem-solving   skills:  Various unforeseen problems can arise at construction sites, and site engineers solve these quickly and effectively. Attention to detail:  To ensure that the construction work proceeds without problems, site engineers pay attention to detail and take stock of even the most minute things. Time-management skills:  Most construction projects have timelines for completion, and site engineers ensure that the project work progresses according to schedule. onsibilities
column11: Project Management, Communication Skills, Technical, Budgeting Skills, Collaboration, Problem Management, Organization Skills, Leadership Skills

column2: Runwal Group is looking for Supervisor - Finishing to join our dynamic team and embark on a rewarding career journey             Team Supervision    : The Supervisor manages and directs the Finishing department team, which may include technicians, inspectors, and operators. They assign tasks, provide guidance, and ensure that work is completed efficiently and according to schedule.            Quality Control    : They oversee quality control measures in the Finishing department to ensure that products meet established quality standards and specifications. This includes conducting inspections, reviewing product samples, and addressing any defects or deviations from quality requirements.            Process Monitoring    : The Supervisor monitors finishing processes and equipment to ensure they are operating effectively and efficiently. They troubleshoot issues, identify opportunities for process improvement, and implement corrective actions as needed.            Inventory Management    : They manage inventory levels of finishing materials, supplies, and components needed for production. They coordinate with procurement and logistics teams to ensure timely delivery of materials and prevent shortages or overstock situations.            Equipment Maintenance    : The Supervisor ensures that finishing equipment and machinery are properly maintained and serviced. They schedule routine maintenance tasks, coordinate repairs, and ensure that equipment downtime is minimized to maintain production efficiency.            Safety Compliance    : They enforce safety protocols and regulations within the Finishing department to maintain a safe work environment for employees. They conduct safety training, perform safety inspections, and address any safety concerns or hazards promptly.            Training and Development    : The Supervisor provides training to new employees and ongoing training and development opportunities to existing team members. They ensure that employees are knowledgeable about finishing processes, quality standards, and safety procedures.            Production Planning and Scheduling      : They collaborate with production planners and scheduling teams to coordinate finishing activities and ensure that production targets are met. They prioritize tasks, allocate resources, and adjust schedules as needed to meet changing production demands.

column2: Job Description As a Supervisor for Machine Installation and Start-up in a Process Plant in India, you will play a vital role in overseeing the installation, testing, and commissioning of machinery and equipment within the plant environment. You will lead a team of technicians, ensuring that installations adhere to local regulations, safety standards, and cultural norms while aligning with project timelines and objectives. Responsibilities: Supervise and coordinate the installation, assembly, and alignment of machinery and equipment in compliance with Indian regulatory requirements and industry standards Lead a diverse team of technicians, fostering a collaborative and inclusive work environment while providing necessary training and support. Collaborate with local engineers and stakeholders to review installation plans, ensuring alignment with local regulations, standards, and cultural practices. Conduct thorough pre-commissioning checks and inspections, ensuring compliance with Indian regulatory bodies such as the Bureau of Indian Standards (BIS) and the Directorate General of Factory Advice Service and Labour Institutes (DGFASLI). Plan and oversee the start-up and commissioning process, considering factors such as voltage fluctuations, power supply reliability, and environmental conditions typical in the Indian context. Develop and maintain comprehensive documentation in English and any local languages as necessary, including installation procedures, equipment manuals, and safety protocols. Ensure strict adherence to health, safety, and environmental regulations, incorporating best practices to mitigate risks and promote a culture of safety among the team Monitor installation progress closely, addressing any challenges or delays promptly, and implementing strategies to keep installations on schedule and within budget. Maintain effective communication channels with project managers, stakeholders, and vendors, providing regular updates on progress and addressing any concerns or issues as they arise. Collaborate with local suppliers and vendors to procure materials, tools, and equipment, considering factors such as lead times, quality standards, and cost-effectiveness.   Qualifications Bachelor's degree in Mechanical Engineering, Electrical Engineering, or a related field. Additional certifications or training in project management and Indian regulatory compliance are desirable Minimum 5 years of experience in supervising machine installations in India, preferably within the manufacturing or process industry. Strong understanding of Indian regulatory requirements, including familiarity with BIS standards, DGFASLI regulations, and other relevant guidelines Excellent leadership and communication skills, with the ability to effectively manage a diverse team and communicate with stakeholders at all levels. Proficiency in English and any local languages spoken in the region where the plant is located Commitment to promoting a culture of safety and compliance with local regulations and industry standards. Strong problem-solving abilities, with a proactive approach to addressing challenges and implementing practical solutions Ability to adapt to cultural differences and work effectively in a diverse, multicultural environment. Strong organizational skills and attention to detail, with the ability to manage multiple tasks and priorities effectively. Flexibility to work non-standard hours and travel as required to support installation projects across different regions in India.

column2: Roles and Responsibilities In this role, you will administer physical construction execution operations for the site. The Site supervisor should have good experience in Residential and commercial building construction including civil, finishing, interior, fit-outs, exterior, infrastructure, etc. The Site supervisors should have the ability to read and understand the Architectural-RCC-MEP Drawings. Coordination with contractor, site team, and Seniors to timely completion of site activities, etc. The Site supervisor must have extensive knowledge of RCC (Reinforcement Concrete) structure execution and its sequences, which should be checked and supervised accordingly. The Site supervisor Should have the ability to execute and check step-by-step Civil and finishing sequences and quality of work such as checking of various superstructure membranes shuttering work, Columns/Beam/Slab/etc. Membranes concreting work line-level-plumb etc., Overall Finishing work quality checking as per thumb rules. Ensure that the assigned work is completed as per the schedule by coordinating amongst the team members, contractors, and consultants. The site supervisor should have knowledge of taking measurements of various civil and finishing work activities, Contractor Bill checking, and measurement verification. Maintain all the desired records at the site like inventory management, RIF register, drawing register, non-compliance register, etc. Identify slippages/delays and initiate corrective action. Knowledge of construction safety and its precautions. Organizing materials and ensuring sites are safe and clean. Providing technical advice and suggestions for improvement on particular projects. Completing quality assurance and providing feedback to the team. Ensure minimum Wastage during civil and finishing work executions on site. Management of Day-to-day operation of various construction activities at the site and Daily report to the Project Head at the Head office. Above is the scope of work but not limited to your post, even then any other work assigned by the Head of the Department will come under the Site supervisor and he has to do it responsibly. Preferably having good knowledge of computer operation and practice in Software MS Office includes Word-Excel-Power point, Internet, etc.  Desired Candidate Profile Experienced Supervisors having good experience in Residential and Commercial building construction including civil, finishing, interior, fit-outs, exterior, infrastructure, etc. Job Benefits & Perks

Ensure compliance with program constraints and budget; and maintain Quality Procedure Manual. Other duties and responsibilities as reasonably required by the Team Leader/Division Manager.     ?Job Responsibility: As a result of the continuing growth of our Design and Engineering business, our Civil and Structural Engineering team in Bangalore, Chennai and Mumbai are seeking to recruit an experienced Principal Structural Engineer. This new appointment is part of our aspiration to develop and grow our structural team in India. This role will allow the right candidate to play a leading role in some of the most challenging and exciting engineering projects in the world. The successful candidate will have a proven track record in the management and production of engineering / technical deliverables on a range of multi-disciplinary projects of varying scales and levels of complexity. You will be responsible for overall Civil and Structural Engineering technical delivery within the Bangalore, Chennai and Mumbai Offices, providing all necessary technical direction, resourcing, mentoring and assurance of structural engineering within Bangalore, Chennai and Mumbai offices.      Credibility, competence, agility and technical excellence are a given as the role requires close working with our internal and external clients, decision makers, industry stakeholders and other consultants to develop robust design solutions through collaborative and proactive management of client demands - providing leadership from both a technical delivery and people management perspective is imperative. You will be a Structural Engineer with a proven track record of successful technical and commercial delivery of design projects from feasibility through to completion of construction/handover. You will be required to demonstrate a developed understanding of the market and industry and ability to focus our business to take full advantage of market conditions and have experience in assisting with the preparation of bids and tendering opportunities, where required. Our offices provides multi-disciplinary design and engineering services and integrated solutions across a wide range of sectors. This appointment offers a challenging and rewarding opportunity to apply knowledge, experience and problem solving skills to assist with leading and developing our business, from a technical perspective.     ?Desired Profile: --Candidate must possess at least a Bachelors Degree, Post Graduate Diploma, Professional Degree, Masters Degree, Engineering (Civil) or equivalent. --At least 5 years of working experience in the related field is required for this position.      --Preferably Senior Executives specializing in Engineering - Civil/Construction/Structural or equivalent.

column2: Skills           MS office             Autocad             Leadership                     1. Quality Control: Conducting quality inspections of finished products or structures to ensure they meet established standards and specifications. This includes checking for defects, verifying measurements, and assessing the overall appearance.           2. Project Coordination: Collaborating with project managers, architects, engineers, and other stakeholders to coordinate the finishing phase of construction or manufacturing projects. This involves creating work schedules, coordinating resources, and ensuring timely completion.           3. Material Selection: Recommending appropriate finishing materials, such as paints, coatings, flooring, and fixtures, based on project requirements, budget constraints, and aesthetic considerations. Ensuring that the chosen materials meet quality standards and are compatible with the project specifications.           4. Supervision: Managing and supervising a team of workers involved in the finishing phase. This includes assigning tasks, providing guidance, monitoring progress, and ensuring compliance with safety regulations and project guidelines.           5. Troubleshooting: Identifying and resolving any issues or challenges that arise during the finishing phase. This may involve addressing defects, coordinating rework, or implementing corrective measures to achieve the desired quality standards.           6. Documentation: Maintaining accurate records and documentation related to the finishing phase, such as inspection reports, quality control records, and material specifications. Ensuring compliance with legal and regulatory requirements.           7. Communication: Regularly communicating with project stakeholders, including clients, contractors, and suppliers, to provide progress updates, address concerns, and manage expectations. Actively participating in meetings and discussions related to the projects finishing phase.           8. Continuous Improvement: Identifying opportunities for process improvements, cost-saving measures, or enhanced efficiency in the finishing phase. Implementing best practices, new technologies, or innovative techniques to optimize the quality and productivity of the finishing processes.           9. Health and Safety: Ensuring a safe working environment for the finishing team by adhering to health and safety guidelines, promoting the use of personal protective equipment, and addressing potential hazards or risks in the workplace.           10. Budget Management: Monitoring and managing the budget allocated for the finishing phase. Tracking expenses, controlling costs, and making recommendations to optimize resource utilization without compromising quality.           Qualification : BE Civil, or any equivalent degree.     ?

column2: A surveyor in a classification society plays a crucial role in ensuring the safety, compliance, and quality of ships and marine structures. The main responsibilities are aimed at verifying that vessels meet international and classification society standards.         ?             Key Accountabilities               Technical Expertise:         Provide expert technical advice to clients, shipowners, and manufacturers on matters related to classification, design, construction, and maintenance.     Stay abreast of the latest industry technologies, innovations, and advancements to ensure the application of cutting-edge knowledge in surveys.             Regulatory Compliance:         Ensure strict adherence to classification society rules, international regulations, and statutory requirements during surveys and inspections.     Collaborate with regulatory bodies to interpret and apply new regulations as they arise.             Problem-Solving:         Act as a troubleshooter, addressing technical issues and challenges that may arise during surveys or in the course of client interactions.     Provide practical and effective solutions to clients while maintaining compliance with classification standards.             Quality Assurance:         Implement quality assurance measures in survey processes to uphold the highest standards of accuracy and reliability in inspection reports.     Participate in internal quality audits and contribute to the continuous improvement of surveying procedures.             Client Education:         Educate clients on classification society processes, rules, and the importance of compliance for safety and operational efficiency.             Documentation and Reporting:         Develop and maintain standardized templates for inspection reports, ensuring consistency and clarity in reporting.     Integrate digital tools for efficient documentation management and reporting.             Collaboration and Teamwork:         Collaborate with colleagues, both within the classification society and externally, to share knowledge, experiences, and best practices.     Actively participate in team meetings and contribute to a collaborative work environment.             Continuous Professional Development:         Engage in ongoing professional development to stay current with evolving industry standards, technologies, and best practices.     Pursue relevant certifications or qualifications to enhance expertise.             Ethical Conduct:         Uphold the highest ethical standards in all professional interactions, ensuring integrity, transparency, and fairness in survey processes.                   Education         Master s Degree in Naval Engineering           Qualifications         Minimum 3 years experience working as a Junior Surveyor or minimum 5 years experience in the engineering or survey fields within the marine industry or other applicable industry to their specialization.     Proficiency in the English language commensurate with the scope of classification, statutory certification, related services and, before assignment, with their future work.     Ability to develop a working knowledge of RINA Rules, Guides, statutory regulations, and related instructions, as well as the RINA Employee Safety Policy.     Ability to understand engineering plans and have a basic knowledge of shipbuilding practices and ship operations.       Ability to perform new building surveys:       to assess the suitability of certified materials and products supplied for the new building,to assess that hull, machinery and equipment have been built in compliance with rules and regulations by means of compulsory inspections, tests and trials,to identify the deficiencies to be rectified (if any) and assess whether immediate repair is necessary or a recommendation may be issued with an appropriate due date,to issue Certificates, Reports, Records and Status in compliance with rules and regulations.       Ability to perform ship in service surveys:       to assess that hull, machinery and equipment have been maintained in compliance with rules and regulations by means of compulsory overall inspections, tests and trials,     to identify the deficiencies to be rectified (if any) and assess whether immediate repair is necessary or a recommendation may be issued with an appropriate due date,     to follow-up as required by rules and regulations any repair work or due     to previous outstanding recommendations,     to assess whether the deficiencies identified (if any) may be linked with potential failure of the Ship Management System,     to endorse Certificates, issue Reports and Status in compliance with rules and regulations.     Knowledge of ships engineering systems and machinery.     Knowledge of computer programs or software packages related to job responsibilities.     Knowledge of related technical interfaces required for group project work.     Candidates with Chief Engineer experience and previous Auditor experience in ISM, ISPS, MLC will be preferred.         Competencies         MAKE EFFECTIVE DECISIONS - Structure activities according to priorities, actions, resources and constraint     ADDRESS THE WAY - Have a big picture of different situations and reinterpret it in a perspective way     MANAGE EMOTIONS - Recognise ones and others emotions and express and regulate ones reactions     CLIENT INTIMACY - Embrace internal and external client needs, expectations, and requirements to ensure maximum satisfaction     EARN TRUST - Take everyones opinion into account and remain open to diversity     PROMOTE SUSTAINABLE DEVELOPMENT - Promote commitment by keeping promises as a Role Model     THINK FORWARD - Capitalise on experiences and translate them into action plans for the future     PIONEER CHANGE - Actively embrace change and benefit from the new circumstances     BUILD NETWORK - Forge trust relationships, across departments, and outside the organization                 At RINA, we endeavor to create a work environment where every single person is valued and encouraged to develop new ideas. We provide equal employment opportunities and are committed to creating a workplace where everyone feels respected and safe from discrimination or harassment of any kind. We are also compliant to the Italian Law n. 68/99.

column2: Job Description:  We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced Site Engineer to join our real estate development team. The Site Engineer will be responsible for overseeing layout development and plot development projects, ensuring adherence to design specifications, quality standards, and regulatory requirements. Responsibilities: Coordinate and manage layout development and plot development projects from inception to completion, including site planning, design, construction, and handover. Collaborate with architects, designers, surveyors, and other stakeholders to develop site layouts, plot plans, and infrastructure designs that meet project requirements and regulatory standards. Conduct site surveys and assessments to evaluate site conditions, topography, soil quality, and other factors influencing layout and plot development. Prepare and review engineering drawings, blueprints, and technical specifications for layout design, infrastructure development, and utility installations. Supervise construction activities on-site, including earthwork, grading, road construction, drainage systems, water supply, sewerage, and electrical installations, ensuring compliance with design specifications, safety regulations, and quality standards. Monitor project progress, schedule adherence, and budgetary compliance, identifying and addressing any issues or delays to ensure timely completion of projects. Perform quality control inspections and tests to verify workmanship, materials, and compliance with engineering standards and specifications. Manage subcontractors, vendors, and suppliers involved in layout and plot development projects, ensuring effective coordination and communication to meet project goals and deadlines. Liaise with local authorities, regulatory agencies, and utility providers to obtain necessary permits, approvals, and clearances for layout development and plot development projects. Provide technical expertise and support to project teams, consultants, and stakeholders, resolving technical issues and providing recommendations for design improvements or cost-saving measures. Requirements: Bachelor's degree in Civil Engineering, Construction Management, or related field; professional engineering license or certification is a plus. 3+ years of experience in site engineering, land development, or civil construction, with specific experience in layout development and plot development projects. Proficiency in AutoCAD, Civil 3D, GIS software, and other engineering design tools. Strong knowledge of civil engineering principles, practices, and construction techniques related to site development, grading, drainage, and infrastructure design. Familiarity with regulatory requirements, building codes, zoning ordinances, and environmental regulations governing real estate development projects. Excellent project management skills, with the ability to prioritize tasks, manage resources, and meet project deadlines. Effective communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to collaborate with multidisciplinary teams and stakeholders. Problem-solving mindset with attention to detail and a commitment to delivering high-quality work. Ability to work independently with minimal supervision and adapt to changing project requirements and priorities. Valid driver's license and willingness to travel to project sites as needed. Benefits: Competitive salary commensurate with experience. Comprehensive health, dental, and vision insurance plans. Retirement savings plan with company matching. Paid time off and holidays. Opportunities for professional development and advancement within the company.
column11: Layout Planning, Site Supervision, Site Execution, site engineering, Labour Management, Site Management, civil 3d, Site Monitoring

column2: We are looking to employ a dedicated and experienced site supervisor to oversee construction projects and supervise the construction team. The site supervisor's responsibilities include ordering building supplies, scheduling equipment maintenance as needed, and training new construction employees. You should also be able to perform first aid in emergencies. To be successful as a site supervisor, you should be detail-oriented and knowledgeable of building codes and construction safety regulations. Ultimately, an outstanding site supervisor should be able to interpret building plans as well as demonstrate exceptional leadership, communication, and problem-solving skills. Site Supervisor Responsibilities: Inspecting      construction sites regularly to identify and eliminate potential safety      hazards. Supervising      and instructing the construction team as well as subcontractors. Educating      site workers on construction safety regulations and accident protocol. Enforcing      site safety rules to minimize work-related accidents and injuries. Handling      site accidents in accordance with established accident protocol. Maintaining      an accurate record of construction employee attendance. Evaluating      the performance of construction employees and instituting disciplinary      measures as needed. Analysing      blueprints to ensure that construction projects meet design, safety, and      budget specifications. Recommending      changes to construction operations or procedures to increase efficiency. Site Supervisor Requirements: Bachelor's degree in construction management, construction science, civil engineering, or related field is preferred. Proven experience working as a site supervisor. Sound knowledge of building codes and construction safety regulations. Working knowledge of construction tools and equipment. The ability to interpret blueprints. Outstanding leadership skills. Strong analytical and problem-solving skills. Excellent organizational and communication skills. Salary Bracket: 35  40k. Location: Delhi/ NCR. Experience: 5-8 years. Please share your profile at hr.northfield3006@gmail.com

column2: JOB DESCRIPTION FOR CIVIL SUPERVISOR As a Senior Civil Engineer, your primary responsibility is to oversee and manage the construction and maintenance of civil engineering projects (MEP). You will be responsible for coordinating and supervising a team of workers to ensure that projects are completed safely on time, and within budget. Your role will involve a combination of technical skills and leadership abilities. Responsibilities: 1.  Project Planning:  Communicate with engineers and project managers to develop project plans, including timelines, resource requirements. 2.  Team Management:  Supervise and provide guidance to a team of construction workers, ensuring that they are aware of their tasks and responsibilities. Delegate work assignments and monitor progress to ensure adherence to project schedules. 3.  Construction Oversight:  Oversee the construction activities on-site. Conduct regular inspections to identify and address any issues or deviations from plans. 4.  Resource Coordination:  Coordinate the procurement and allocation of resources, such as materials, equipment, and manpower, necessary for the successful execution of projects. Ensure that all required resources are available and utilized efficiently. 5.  Safety Compliance:  Enforce strict adherence to safety protocols and regulations to maintain a safe working environment. 6.  Documentation and Reporting:  Maintain accurate and up-to-date project documentation, including progress reports, daily activity logs. Prepare timely reports on project status, including any challenges or issues encountered. 7.  Client Communication:  Liaise with project holders regarding bill and fund, including engineers, contractors to provide updates on project progress, address concerns, and ensure effective communication throughout the project lifecycle. 8.  Cost Control:  Monitor project expenses, track costs, and identify areas for cost optimization. 9.  Continuous Improvement:  Stay technological advancements in the field of civil engineering. Identify opportunities for process improvement and propose innovative solutions to enhance project efficiency and quality. Requirements: Bachelor's degree in any stream (Science preferred). Should have minimum 3 years exp. in civil supervision. At least complete one Govt. project (Preferred work in JJM). Proven experience as a Civil Supervisor or a similar role in the Govt. Infrastructures. Strong knowledge of civil construction & MEP. Excellent leadership and team management skills. Proficient in Computer knowledge. Sound understanding of Govt. liaise. Effective communication and interpersonal skills. Strong problem-solving and decision-making abilities. Ability to work under pressure and meet project deadlines. Attention to detail and a commitment to delivering the project on time.
column11: civil supervision, Civil Construction, Civil Engineering

We are currently seeking a dedicated On-Site Engineer to join our team and ensure the successful execution of our projects. Job Title: On-Site Engineer Location:  Surat, Vadodara, Ahmedabad Qualifications: Diploma in Civil/Electrical Engineering or related field. 0-3 Years work Experience (Freshers may apply) Responsibilities: Work Progress Management: Oversee and ensure that construction work progresses according to strict deadlines and project timelines. Team Management: Manage and supervise blue-collar workers on-site, providing guidance, instruction, and support as needed. Efficiency and Performance Monitoring: Monitor the performance and efficiency of on-site teams, identifying areas for improvement and implementing corrective measures as necessary. Implement best practices and procedures to enhance productivity and ensure quality outcomes. Benefits: Competitive salary and benefits package. Opportunities for career growth and advancement within the company. Exposure to innovative and sustainable construction practices. Collaborative and supportive work environment. column2: Below are the role and responsibility for Estimation Manager  Estimation Management: Lead the estimation team in preparing accurate and detailed cost estimates for construction projects, encompassing materials, labor, equipment and overhead costs. Analyze project specifications, architectural drawings and other relevant documents to create comprehensive and competitive estimates. Collaborate with architects, engineers and project managers to ensure accurate estimation aligned with project requirements. Cost Control and Analysis: Monitor project costs throughout the construction phase, comparing actual expenditures against estimated costs. Identify cost-saving opportunities and potential areas of overruns and collaborate with project teams to implement corrective actions. Prepare regular cost analysis reports for management review, highlighting trends, variances and cost forecasts. Change Order Management: Evaluate and process change orders, modifications and variations to contracts, ensuring proper documentation and alignment with project objectives. Collaborate with project teams to assess the impact of changes on project timelines, costs and deliverables. Risk Mitigation: Identify and assess potential risks associated with estimation accuracy, contract terms and cost control. Develop strategies to mitigate risks and ensure that projects are executed within budgetary and contractual boundaries. ERP: Update all required data on ERP (HiRise). Get required approvals through ERP. Stakeholder Communication: Communicate effectively with other department, vendors, subcontractors and clients to address estimation and contract-related matters. Provide timely updates on cost projections, contract negotiations and project financial performance.   Experience in Estimation ,Budgeting, Billing and Invoicing etc. in reputed real estate company.  Interested Candidate can send   CV on sonali.v@tejraj.in

column2: Job Description:  We are seeking a highly experienced Senior Site Engineer to join our team. The ideal candidate will have 5-6 years of experience in site engineering, construction management, and project coordination. The Senior Site Engineer will be responsible for overseeing all aspects of construction activities on-site, ensuring compliance with project plans, specifications, and safety regulations. Responsibilities: Manage and supervise all on-site construction activities, including scheduling, resource allocation, and quality control. Coordinate with project managers, architects, subcontractors, and suppliers to ensure timely and efficient completion of projects. Interpret engineering drawings, plans, and specifications to ensure accuracy and adherence to project requirements. Conduct regular inspections and quality assurance checks to verify workmanship, materials, and compliance with building codes and standards. Monitor and track project progress, milestones, and budget expenditures, reporting any deviations or issues to the project team. Manage subcontractor and vendor relationships, including procurement, contract negotiation, and performance evaluation. Implement and enforce safety policies and procedures to maintain a safe work environment for all personnel on-site. Provide technical guidance and support to junior engineers, foremen, and construction crews as needed. Prepare and maintain accurate documentation, reports, and records related to construction activities, including daily progress reports, site diaries, and as-built drawings. Participate in project meetings, progress reviews, and client presentations as required.

column2: We have an urgent opening for Site Engineer for a leading Construction company project based out in Mumbai.   Qualification: Bachelor in Civil Engineering. / Technical Office Concerns and Quantity Survey Techniques. Experience: - Extensive familiarity on Technical Civil / Structural and Quantity Surveying Works. 4 + years of Construction Quality Experience.   Minimum Experience 4 years. Role Purpose Perform quantity surveying activities, ensuring all aspects of operation and associated processes are in compliance with project specifications and completed within planned time. Prepare quantity survey works with proper coordination with All Disciplines and prepare the Client / Sub-Contractors Invoices. Prepare processed work, determining the needed quantities and prepare required reports as per Report Frequency List. Conduct Quantity Surveying Process According to the technical standards Prepare and review Client Invoice, Sub- Contractor Invoice, Variation Orders and Cost Control. Prepare cost and expenditures statements and other necessary documentation at regular intervals for duration of the project. Communicate with Architects, Engineers, Client/s, Consultant/s and Sub- Contractors to changes and adjustments of quantities According to business needs. Maintain the scope of work, procedures and schedules are adhered to achieve project objectives with alignment with the client needs and KCC abilities. Internal Architectural, Civil/ Structural and Electro- Mechanical Disciplines Continuous coordination by discussing charts in the presence of All Disciplines. External Consultant, Project Manager/s and Technical Office Manager: Constant discussion in all the quantity survey, client invoice and sub - contractor invoice submitted for adoption. Adoption of amendments or parts that have been redesigned the project and as per Client required that may effects on the quantities. Personnel Skills Ability to persuade others about Company Policy, Objectives and Project Control aspects. Communication Skills and Teamwork. Familiar with all the Civil / Structural Engineering Methodologies as well as the corresponding equipment, materials, consumables, tools and manpower allocations related to Civil / Structural and Quantity Survey Scope of Works for building projects. Mastering AUTOCAD. Other related software in Civil / Structural and Quantity Survey Works. MS Office, Working knowledge of the fundamental requirements of Civil / Structural Engineering and the Basic Requirements of other Engineering fields.

column2: We are looking for an experienced Site Lead that will be a key part of the Projects (Ground Mount) team. The ideal candidate has demonstrated effective leadership and people management performance in a fast moving and ever challenging environment. Knowledge and experience of solar focused Construction Management is imperative.      This includes responsibility for project managing the design and installation of solar facilities supporting both existing facilities and any new sites. This role will analyze and evaluate different site scenarios and build-out designs with an emphasis on the introduction, construction and operation of solar systems. In addition, this candidate has to support the standardization of the technical and facility related processes and systems required to operate and maintain installed solar systems.     This opportunity combines personnel management, organizational leadership, construction engineering, planning, project management, facilities management, and contract management. The opportunity will require the candidiate to travel to various sites across UP, and outside of UP if required in Future.       Lead, motivate, and manage team         Develop and manage metrics quantifying performance         Provide positive, clear, concise, and transparent cross team communication for all aspects of project delivery         Oversee engineering review process and lead construction scope review and development with internal operational customers on new and retrofit projects         Support utility interconnection application process and applicable permit/ approvals.         Oversee and facilitate execution of solar installations involving both existing and new sites within the network         Enforce contracts and uphold design standards with solar developers, contractors and present formal documentation for approval when required         Coach and guide all project teams (developers, design engineers, general contractors, sub-contractors, internal stakeholders) throughout the full project lifecycle         Establish and operate the information systems necessary for effective scheduling and recording of contract work         Review of designs for conformance to current specifications and standards         Perform comprehensive budget tracking, forecasting, and management of assigned solar projects         Conduct receipt, review, and analysis of all proposed cost and time change requests as presented by external project teams         Review and guide internally requested changes for validity, impact, and ensure timely and cost sensitive incorporation once approved         Lead and/or assist in negotiations with appropriate entities as required                 B.E/Tech (Civil/Mechanical/Electrical)         Experience as an Engineer, Senior Construction Manager, and other construction related disciplines         Experience as a Project Manager, or equivalent, in the solar industry         Project management experience from due diligence and design phase through implementation and operation         Experience negotiating solar construction and development contracts             More diverse career path responsibility set         Working directly with and learning from senior team and company founders         Managing clients and running projects independently         Greater flexibility in defining own role and pursuing new opportunities         Learning entirely on the job

column2: We are seeking an experienced and capable Civil Foreman/Supervisor to oversee and manage civil construction projects      The ideal candidate should have 10-15 years of relevant experience in the construction industry, with a proven track record of successfully leading teams and delivering projects on time and within budget      As a Civil Foreman/Supervisor, you will play a pivotal role in ensuring the efficient and safe execution of construction activities            Responsibilities:      Project Planning and Coordination:        Collaborate with project managers and stakeholders to understand project scope, objectives, and timelines.      Assist in creating detailed work schedules and resource allocation plans.      Coordinate with other teams, subcontractors, and suppliers to ensure smooth project execution.        Team Management and Leadership:        Supervise and lead a team of construction workers and subcontractors.      Assign tasks and responsibilities to team members, providing clear instructions and guidance.      Ensure that the team maintains high levels of productivity and work quality.        Construction Execution:        Oversee the implementation of civil construction activities as per approved plans and specifications.      Monitor progress and ensure that work is carried out efficiently and in compliance with safety standards.      Address any issues or challenges that arise during the construction process.        Quality Control and Safety:        Implement and enforce quality control measures to ensure work meets the required standards.      Promote and maintain a safe working environment, adhering to all safety regulations and practices.      Conduct regular safety inspections and address safety concerns promptly.        Material and Equipment Management:        Coordinate with procurement teams to ensure timely availability of construction materials and equipment.      Manage inventory and oversee the proper utilization of resources to minimize wastage.        Documentation and Reporting:        Maintain accurate and up-to-date records of work progress, labor, and material usage.      Prepare regular progress reports and communicate project status to higher management.        Problem Solving and Decision Making:        Identify and resolve construction-related issues in a timely and effective manner.      Make informed decisions to keep the project on track and within budget.        Requirements:        Proven experience as a Civil Foreman/Supervisor in the construction industry (10-15 years).      Strong knowledge of civil construction practices, techniques, and materials.      Ability to read and interpret construction plans and drawings.      Excellent leadership and communication skills.      Demonstrated ability to manage and motivate a diverse workforce.      Understanding of safety regulations and procedures.      Diploma or degree in Civil Engineering or a related field preferred.

column2: Safety first - Going home safe and well:                    You will be an advocate of Mace's value of Safety First, and be accountable for leading and maintaining exceptional safety, quality, cost, programme, sustainability and project compliance standards.                  You will possess knowledge of local Health and Safety rules and regulations relevant to project portfolio.                You will promote a diverse and inclusive working environment, and understand the importance of the wellbeing of the people you manage.                  Client focus - Deliver on our promise:                    You will work as part of the Construction Delivery Team, taking direction from the Project senior leadership team and other Construction Managers.                  You will build relationships with stakeholders, both internally and externally.                You will build a strong working relationship with your clients, and support the construction lead in turning the client s vision into a deliverable onsite plan.                  Integrity - Always do the right thing:                    You will assist in the control and coordination of specific areas or packages, and ensuring they meet quality and safe working standards.                  You will support the Construction Delivery Team in influencing the long term development of strategy for a function or Business Unit (BU), creating a sustainable business future.                  You will commit to making a positive impact for our people, our clients, and our planet, and take ownership for holding others to account who do not uphold the Mace values.                    Create opportunity for our people to excel:                    You will support other Managers and junior members of your project team and provide an environment to share knowledge and experience.                  You will actively network, innovate, and seek understanding of best practice, utilising the full depth of knowledge of Mace Group, the Centres of Excellence, Mace Way Control Centre and Knowledge Hub.                You will provide support to Delivery Teams, creating a culture of ownership, promoting roles and responsibilities.                  You ll need to have:                    Bachelor's degree in civil with master's from NICMAR/RICS.               Experience of leading a project of a similar nature.                 You ll also have:                   Working towards membership of MCIOB / MAPM / MRICS / MICE or equivalent demonstrable professional or personal development.                  Experience in the successful delivery phase of projects and programmes in the construction sector.                  Construction management expertise. Experience of building relationships with key stakeholders.                  Knowledge of how carbon and sustainability considerations will shape the outlook of the projects you are working on.
