column2: Site management is responsible of providing complete project execution support through project life cycle globally.      Vanderlande is the global market leader in baggage handling systems for airports, and sorting systems for parcel and postal services. The company is also a leading supplier of warehouse automation solutions. With a consistently increasing order intake of more than 2.8 billion euros, it has established a global reputation over the past six decades as a highly reliable partner for value-added automated material handling solutions.      We are looking for a Site Supervisor for Global projects. You will be part of the team that Lead and Support project execution across the Globe.              Your position:          As a Site Supervisor your role is to lead the site execution work and supervise multiple Site Supervisors (Mechanical/ Electrical) and multiple teams of contractors for mechanical and electrical work. And, in parallel, he will work with the project, procurement, Safety, Engineering, and Field Quality team for better Planning, Site Procurements, Safety Implementation, Engineering changes, and to maintain Vanderlande's standard of execution.          Job Description:          Supervision of the Mechanical, electrical and control installation, guide, and train in Electro-Mechanical installation teams.      Inspect and diagnose complex mechanical/electrical systems      Interpret engineering drawings in reference to layout, location, and operation of the system(s).      Should have hand on experience with AutoCAD, Navis and E. Plan drawing.      Should possess conceptual knowledge of PLC systems (Siemens), different type of hardware s, Communication protocols (Profinet, Ethernet, Profibus, ASI).      Should have knowledge of different types of Switch gears, Drives and RLC circuits.      Should have knowledge of I/O testing.      Support the commissioning, testing and integration of material handling system      Managing the quality inspections for the installed equipment with focus on the electrical installation.      You ensure in close coordination with our engineers that the equipment is installed in accordance with the specification.      Support for the site handover and conduct surveys for installation areas.      Aware of our contract and responsibilities and identify deviations.      Reporting progress to the site manager and project manager.      Join progress meetings      Responsible for the electrical and control installation progress on site and ensure to meet the program milestones      Responsible for the site safety and quality of the installed electrical and control equipment      Responsible for daily, weekly, and monthly installation reports and toolbox talk with supervisor team.      Cooperate with your project manager in the establishment of policies and procedures related to Field Support              Desired profile:          Bachelor's degree in electrical/ Mechanical engineering, mechatronics.      6 to 8 years experience in handling WS/ Parcel or Airport system.      Experience of different type of sorters (Line/Loop Sorters) are preferable.      General PLC programming or troubleshooting certification      Safety certification line IOSH, Emergency preparedness training.          Travel:          Need to Travel 70% or more.          Base Location:          Pune India.          Mandatory Skills:          Leadership and presentation skills including relentless problem solving, results orientation      Should have positive approach, right attitude etc.      Ability to effectively lead and work under pressure,      Ability to work constructively with all stakeholders, building both internal and external relationships.      Proficiency in the application of computerized systems, including standard business applications (i.e., MS Office)      Effective verbal and written communications skills      Negotiation skill and commercial experience to manage contract scope changes directly with clients, suppliers      Demonstrated organizational skills, and company ethics      Strong bias for following processes and continual process improvement

With a consistently increasing order intake of more than 2.8 billion euros, it has established a global reputation over the past six decades as a highly reliable partner for value-added automated material handling solutions.     We are looking for a Site Supervisor/ Site Manager for Global projects. You will be part of the team that Lead and Support project execution across the Globe.             Your position:          As a Site Supervisor your role is to lead the site execution work and supervise multiple Site Supervisors (Mechanical/ Electrical) and multiple teams of contractors for mechanical and electrical work. And, in parallel, he will work with the project, procurement, Safety, Engineering, and Field Quality team for better Planning, Site Procurements, Safety Implementation, Engineering changes, and to maintain Vanderlande's standard of execution.         Job Description:         Supervision of the Mechanical, electrical and control installation, guide, and train in Electro-Mechanical installation teams.     Inspect and diagnose complex mechanical/electrical systems     Interpret engineering drawings in reference to layout, location, and operation of the system(s).     Should have hand on experience with AutoCAD, Navis and E. Plan drawing.     Should possess conceptual knowledge of PLC systems (Siemens), different type of hardware s, Communication protocols (Profinet, Ethernet, Profibus, ASI).     Should have knowledge of different types of Switch gears, Drives and RLC circuits.     Should have knowledge of I/O testing.     Support the commissioning, testing and integration of material handling system     Managing the quality inspections for the installed equipment with focus on the electrical installation.     You ensure in close coordination with our engineers that the equipment is installed in accordance with the specification.     Support for the site handover and conduct surveys for installation areas.     Aware of our contract and responsibilities and identify deviations.     Reporting progress to the site manager and project manager.     Join progress meetings     Responsible for the electrical and control installation progress on site and ensure to meet the program milestones     Responsible for the site safety and quality of the installed electrical and control equipment     Responsible for daily, weekly, and monthly installation reports and toolbox talk with supervisor team.     Cooperate with your project manager in the establishment of policies and procedures related to Field Support             Desired profile:         Bachelor's degree in electrical/ Mechanical engineering, mechatronics.     10 to 11 years experience in handling WS/ Parcel or Airport system.     Experience of different type of sorters (Line/Loop Sorters) are preferable.     General PLC programming or troubleshooting certification.     Safety certification line IOSH, Emergency preparedness training.         Travel:         Need to Travel 70% or more.         Base Location:         Pune India.         Mandatory Skills:         Leadership and presentation skills including relentless problem solving, results orientation     Should have positive approach, right attitude etc.     Ability to effectively lead and work under pressure,     Ability to work constructively with all stakeholders, building both internal and external relationships.     Proficiency in the application of computerized systems, including standard business applications (i.e., MS Office)     Effective verbal and written communications skills     Negotiation skill and commercial experience to manage contract scope changes directly with clients, suppliers.     Demonstrated organizational skills, and company ethics.     Strong bias for following processes and continual process improvement.     Strong sense of time urgency for critical-path project items, milestones, and key project deliverables
column11: Site management, Automation, Mechatronics, AutoCAD, Process improvement, PLC, IOSH, MS Office, Troubleshooting, Material handling

column2: Leadership: Supervisors are responsible for leading and managing a team of employees     They provide direction, guidance, and support to ensure that team members work effectively and efficiently     Team Management: They oversee the day-to-day activities of their team, including task assignment, scheduling, and workload management     They ensure that team members are meeting their goals and deadlines     Training and Development: Supervisors often play a role in training new employees and providing ongoing development opportunities for their team members     This may involve on-the-job training, coaching, or recommending additional training or education     Performance Evaluation: They are typically responsible for evaluating the performance of their team members     This includes conducting regular performance reviews, providing feedback, and addressing performance issues or concerns     Problem Solving: Supervisors are expected to handle and resolve issues or conflicts that arise within the team     They may need to find solutions to operational problems and ensure a smooth workflow

column2: A Site Engineer is responsible for overseeing and managing technical aspects of construction projects.        Key responsibilities include:       1.Planning and organizing construction work     2.Supervising and directing site personnel     3.Ensuring project specifications are met     4.Monitoring progress and ensuring project stays on schedule     5.Coordinating with other engineers, contractors, and sub-contractors     6.Conducting quality control checks and inspecting completed work     7.Maintaining accurate records and documentation     8.Resolving technical problems and providing solutions     9.Communicating with clients and stakeholders to provide updates and address concerns10.Ensuring compliance with health and safety regulations.       Requirements for the role may include:       1.Proven experience as a Site Engineer or similar role     2.Knowledge of construction methods, materials, and regulations     3.Ability to read and interpret blueprints and technical drawings     4.Strong communication, organizational, and leadership skills     5.Good problem-solving abilities and attention to detail     6.Ability to work in a fast-paced environment and handle multiple projects simultaneously     7.Willingness to work on construction sites, sometimes in challenging conditions
column11: Site Engineer

column2: LOHAAR ENGINEERING & CONSTRUCTION PVT. LTD.? is looking for Construction Estimator? to join our dynamic team and embark on a rewarding career journey       Cost Estimation: Analyze project specifications, blueprints, and other construction documents to estimate the costs of labor, materials, equipment, and subcontractor services required for the project      Quantity Takeoffs: Perform quantity takeoffs, which involve quantifying the amount of materials and labor needed for each aspect of the construction project      Pricing and Bidding: Source pricing for materials and subcontractor services, solicit and compare bids, and negotiate with suppliers and subcontractors to secure favorable terms and prices      Cost Database Management: Maintain a database of historical cost data to support accurate estimating and track cost trends over time      Budget Development: Collaborate with project managers and clients to develop project budgets, taking into account various cost elements and contingencies      Value Engineering: Identify cost-saving and value-adding opportunities to optimize the project's financial efficiency      Cost Analysis: Analyze cost breakdowns, identify cost drivers, and assess project risks and uncertainties      Proposal Preparation: Prepare detailed cost proposals and estimates, including comprehensive documentation of assumptions, methodologies, and cost justifications      Change Order Evaluation: Evaluate change orders and modifications to existing construction projects, providing cost assessments and recommendations
column11: Construction, Bidding, Database management, Estimator, Value engineering, Finance, Proposal preparation, Cost estimation, Cost analysis, Cost

column2: We are looking to employ a dedicated and experienced site supervisor to oversee construction projects and supervise the construction team      The site supervisor s responsibilities include ordering building supplies, scheduling equipment maintenance as needed, and training new construction employees      You should also be able to perform first aid in emergencies      To be successful as a site supervisor, you should be detail-oriented and knowledgeable of building codes and construction safety regulations      Ultimately, an outstanding site supervisor should be able to interpret building plans as well as demonstrate exceptional leadership, communication, and problem-solving skills              Site Supervisor Responsibilities:          Inspecting construction sites regularly to identify and eliminate potential safety hazards.          Supervising and instructing the construction team as well as subcontractors.          Educating site workers on construction safety regulations and accident protocol.          Enforcing site safety rules to minimize work-related accidents and injuries.          Handling site accidents in accordance with established accident protocol.          Maintaining an accurate record of construction employee attendance.    Evaluating the performance of construction employees and instituting disciplinary measures as needed.          Analyzing blueprints to ensure that construction projects meet design, safety, and budget specifications.          Recommending changes to construction operations or procedures to increase efficiency.          Site Supervisor Requirements:          Completion of a post-secondary education construction training program.          A bachelor s degree in construction management, construction science, civil engineering, or related field is preferred.          Proven experience working as a site supervisor.          CPR and first aid certifications.          Sound knowledge of building codes and construction safety regulations.          Working knowledge of construction tools and equipment.          The ability to interpret blueprints.          Outstanding leadership skills.          Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.          Excellent organizational and communication skills.

column2: Job Responsibility of Field Engineer Job Overview Position : Field Engineer Location : Pithampur, MP A Field Engineer will play a crucial role in providing technical support and expertise in the field. He will be responsible for overseeing the installation, maintenance, and troubleshooting of pre engineered building structure at various sites. Working closely with project coordinator, internal teams like logistics, production and external clients, he will ensure that projects are executed efficiently and meet quality standards. This role requires a combination of technical skills, problem-solving abilities, and effective communication. Key Responsibilities   1. Installation and Commissioning: Perform on-site installation, configuration, and commissioning of equipment or systems according to technical specifications and project requirements. Ensure proper setup and functionality before handing over to the client. 2. Technical Support: Provide technical support and assistance to clients and field technicians. Troubleshoot issues, diagnose problems, and implement solutions in a timely manner to minimize downtime and ensure optimal performance. 3. Maintenance and Repair: Conduct routine maintenance checks and inspections to identify potential issues or areas for improvement. Perform repairs, replacements, or upgrades as necessary to maintain equipment reliability and functionality. 4. Documentation: Maintain accurate records of installation activities, service reports, and equipment inventory. Document troubleshooting steps, solutions implemented, and any modifications made during field visits. 5. Quality Assurance: Ensure that all work meets quality standards and complies with relevant regulations and safety guidelines. Conduct quality checks and inspections to verify compliance with specifications and customer expectations. 6. Customer Interaction: Build and maintain positive relationships with clients, contractors, and other stakeholders. Address client inquiries, provide technical guidance, and ensure customer satisfaction throughout the project lifecycle. 7. Training and Knowledge Sharing: Provide training and guidance to field technicians and clients on the proper use, maintenance, and troubleshooting of equipment or systems. Share technical expertise and best practices to improve overall performance and efficiency. 8. Remote Support: Provide remote assistance and troubleshooting support to field technicians and clients as needed. Utilize remote access tools and diagnostic software to identify and resolve technical issues remotely. 9. Continuous Improvement: Identify opportunities for process improvement and efficiency gains in field operations. Collaborate with internal teams to implement changes, streamline workflows, and enhance service delivery. 10. Proven experience in a similar role, preferably in a field service or technical support environment. 11. Strong technical aptitude with hands-on experience in equipment installation, maintenance, and troubleshooting. 12. Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail. 13. Effective communication skills, both verbal and written. 14. Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a dynamic, fast-paced environment. 15. Willingness to travel to various job sites and work flexible hours as needed. 16. Knowledge of relevant industry standards, regulations, and safety protocols. 17. Proficiency in computer skills and familiarity with technical software tools. Experience 2  years and above in similar field.
column11: Installation And Commissioning, Remote Support, Documentation, Customer Interaction, Remote Monitoring, Maintenance and Repair, Continuous Improvement, Technical Support, Quality Assurance

column2: Seacon Constructions Pvt Ltd  is looking for Construction Management Professionals  to join our dynamic team and embark on a rewarding career journey    you will play a pivotal role in overseeing and coordinating construction projects from inception to completion     This role involves managing various aspects of construction, including planning, scheduling, budgeting, and ensuring compliance with safety and quality standards     You will work closely with contractors, subcontractors, and project stakeholders to deliver successful construction outcomes       Key Responsibilities:       Project Planning and Scheduling:Develop and implement project plans, including timelines, milestones, and resource allocation     Create and manage construction schedules, ensuring adherence to deadlines     Budgeting and Cost Control:Prepare project budgets, including cost estimates for materials, labor, and equipment     Monitor project costs, identify variances, and implement cost-control measures     Contract Management:Coordinate the bidding process and evaluate contractor proposals     Negotiate and manage contracts with contractors, subcontractors, and suppliers     Site Supervision:Oversee day-to-day construction activities to ensure compliance with project plans and specifications     Conduct regular site inspections to monitor progress, quality, and safety     Quality Assurance and Compliance:Implement and enforce quality control measures to meet project specifications     Ensure compliance with building codes, regulations, and safety standards     Communication and Stakeholder Management:Maintain clear and regular communication with project stakeholders, including clients, architects, engineers, and regulatory authorities     Provide regular project updates and address any concerns or issues promptly     Risk Management:Identify potential risks and develop mitigation strategies     Implement proactive risk management measures to avoid delays and cost overruns     Documentation:Maintain accurate project documentation, including contracts, change orders, and progress reports     Prepare and submit regular project status reports to management

column2: SUMMARY      Our Client:         Our Client is the leading provider of employer-focused immigration services in New Zealand. Our immigration team is the largest and most experienced in New Zealand, providing employers with Immigration Strategy and visa advice for their employees.           Experience:  ?2 + years of working experience as a Site Traffic Management Supervisor.           NOTE: Only apply who are willing to relocate to New Zealand.           About the Role:       The candidate will be based in Auckland and/or but may also be required to work nationwide in Northland,?Waikato, Bay of Plenty, Gisborne, Hawkes Bay, Taranaki, Manawatu-Wanganui, Wellington, Tasman, Nelson,?Marlborough, West Coast, Canterbury, Otago, Southland.       This may require the need to travel away from home or relocate.   What you will do:   Tasks include (but is not limited to):      Planning and designing traffic management plans according to the specific requirements of the site.      Assessing potential hazards and risks associated with traffic management and implementing?     appropriate control measures.      Coordinating and supervising the installation and removal of traffic management devices, such as? signage, barriers, and cones.      Ensuring compliance with New Zealand's traffic management regulations, standards, and guidelines.      Conduct regular inspections and audits of traffic control measures to ensure they are properly?     maintained and functioning.        Monitoring and adjusting traffic management plans as needed to accommodate changing conditions or?unforeseen circumstances.          Communicating and collaborating with stakeholders, including workers, contractors, event organizers,?and local authorities.      Providing guidance and training to traffic management staff on safe work practices and proper use of?traffic control devices.      Investigating and reporting any incidents, near-misses, or non-compliance issues related to traffic?management.        Keeping accurate records, documentation, and reports related to traffic management activities      Other necessary tasks as required for the role           Requirements    Previous experience in civil construction, managing traffic   A solution-focused attitude, with strong forward planning and adaptability   Proven experience and understanding of Health and Safety   A good level of physical fitness due to the physical nature of the role   Able to pass a Drug test

column2: Role & responsibilities     Project Management: Planning, organizing, and coordinating all aspects of the project, from start to finish. This involves creating schedules, setting milestones, and assigning tasks to workers. Resource Management: Allocating and managing resources such as labor, materials, equipment, and tools efficiently to ensure smooth project operations. Supervision: Monitoring the work of subcontractors, laborers, and other personnel on-site to ensure that they are following project plans, specifications, and safety protocols. Quality Control: Ensuring that the work being performed meets the required quality standards and specifications. This may involve conducting inspections and tests. Safety Compliance: Enforcing and promoting a culture of safety on the construction site, ensuring that all workers follow safety regulations and protocols to prevent accidents and injuries. Problem Solving: Identifying and addressing any issues or challenges that arise during the project, such as unexpected delays, design changes, or budget constraints. Communication: Maintaining clear and effective communication with project stakeholders, including clients, architects, engineers, and management, to provide progress updates and address any concerns.

column2: Position : Civil Site Inspector   Role & Responsibilities:   Initiate prompt contact with clients upon assignment and schedule meetings based on client feasibility. Attend client meetings at their specified locations punctually. Conduct on-site inspections, meticulously cross-verifying the land security documents provided for home loans by clients, and update them in the Mattrum Web App. Complete assigned tasks by meticulously verifying 20 attributes for each property. This includes validating the EB card with the meter number, assessing the area, length, and breadth of the site, confirming building plan approvals documents, capturing street view photos inside and outside the property, and accurately tagging the geo-location. Submit the completed 20 attributes in the Maatram Web App, ensuring alignment with actual findings. Educational Qualification: Diploma or B.E. in Civil Engineering (Preferred) Required Skills: Proficient communication skills, including vernacular languages(Telugu) Basic understanding of civil engineering principles related to land and property. Job Nature: Fieldwork requires the use of your own transportation. Travel to various locations for inspections and verifications. Accurate documentation and reporting must be completed by the end of each working day in the Maatram Web App using your Android mobile phone.

column2: Job Title: Site Supervisor  Job Location: Hyderabad Salary Range: 12,000/- Per Month Description  We are currently seeking a highly qualified and experienced Site Supervisor to oversee and manage our construction sites. As a Site Supervisor, you will be responsible for ensuring the smooth and efficient operation of projects, while maintaining a safe working environment. This is a critical role that requires strong leadership skills, excellent problem-solving abilities, and the ability to work well under pressure. Responsibilities Supervise and coordinate site activities to ensure project objectives are met Monitor and enforce compliance with all relevant safety regulations and company policies Coordinate with subcontractors, suppliers, and other stakeholders to ensure timely completion of work Provide technical guidance and support to construction teams Review project plans and specifications to identify any potential issues or conflicts Conduct regular inspections to ensure quality control and identify any necessary corrective actions Maintain accurate records of site activities, including daily reports, progress photos, and material delivery documentation Requirements Fresher (or) Minimum 1 year of experience as a Site Supervisor in the construction industry Strong knowledge of construction methods, materials, and techniques Excellent leadership and organizational skills Ability to effectively communicate and collaborate with various stakeholders Proven ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously Solid understanding of safety regulations and procedures Proficient in using construction management software and other relevant tools Ability to work in fast-paced and dynamic environments Strong problem-solving and decision-making skills Attention to detail and strong analytical abilities Excellent time management and prioritization skills Ability to work well under pressure and meet tight deadlines Willingness to travel to different project sites as required

N   Relocation?  N   Position Type  Non-Management       POSITION SUMMARY         Direct and assist Stewards in order to make clean up more efficient. Assist management in hiring, training, scheduling, evaluating, counseling, disciplining, and motivating and coaching employees. Follow all company and safety and security policies and procedures; report accidents, injuries, and unsafe work conditions to manager; complete safety training and certifications. Ensure uniform and personal appearance are clean and professional; maintain confidentiality of proprietary information; protect company assets. Welcome and acknowledge all guests according to company standards; anticipate and address guests  service needs. Speak with others using clear and professional language. Develop and maintain positive working relationships with others; support team to reach common goals. Ensure adherence to quality expectations and standards. Move, lift, carry, push, pull, and place objects weighing less than or equal to 50 pounds without assistance. Stand, sit, or walk for an extended period of time. Reach overhead and below the knees, including bending, twisting, pulling, and stooping. Move over sloping, uneven, or slippery surfaces. Perform other reasonable job duties as requested by Supervisors.       PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS   Education: High school diploma or G.E.D. equivalent.   Related Work Experience: At least 2 years of related work experience.   Supervisory Experience: At least 1 year of supervisory experience.   License or Certification: None                   Marriott International is an equal opportunity employer. We believe in hiring a diverse workforce and sustaining an inclusive, people-first culture. We are committed to non-discrimination on any protected basis, such as disability and veteran status, or any other basis covered under applicable law.       At Le M ridien, we are inspired by the era of glamorous travel, celebrating each culture through the distinctly European spirit of savouring the good life. Our guests are curious and creative, cosmopolitan culture seekers that appreciate moments of connection and slowing down to savour the destination. We provide authentic, chic and memorable service along with experiences that inspire guests to savour the good life. We re looking for curious and creative people to join our team. If you appreciate connecting with like-minded guests and have a deep desire to create memorable experiences, we invite you to explore career opportunities with Le M ridien. In joining Le M ridien, you join a portfolio of brands with Marriott International.  Be  where you can do your best work,   begin  your purpose,  belong  to an amazing global team, and  become  the best version of you.

column2: Responsible for Fabrication, testing and erection of process and utility piping during execution of a project in close and efficient coordination between site engineering manager, site planning engineer, piping contractor and engineering contractor (EPCM).      Overview/ Responsibilities:          As a Piping Engineer , you will be expected to: contractor critically along with planning engineer deputed at site during construction phase     Identifies planned activities for various contractors / subcontractors for short term and medium term Holds meetings with counterpart/ project manager to ascertain that they are providing adequate men and machinery to complete the work as per planned activities     Ensures that persons deployed by the contractor are having adequate skills and experience to carry out the requisite work (welder qualification; IBR certification) Interfaces with detailed engineering contractor - wherever necessary- to resolve the technical issues and help the progress of piping fabrication/ erection     Close watch on any design change request or specification waivers requested by contractor and accepting/ rejecting them through proper change management mechanism and maintains records for all such changes approved during execution of the project             Understands and explains contract terms to all concerned and deviations if any are brought to the notice of project manager and resolved accordingly.      Supervision and Progress Monitoring Close supervision of actual fabrication, testing and erection. Ensures that all the quality checks are carried out as per the project specifications/ quality plans and proper records are maintained.      Interacts with lead lead engineers of construction contractor to monitor progress that is achieved vis -a- vis planned progress. Raises the flags wherever delays are anticipated and ensure that contractors take necessary corrective / pre-emptive actions to adhere to schedule      Safety & Environment Works very closely with project manager, site construction manager, site safety engineer and construction contractor so that project safety and environment policy is adhered to in totality during all phases of construction; pre commissioning and commissioning.      Statutory Approvals Assists project manager and site construction manager in preparing necessary documentation for obtaining various statutory approvals      Cost Optimisation Always looks for opportunities to optimize the quantities and materials to minimize the cost in consultation with Project Manager/RCM.      Reports Generates periodic reports highlighting areas of concern and identifying the actions which need to be taken and shares the same with project manager and site construction manager.      Bachelor s degree in engineering (Mechanical) with a specialization in piping (preferred; but not a must)      Minimum 18 to 20 years of experience in the field of management of piping fabrication and erection in an EPC environment for chemical / petrochemical/ refinery units.      Exposure to working as an owner s engineer will be an advantage.      He must have some knowledge of mechanical, chemical, civil, electrical and instrumentation engineering so as to discuss and understand requirements and problems with engineers in these fields.      He must be aware of various standards, codes and practices.          Technical /Functional Expertise:            Good knowledge of all the stages of project execution activities (process plant) with an emphasis on piping fabrication, testing and erection activities        Excellent proficiency in reading and understanding all the construction drawings related to piping (isometric, hook ups, standard and special supports, piping GAs, underground drawings, 3D model)     Insight into construction and erection under other disciplines (instrumentation, civil, mechanical, electrical etc) and their interdependence during construction is a must     Good working knowledge of planning, detailed engineering , management of changes during detailed construction     Good knowledge of overall sequence and methodology of EPC execution of a chemical project     Aware of all environment regulations and statutory requirements     Reasonably good knowledge of various national and international design codes and practices (including those for safety)     Very good knowledge of various statutory requirements (PESO, IBR regulations, factory inspector approvals , DISH approvals etc)      Excellent command over written and verbal communication     Excellent management skills

Ltd. is looking for Assistant - Storekeeper to join our dynamic team and embark on a rewarding career journey     This role involves maintaining accurate records, ensuring timely stock replenishment, and supporting the smooth operations of the manufacturing facility        Key Responsibilities:        Inventory Management: Monitor and manage inventory levels of raw materials, components, and tools to support manufacturing requirements while minimizing excess stock      Receiving and Inspection: Receive incoming materials, conduct quality checks, and verify quantities against purchase orders or delivery notes      Storage and Organization: Properly store and organize items within the warehouse or storage area, ensuring efficient accessibility and space utilization      Stock Replenishment: Coordinate with procurement teams to ensure timely replenishment of materials to avoid stockouts      Issuance and Distribution: Issue materials, tools, and equipment to production teams based on requisitions and maintain accurate records of transactions      Data Entry: Record all inventory-related transactions accurately in the inventory management system or spreadsheets      Quality Control: Collaborate with quality control teams to ensure materials meet required standards before being used in production      Material Handling: Safely handle materials, components, and tools, using appropriate equipment and following safety guidelines      Documentation: Maintain detailed records of inventory levels, material movements, receipts, and issuances      Stock Audits: Conduct periodic stock audits to verify inventory accuracy and identify discrepancies      Reporting: Prepare regular inventory reports, consumption patterns, and recommendations for stock optimization      Safety and Compliance: Ensure compliance with safety regulations and storage guidelines for hazardous materials, if applicable

column2: Roles & Responsibilities As a senior horticulturist, you would typically have a range of responsibilities that involve overseeing various aspects of plant cultivation, landscaping, executing projects as per AUTOCAD design, supervise junior horticulturists etc. Here are some common roles and responsibilities for senior horticulturists: Planning,Design and Execution:  You might be involved in designing and executing landscapes. This involves selecting suitable plants considering soil types, drainage, and climate conditions, executing landscapes as per AUTOCAD and drawings presented by clients and creating aesthetically pleasing and functional layouts. Plant Selection and Care:  Senior horticulturists often choose plants that are suitable for specific environments and purposes, such as ornamental gardens, urban landscaping, or agricultural production. You would oversee planting, watering, fertilizing, and pest management to ensure plant health and growth. Supervision and Training:  In a senior role, you might supervise teams of horticulturists, gardeners, or landscaping staff. This includes providing guidance, training, and support to ensure that tasks are completed effectively and according to best practices. Budgeting and Resource Management:  You may be responsible for budgeting and managing resources such as plants, equipment, and personnel. This involves cost analysis, procurement, inventory management, and allocating resources efficiently to meet project goals. Environmental Conservation:  Senior horticulturists play a key role in promoting environmental sustainability and conservation. This can include implementing practices such as water conservation, organic farming, habitat restoration, and biodiversity conservation. Education and Outreach:  Many senior horticulturists engage in educational activities such as conducting workshops, giving presentations, writing articles, or participating in community outreach programs. This helps educate the public about gardening, environmental stewardship, and sustainable agriculture. Regulatory Compliance:  Depending on the industry and location, senior horticulturists may need to ensure compliance with regulations related to plant health, pest control, environmental protection, and land use. Preferred candidate profile  : Diploma in Agriculture ,B.Sc in Horticulture, M.Sc in Horticulture Perks and benefits   Salary , Travel allowances

overseeing the operations and maintenance of a specific site or facility      Your role involves ensuring that the site operates efficiently, meets safety and regulatory standards, and delivers high-quality services to its users or tenants      You will also be responsible for managing personnel, budgets, and resources effectively to achieve organizational goals        Key Responsibilities:        Operations Management: Manage day-to-day operations of the site, including facility maintenance, security, and janitorial services, to ensure smooth functioning      Safety and Compliance: retention      Budget Management: Develop and manage budgets for site operations, monitoring expenses and identifying cost-saving opportunities while ensuring optimal use of resources      Staff column2: Site Management: Overseeing all activities on the construction site to ensure work progresses according to the project plan     Safety Compliance: Enforcing safety regulations and best practices to maintain a safe working environment     Project Planning: Assisting in project planning, including resource allocation, scheduling, and procurement of materials and equipment     Quality Control: Ensuring that work is completed to the required quality standards and specifications     Supervision: Managing and supervising on-site workers, subcontractors, and vendors     Problem Solving: Addressing issues and challenges that arise during construction, such as delays, unexpected site conditions, and equipment malfunctions     Reporting: Providing regular progress reports to project managers and stakeholders     Cost Control: Monitoring expenses and ensuring that work is completed within the project budget     Client Communication: Maintaining communication with clients and addressing their concerns or requests

column2: About Company        Founded in 2011, ReNew, is one of the largest renewable energy companies globally, with a leadership position in India. Listed on Nasdaq under the ticker RNW, ReNew develops, builds, owns, and operates utility-scale wind energy projects, utility-scale solar energy projects, utility-scale firm power projects, and distributed solar energy projects. In addition to being a major independent power producer in India, ReNew is evolving to become an end-to-end decarbonization partner providing solutions in a just and inclusive manner in the areas of clean energy, green hydrogen, value-added energy offerings through digitalisation, storage, and carbon markets that increasingly are integral to addressing climate change. With a total capacity of more than 13.4 GW (including projects in pipeline), ReNew?? solar and wind energy projects are spread across 150+ sites, with a presence spanning 18 states in India, contributing to 1.9 % of India?? power capacity. Consequently, this has helped to avoid 0.5% of India?? total carbon emissions and 1.1% India?? total power sector emissions. In the over 10 years of its operation, ReNew has generated almost 1.3 lakh jobs, directly and indirectly. ReNew has achieved market leadership in the Indian renewable energy industry against the backdrop of the Government of India?? policies to promote growth of this sector. ReNew?? current group of stockholders contains several marquee investors including CPP Investments, Abu Dhabi Investment Authority, Goldman Sachs, GEF SACEF and JERA. Its mission is to play a pivotal role in meeting India?? growing energy needs in an efficient, sustainable, and socially responsible manner. ReNew stands committed to providing clean, safe, affordable, and sustainable energy for all and has been at the forefront of leading climate action in India.            Job Description         Roles and Responsibilities:     Manage vendors and a group of assigned engineers at the site level to ensure quality work execution according to the project schedule.   Verify all drawings before releasing them for execution.   Ensure civil work aligns with approved drawings.   Ensure civil work adheres to the approved schedule.   Oversee the Handover-Takeover (HOTO) process.   Manage contract closure activities.   Supervise civil foundation work for module mounting structures, ensuring compliance with approved drawings and quality standards.   Supervise and inspect column leg civil foundation work.   Oversee and check land leveling activities.   Supervise sub-station foundation construction work.   Supervise the construction of main control room buildings and inverter control rooms.   Supervise tower construction civil work.   Oversee plant plumbing work.   Supervise the construction of roads.   Manage the construction of drainage systems.   Act as an active member of the HOTO team, ensuring timely handover of commissioned projects.   Adhere to the organizational safety policy.   Implement Integrated Management System (IMS), maintain records, and prepare for audits.   Inspect, test, and report non-conformities in consultation with designated authorities, ensuring adherence to approved Field Quality Plans (FQPs) covering all stages from raw materials to finished structures.     Deliverables:     Adhere to the project schedule and monitor progress daily, weekly, fortnightly, and monthly until completion.   Ensure projects are completed in line with engineering drawings and quality standards within the project schedule commissioning date.   Develop team members assigned to him to handle future responsibilities effectively.   Ensure zero rework and zero accidents at the field level.   Complete HOTO activities within the stipulated period by the assigned contractors.     Profile & Eligibility Criteria:     Education: Bachelor's degree (B.E/B.Tech) in Civil Engineering.   Experience: 7-12 years in supervising civil construction of switchyard and control room buildings.   Ability to manage a project sub-team to meet project schedule requirements.   Knowledge of civil construction standards to ensure quality execution.   Prepare project progress and MIS reports, and update relevant authorities about project progress.   Coordinate with supply chain management, vendors, and construction project managers.   Measure and certify bills with clients and contractors, ensuring statutory compliance.   Conduct civil-related testing such as raw material tests, dimension and marking verifications, pull-out tests, and stability tests.   Knowledge of building construction, steel construction RCC, control room construction, and construction standards.   Familiarity with contour and land leveling with proper slope.   Proficiency in using civil-related equipment such as Auto level, Dumpy level, total station machine, and GPS.   Knowledge of Bill of Quantities (BOQ) and Bill of Materials (BOM) of Civil Materials, surveying, AutoCAD, and other civil-related software.   Demonstrated experience working with multiple contractors and teams at the site level.

column2: CRESCENT DESIGNS INDIA PRIVATE LIMITED is looking for Site Engineers to join our dynamic team and embark on a rewarding career journey      A Site Engineer, also known as a Construction Site Engineer or Field Engineer, is a professional who oversees construction projects at the site level      They play a critical role in ensuring the successful execution of construction plans and coordinating various activities on-site      Here are some key responsibilities of a Site Engineer:Project Planning and Execution:      The Site Engineer works closely with project managers and stakeholders to understand project requirements, timelines, and specifications      They contribute to the development of project plans, schedules, and budgets      They ensure that construction activities are executed according to the plans and monitor progress to meet project milestones      Site Supervision: The Site Engineer is responsible for overseeing construction activities on-site      They manage and supervise the construction crew, contractors, and subcontractors, ensuring compliance with safety regulations, quality standards, and project specifications      They monitor and control work progress, resolve any issues or conflicts that arise, and ensure efficient utilization of resources      Quality Control: The Site Engineer ensures that construction work meets the required quality standards      They conduct regular inspections, perform quality checks, and ensure adherence to approved construction drawings and specifications      They identify and address any quality-related issues or deficiencies promptly      Material and Equipment Management: The Site Engineer is involved in managing construction materials, equipment, and resources on-site      They coordinate with suppliers, track inventory, and ensure timely availability of materials and equipment as per project requirements      They also oversee the proper handling, storage, and usage of materials and equipment to minimize wastage and ensure safety      Documentation and Reporting: The Site Engineer maintains accurate and up-to-date project documentation      They prepare daily or weekly progress reports, record site activities, maintain records of work orders, change orders, and RFIs (Requests for Information)      They also document any issues, incidents, or variations from the original plans and report them to the project team
column11: Construction, Supervision

column2: As a Horticulturist, you will be responsible for ensuring the aesthetic appeal and environmental sustainability of our real estate properties through the implementation of innovative horticultural practices. You will collaborate with cross-functional teams to implement, and maintain green spaces that enhance the overall value and attractiveness of our properties. Role & responsibilities   1. Develop and implement landscape design plans that align with the aesthetic vision of the real estate properties. 2. Select appropriate plant species and materials for landscaping projects based on factors such as climate, soil conditions, and client preferences. 3. Coordinate with external vendors and contractors for the procurement and installation of landscaping materials and equipment. 4. Conduct regular site inspections to assess the health and condition of plants, trees, and other greenery, and recommend appropriate maintenance interventions. 5. Develop and implement sustainable landscaping practices to conserve water, reduce chemical usage, and promote biodiversity. 6. Provide guidance and support to property management teams on horticultural matters, including pest control, irrigation systems, and seasonal maintenance tasks. 7. Stay informed about industry trends, advancements in horticultural technology, and best practices in sustainable landscaping. 8. Collaborate with marketing and sales teams to showcase the landscaping features of our properties to prospective clients and tenants. 9. Educate clients, tenants, and community members about the benefits of green spaces and the importance of environmental stewardship. 10. Maintain accurate records of landscaping activities, including plant inventory, maintenance schedules, and budget expenditures. Preferred candidate profile   1. Bachelors degree in Horticulture 2. Proven experience in horticulture, landscaping, or related field, preferably in a real estate or property management context. 3. Strong knowledge of plant biology, soil science, and landscape design principles. 4. Proficiency in using landscaping tools and equipment, including but not limited to lawnmowers, trimmers, and irrigation systems.
column11: Horticulture

column2: This role involves supervisors to manage and coordinate projects, oversee installation and commissioning activities along with managing site team and subcontractors and ensuring safety practices at work place.         Main Responsibilities:           Safety Inspections:    Conduct regular inspections of the work area to identify and correct potential safety hazards.       Enforcement of Safety Policies:    Enforce adherence to safety protocols and procedures established by regulatory agencies and company policies.       Training and Education   : Conduct toolbox talk and provide safety training to employees and contractors on safe working practices and procedures.       Accident Investigation:    Investigate accidents or incidents to determine their root cause and implement corrective actions to prevent recurrence.       Safety Documentation   : Maintain records of safety inspections, training sessions, and incidents. Implementation of Safety compliance adherence and Daily toolbox talk with the installation vendor.       Safety Equipment Management   : Ensure availability and proper use of safety equipment like helmets, harnesses, goggles, etc       Emergency Response Planning:    Develop and implement emergency response plans for various scenarios like fires, chemical spills, or injuries.       Coordination:    Coordination between contractor the client and to collaborate with project managers, engineers, and contractors to address safety concerns and implement safety measures.       Safety Meetings:    Conduct regular safety meetings with site team and management to discuss safety issues and improvements.       Review:    Material verification as per the approved makes and PDI checklist and review of storage conditions for material and installation activities.       Planning:    Work-front allocation and site planning by witnessing all functionality tests conducted by the vendor.         Qualifications and Skills:         A degree or diploma in Occupational Health and Safety from a recognized institute.     4-6 years of experience in supervision and site coordination of MEP projects , electrical installation, construction activities in industries or similar field is preferred.     Understanding of Safety regulations and codes set forth by relevant authorities (OSHA, ANSI, etc).     Strong verbal and written communication skills to effectively convey Safety procedures and concerns.     Ability to identify Safety risks and develop solutions to mitigate them.     Keen observation skills to spot potential hazards and ensure compliance with Safety standards.     Capability to lead and motivate teams towards a culture of Safety and compliance.         Skills:         Well-versed in preparing Gantt chart, project trackers, MS Office, Excel, PMS applications for documentation and reporting.
column11: Accident investigation, Excel, Compliance, Safety training, Consulting, MEP, Occupational health, Site planning, ANSI, Safety Supervisor

column2: About the Role: The JM Supervisor is responsible for managing a team of technicians and delivering quality Termite services, optimising material consumption and service excellence through them. The incumbent will report to the OM / AOM/ Sr OE and will have to work as part of a multi-functional team and this involves collaboration with the internal team and external stakeholders. Job Responsibilities: Manage a team of technicians and deliver Service Excellence through a team.  Ensure contractual obligations to our customers are met; ensuring consistently high standards of workmanship are delivered.  Supervision of Termite jobs, SMEs jobs in absence of TSPO jobs, and supporting Solo Technicians if required (Should not be utilised for Office work)  Issue of materials, chemical, Fuel and monitoring & optimising consumption.  Verify physical stock and ensure the same is matching with NAV once in 15 days. Prepare Bags and Materials for technicians one day in advance for next day's schedule, by taking the next day schedule from Planner daily @ 3 pm  Allocate technician for daily deployment in coordination with SPs as per OTOZ  Expected reduction in material consumption at site and in route to optimum utilisation of resources  Inform BM/OM for non moving material each month. Monitor material expiry dates and inform OM/BM min 3-4 months in advance. Update OE on surplus stock / near to expiry & Prepare indents  Physical stock taking at branch and at customer sites  Ensure store remains clean and in neat condition  PPE distribution check and issue  Check service quality when on supervision & surprise visits  Supervise termite jobs and optimise ToS for termite jobs  Improve quality of Termite jobs to reduce complaints  Encourage more technicians to submit leads Key Result Areas: Control & reduction in material cost  Effective utilisation of Squad and Improve Termite ToS  TSPO- Complaint reduction  Increase in nos. of Technicians submitting leads  Streamline PPEs usages and stores material issue & receipt  Competencies (Skills essential to the role): Proven for his skills in various PMS  SCP operating knowledge  Assertive, Self Confident and Team player  Positive Attitude  Takes pride in their work  Ability to work Independently  Leadership skills for getting work done, persuasive  Well Groomed  Educational Qualification / Other Requirement: Minimum 10th pass (prefered 10+2), can read & write in local language (English prefered ) Successfully completed L1 Training Program (L2 Preferred)  Preferably possess two wheeler with valid driving license  Working knowledge of computers will be an added advantage

column2: Job Description: We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced Project Coordinator to join our team for a prestigious high-rise luxury residential project in South Mumbai. The ideal candidate will possess technical expertise in RCC structures, finishes, MEPF trades coordination, as well as a thorough understanding of site logistics, planning, risk management, and strategy for fast-track construction techniques and innovative construction methods. The Project Coordinator will play a crucial role in ensuring the successful execution of the project from inception to completion. Key Responsibilities: 1. Technical Coordination: - Coordinate with architects, engineers, consultants, and contractors to ensure proper coordination of RCC structures, finishes, MEPF trades, and other technical aspects. - Review construction drawings, specifications, and documents to identify and resolve any discrepancies or conflicts. - Monitor the progress of consultant deliverables in line with Project Master Schedule and ongoing construction activities and ensure adherence to quality standards and project specifications. 2. Site Logistics and Planning: - Develop and implement site logistics plans to optimize the use of resources, equipment, and manpower. - Coordinate with site management teams to plan and schedule construction activities, material deliveries, and equipment mobilization. - Anticipate and mitigate potential construction-related challenges and obstacles to ensure smooth project execution. 3. Strategy for Fast-Track Construction Techniques: - Identify opportunities for implementing fast-track construction techniques to expedite project timelines while maintaining quality and safety standards. - Collaborate with project stakeholders to develop innovative construction methods and strategies to enhance efficiency and productivity. 4. Formwork Planning: - Evaluate and select appropriate types of formwork systems based on project requirements, structural design, and construction methodology. - Develop formwork plans and schedules to ensure timely installation, removal, and reusability of formwork systems. 5. Risk Management: - Identify potential risks and uncertainties associated with the project and develop risk mitigation strategies. - Conduct regular risk assessments and implement measures to minimize the impact of identified risks on project objectives. - Collaborate with project stakeholders to ensure compliance with safety regulations and protocols to mitigate construction-related risks. Requirements: - Bachelors degree in civil engineering or architecture or related field. Masters degree in project management or PMP preferred. - Middle east or international market project delivery experience will be preferred. - Minimum of  15 to 18 years  of experience in project coordination or management, preferably in high-rise residential construction projects. - Strong technical knowledge of RCC structures, finishes, MEPF trades, and construction methods. - Proficiency in project management software and tools. - Excellent communication, leadership, and interpersonal skills. - Ability to work effectively in a fast-paced environment and manage multiple priorities simultaneously. - Proven track record of delivering projects on time and within budget. If you possess the required skills and experience and are passionate about contributing to the success of prestigious luxury residential projects, we encourage you to apply for this exciting opportunity. Join us in shaping the skyline of South Mumbai with iconic and exceptional developments. To apply, please submit your resume on amey.matephod@runwalgroup.in . We thank all applicants for their interest, however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

column2: Some key responsibilities of a project manager include: Project Planning:  Developing a comprehensive project plan that outlines the scope, objectives, timeline, resources for the project. Design Compliance:  The PM shall ensure that the construction work aligns with the design intent and drawings. They shall review drawings, specifications, and other project documents to verify that the design is being implemented correctly. Any Non-Compliance shall be raised with the Architects/clients for appropriate action. Team Management:  Building and leading a project team, assigning tasks, and ensuring that team members have the necessary resources and support to complete their work. Coordination and Communication:  PM shall act as a liaison between the Interior Architects, build partners, and other project stakeholders & suppliers for any matter related to scope of work. They shall facilitate communication and collaboration between the stakeholders and highlight any changes or challenges that arise during the Interior fit out phase.  Risk Management:  Identifying potential risks to the project and developing strategies to mitigate them. Budget Management:  Monitoring project expenses and ensuring that the project stays within budget. Quality Control:  Ensuring that the project deliverables meet the required quality standards. Responsible for quality audits during the construction phase. Ensure that the materials, finishes, and installations are per specifications. Any discrepancies or issues shall be raised to the Architect/Client through a weekly report mechanism. Timeline Management:  Monitoring project timelines and making adjustments as necessary to ensure that the project stays on track. Documentation:  Keeping accurate records of all project-related activities, including meetings, decisions, and changes to the project plan. Problem-solving:  Addressing any issues or conflicts that arise during the project and finding solutions to keep the project moving forward. Advising the client on contractual matters including price variations as submitted by the contractor. Certifying all contractor bills. A full-time resource for daily execution work at the site, with monitoring conducted directly by a senior part-time resource available on a callout basis as needed.
column11: Project Execution, Site Management, Civil Project Management, Site Supervision

column2: Responsibilities -    1. Project Management: Supervise and manage all on-site construction activities from preliminary site setup to handing over stage. Preparation of BOQ. Reconciliation of Materials Ensure that projects are completed within scope, budget, and schedule. Collaborate with team and other stakeholders to develop and update project schedules. Check and review the site requisitions and compare them with the approved Bill of Quantity (BOQ).  2. Quality Assurance: Implement and enforce quality control and safety standards on-site. Conduct regular inspections to ensure compliance with project specifications and regulatory requirements. Address and resolve any issues or deviations from project plans. 3. Technical Expertise: Interpret and review engineering drawings, specifications, and other technical documents. Provide technical guidance to construction teams. Work closely with architects and designers to ensure design intent is  maintained during construction. 4. Coordination: Coordinate with subcontractors, suppliers, and other stakeholders. Facilitate communication between different project teams. Address and resolve any site-related issues that may arise. 5. Documentation: Maintain accurate and up-to-date project documentation. Checking of drawing discrepancies and specifications      etc. Prepare and submit regular progress reports to project managers. Keep records of materials used, expenditures, and project progress. 6. Budget Management: Assist in the preparation and monitoring of project budgets. Rate Analysis. Submit and negotiate contract variations, additional works, snags, and maintenance orders. Identify cost-saving measures without compromising  quality. 7. Problem Solving: Quickly and effectively address and resolve      unforeseen challenges on-site. Propose solutions to optimize construction processes      and overcome obstacles Preparation of BBS Calculation Daily Progress report. Monthly Reports.   Desired profile of the candidate -     Site Engineer  English, kannada, Hindi,  Preferred Bangalore Location Only  Must have 1 to 5 years of experience and Candidate must be good oral and written communication skills and possess multi-tasking ability. column2: Job Title: Project Head - Hospital Construction Location: Dwarka Salary: Up 2.5 to 4 Lacs per Month depending on experience     Position Summary: As the Project Head for Hospital Construction, you will play a pivotal role in managing and overseeing all aspects of the construction project, ensuring its successful completion within the specified timeframe and budget. Your expertise in hospital construction and MEP systems will be critical to the project's success.     Key Responsibilities: 1.  Project Leadership : Lead, manage, and coordinate all activities related to the hospital construction project. 2.  Technical Expertise : Utilize your knowledge of Civil Engineering and MEP systems to ensure the project's technical requirements are met. 3.  Quality Assurance : Implement and monitor quality control procedures to guarantee the highest standards of construction. 4.  Budget Management : Manage project finances, ensuring adherence to the budget and identifying cost-saving opportunities. 5.  Timeline Adherence : Develop and execute project schedules to meet deadlines and adapt to any changes as necessary. 6.  Resource Management : Oversee labour, materials, and equipment procurement, and ensure efficient resource utilization. 7.  Stakeholder Communication : Maintain open and effective communication with clients, subcontractors, and team members. 8.  Documentation : Maintain detailed project records and reports, keeping all documentation organized and up to date.     Qualifications: Bachelors degree in civil engineering or a related field. A minimum of working experience as a Project Head on three hospital construction projects. In-depth knowledge of MEP (Mechanical, Electrical, and Plumbing) systems in a hospital setting. Excellent project management and leadership skills. Strong communication and interpersonal abilities. Knowledge of industry best practices and relevant regulations. Ability to work effectively under pressure and in a dynamic environment.

column2: Project Planning: Project Engineers participate in the initial project planning phase     They work with stakeholders to define project objectives, scope, and deliverables     They develop project schedules, budgets, and resource allocation plans     Design and Development: Depending on the field (civil engineering, mechanical engineering, electrical engineering, etc), Project Engineers may be involved in designing systems, structures, components, or products     They collaborate with design teams, draft plans, and ensure compliance with relevant codes and standards     Coordination: Project Engineers serve as the point of contact between different teams, departments, and stakeholders involved in the project     They facilitate communication and collaboration to ensure everyone is working toward the same goals     Resource Management: Project Engineers allocate and manage resources such as personnel, materials, equipment, and budget     They monitor resource utilization and make adjustments as needed to keep the project on track     Risk Management: Identifying potential risks and developing strategies to mitigate them is a crucial aspect of a Project Engineer's role     They anticipate challenges, implement risk reduction measures, and develop contingency plans     Quality Assurance: Project Engineers are responsible for maintaining the quality of work throughout the project lifecycle     They establish quality control processes, conduct inspections, and ensure that work meets specifications and standards

column2: ?         Pre-tendering Activities :    He shall go through various tender notices appearing in news papers. Select works from his angle which can be bidded, obtain their details such as work components, location time limit E.M.D., S.D., way of paying EMD and SD, dates of purchase-pre-bid-submission, pre-qualification criteria etc and put up before his superiors the list of such works with their details for their decision regarding bidding.           Check-list for site information :    After getting the decision regarding works to be quoted a checklist giving site details and other relevant information should be got filled in from he site engineer concerned.           Calling quotations for materials :    Rates for various materials shall be gathered by calling quotations.           Tender Cost Working :    On the basis of information gathered from site engineer and rate quotations of materials obtained, workable rates for each item of work in the tender shall be worked out. Total workable tender cost shall then be worked out. By adding the taxes and overheads the    biddable cost    shall be worked out. This cost shall be got approved from superiors/director           Submission of tender :    The tender duly completed along with relevant documents shall be submitted in time to the authority concerned.           Post tender submission activities:    The tender quoted if accepted by the authority for formalities in getting    Work Order    shall be followed up immediately.           Handing over documents to Project Manager :    After getting the work order the sets of copies of accepted tender documents with drawings shall be prepared. One such set shall be handed over to the concerned Project Manager immediately.
column11: Survey, Purchase, Bidding, Work Order, Site Engineer, Tendering

column2: ??Construction Managers need strong analytical and leadership skills so they can solve technical engineering challenges while managing a large construction team.   ??Construction Manager manage the planning and design stage of construction projects.    They carefully evaluate the structural, electrical, and mechanical condition of each project.    The construction manager also analyzes a job?? financial projections to ensure they are accurate and practical.   ??Overseeing all the different engineering processes in a construction project is the primary responsibility of a construction manager. They are expected to be subject-matter experts and complete routine tests to make sure that all legal regulations are followed. They keep an up-to-date understanding of all legal obligations and contract terms to prevent project delays, support all construction workers, and actively drive projects to completion.   ??Construction managers bring specific knowledge to construction projects, such as cost control, cost accounting, and management of project schedules. They constantly refer to schedules to make sure quality work is done on time. When needed, they facilitate discussions and create solutions between construction contractors and construction managers. It is their responsibility to eliminate disagreements in the field and misunderstandings about expected work outcomes.   ??Weekly meetings with all parties involved in a construction project are common for construction managers. Part of their job is to provide necessary status updates and respond to questions from contractors, clients, and their own company leadership. Furthermore, they regularly assess all projects to suggest different cost-saving techniques for a project. Many construction engineers are also required to send weekly project reports to their reporting authorities.   ??Collaborate with engineers, architects etc. to determine the specifications of the project   ??Negotiate contracts with external vendors to reach profitable agreements. Obtain permits and licenses from appropriate authorities   ??Determine needed resources (manpower, equipment and materials) from start to finish    with attention to budgetary limitations and Plan all construction operations and schedule intermediate phases to ensure deadlines will be met.   ??Acquire equipment and material and monitor stocks to timely handle inadequacies   ??Hire contractors and other staff and allocate responsibilities   ??Supervise the work of labourers, mechanics etc. and give them guidance when needed, evaluate progress and prepare detailed reports.   ??Ensure adherence to all health and safety standards and report issues, contributing technical expertise to project drawings and designs.   ??Performing cost calculations and preparing financial projections.   ??Manage, design, develop, create and maintain small-scale through to large-scale construction projects in a safe, timely and sustainable manner   ??Conduct on site investigations and analyze data (maps, reports, tests, drawings and other)   ??Carry out technical and feasibility studies and draw up blueprints that satisfy technical specifications   ??Assess potential risks, materials and costs   ??Provide advice and resolve creatively any emerging problems/deficiencies   ??Manage budget and purchase equipment/materials   ??Comply with guidelines and regulations including permits, safety etc and deliver technical files and other technical documentation as require       Requirements       ??Proven experience as construction project manager   ??In-depth understanding of construction procedures and material and project management principles   ??Familiarity with quality and health and safety standards   ??Good knowledge of MS Office, Autocad etc,.Familiarity with construction/ project management software. Computer-aided drafting and design 3D modeling software or similar   ??Outstanding communication and negotiation skills.   ??Should know to do planning, budgeting, quantity calculation and estimating.   ??Excellent organizational and time-management skills   ??A team player with leadership abilities   ??BSc/BE in engineering, Civil, building science or relevant field   ??PMP or equivalent certification will be an advantage   ??Geographic information systems (GIS)   ??Surveying equipment

column2: Location:  Nagpur Experience:  1-3 Years Education:  Diploma / B.Tech in Civil Engineering We are seeking a talented Junior Engineer with proficiency in AutoCAD and a passion for building construction to join our team in Nagpur. The ideal candidate will assist in the design, drafting, and coordination of building projects, contributing to the successful execution of construction plans. Responsibilities: AutoCAD Drafting:  Create detailed drawings, plans, and layouts using AutoCAD software for building construction projects. Design Support:  Assist in the development and modification of building designs, incorporating architectural, structural, and MEP elements. Coordination:  Collaborate with project engineers, architects, and other stakeholders to ensure alignment of design drawings with project requirements. Quantity Estimation:  Prepare quantity take-offs and material schedules based on design drawings and project specifications. Documentation:  Maintain accurate project documentation, including drawings, revisions, and as-built records. Quality Assurance:  Review drawings for accuracy, completeness, and compliance with relevant codes and standards. Technical Support:  Provide support to project teams, answering queries related to drawings, specifications, and design details. Learning and Development:  Stay updated on industry trends, software updates, and best practices in building design and drafting. Requirements: Diploma or B.Tech in Civil Engineering, with a focus on building construction. 1-3 years of experience in architectural drafting and design, preferably in the construction industry. Proficiency in AutoCAD software, with the ability to create 2D and 3D drawings. Knowledge of building construction techniques, materials, and codes. Strong attention to detail and accuracy in drafting. Good communication and interpersonal skills. Ability to work effectively in a team environment and collaborate with multidisciplinary teams. Eagerness to learn and grow in the field of building design and construction. Advantageous Skills: Familiarity with other design software such as Revit, SketchUp, or Photoshop. column2: As an Interior Fit Out Site Engineer, you will play a crucial role in overseeing and managing the execution of interior fit-out projects from conception to completion. You will work closely with project managers, subcontractors, and other stakeholders to ensure that projects are delivered on time, within budget, and to the highest quality standards. Responsibilities: - Interpret architectural drawings, blueprints, and specifications to ensure compliance with project requirements. - Plan, coordinate, and supervise interior fit-out activities on construction sites, including material procurement, installation, and finishing. - Manage project schedules, budgets, and resources to optimize efficiency and minimize delays. - Conduct regular site inspections to monitor progress, identify potential issues, and implement corrective actions as needed. - Ensure compliance with building codes, safety regulations, and quality standards throughout the construction process. - Liaise with clients, architects, subcontractors, and suppliers to address any concerns and maintain positive relationships. - Provide technical guidance and support to project team members - Proactively identify opportunities for process improvement and implement best practices to enhance project delivery. - Keep abreast of industry trends, emerging technologies, and regulatory changes to continuously improve knowledge and skills. Requirements: - Bachelor's degree or diploma in Civil Engineering, Construction Management, or related field. - Proven experience in interior fit-out projects, with a minimum of 2 years in a similar role. - Strong technical expertise in reading and interpreting architectural drawings, specifications, and construction documents. - Excellent project management skills, including scheduling, budgeting, and resource allocation. - Effective communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively with diverse stakeholders. - Detail-oriented with a commitment to quality and precision in work. - Leadership abilities to motivate and guide project teams towards achieving common goals. - Proficiency in construction management software and tools. - Familiarity with relevant building codes, regulations, and safety standards. - Willingness to travel to project sites and work flexible hours as needed. Benefits: - Competitive salary and per site bonus commensurate with experience. - Opportunities for professional development and career advancement. - A dynamic and collaborative work environment with opportunities to work on exciting projects. Join our team and be part of a company that is shaping the future of interior fit-out solutions. Apply now by submitting your resume and cover letter detailing your relevant experience and qualifications. We look forward to welcoming you to our team!
