column2: Overview: We are seeking a dedicated and experienced Civil Site Supervisor to join our team. The Civil Site Supervisor will be responsible for overseeing all aspects of construction projects, ensuring they are completed safely, on time, and within budget. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in civil engineering, excellent leadership skills, and the ability to effectively communicate with team members, contractors, and clients. Responsibilities: Project Management: Manage and oversee all aspects of construction projects from start to finish, including planning, scheduling, budgeting, and resource allocation. Site Supervision: Supervise and coordinate construction activities on-site to ensure compliance with project specifications, safety standards, and regulatory requirements. Team Leadership: Provide leadership and direction to construction crews, subcontractors, and other personnel involved in the project. Delegate tasks effectively and ensure that all team members understand their roles and responsibilities. Quality Control: Monitor workmanship and quality of materials to ensure that construction meets industry standards and client expectations. Safety Compliance: Enforce safety protocols and procedures to create a safe working environment for all personnel on-site. Conduct regular safety inspections and address any safety concerns or violations promptly. Progress Reporting: Keep accurate records of project progress, including daily reports, inspection logs, and material quantities. Provide regular updates to project stakeholders on the status of construction activities. Problem Solving: Identify and resolve any issues or conflicts that may arise during construction, such as design changes, unexpected site conditions, or delays in material delivery. Client Relations: Maintain positive relationships with clients, architects, engineers, and other stakeholders throughout the project lifecycle. Address client concerns and ensure that their needs are met to the best of your ability. Cost Management: Monitor project costs and expenditures to ensure that construction stays within budget. Identify cost-saving opportunities and implement efficient construction practices where possible. Requirements: Bachelor's degree in Civil Engineering, Construction Management, or related field preferred. Proven experience as a Civil Site Supervisor or similar role in the construction industry. Strong knowledge of construction methods, materials, and techniques. Excellent leadership and communication skills, with the ability to effectively manage and motivate a diverse team. Thorough understanding of safety regulations and best practices in construction. Proficiency in project management software and Microsoft Office Suite. Ability to read and interpret blueprints, drawings, and specifications. Valid driver's license and willingness to travel to different job sites as needed. Certification in First Aid/CPR and OSHA 30-Hour Construction Safety Training a plus.
column11: Execution, Communication Skills, Quality Management, Labour Management, Construction knowledge

Job Responsibility: As a result of the continuing growth of our Design and Engineering business, our Civil and Structural Engineering team in Bangalore, Chennai and Mumbai are seeking to recruit an experienced Principal Structural Engineer.      This new appointment is part of our aspiration to develop and grow our structural team in India. This role will allow the right candidate to play a leading role in some of the most challenging and exciting engineering projects in the world. The successful candidate will have a proven track record in the management and production of engineering / technical deliverables on a range of multi-disciplinary projects of varying scales and levels of complexity. You will be responsible for overall Civil and Structural Engineering technical delivery within the Bangalore, Chennai and Mumbai Offices, providing all necessary technical direction, resourcing, mentoring and assurance of structural engineering within Bangalore, Chennai and Mumbai offices. Credibility, competence, agility and technical excellence are a given as the role requires close working with our internal and external clients, decision makers, industry stakeholders and other consultants to develop robust design solutions through collaborative and proactive management of client demands - providing leadership from both a technical delivery and people management perspective is imperative.     ?You will be a Structural Engineer with a proven track record of successful technical and commercial delivery of design projects from feasibility through to completion of construction/handover.     ?You will be required to demonstrate a developed understanding of the market and industry and ability to focus our business to take full advantage of market conditions and have experience in assisting with the preparation of bids and tendering opportunities, where required. Our offices provides multi-disciplinary design and engineering services and integrated solutions across a wide range of sectors.     ?This appointment offers a challenging and rewarding opportunity to apply knowledge, experience and problem solving skills to assist with leading and developing our business, from a technical perspective. Desired Profile: --Candidate must possess at least a Bachelors Degree, Post Graduate Diploma, Professional Degree, Masters Degree, Engineering (Civil) or equivalent. --At least 5 years of working experience in the related field is required for this position. --Preferably Senior Executives specializing in Engineering - Civil/Construction/Structural or equivalent. --

column2: Position : Civil Site Inspector   Role & Responsibilities:   Initiate prompt contact with clients upon assignment and schedule meetings based on client feasibility. Attend client meetings at their specified locations punctually. Conduct on-site inspections, meticulously cross-verifying the land security documents provided for home loans by clients, and update them in the Mattrum Web App. Complete assigned tasks by meticulously verifying 20 attributes for each property. This includes validating the EB card with the meter number, assessing the area, length, and breadth of the site, confirming building plan approvals documents, capturing street view photos inside and outside the property, and accurately tagging the geo-location. Submit the completed 20 attributes in the Maatram Web App, ensuring alignment with actual findings. Educational Qualification: Diploma or B.E. in Civil Engineering (Preferred) Required Skills: Proficient communication skills, including vernacular languages(Telugu) Basic understanding of civil engineering principles related to land and property. Job Nature: Fieldwork requires the use of your own transportation. Travel to various locations for inspections and verifications. Accurate documentation and reporting must be completed by the end of each working day in the Maatram Web App using your Android mobile phone.

column2: Project Management: They are responsible for managing all phases of the construction project, from planning and design to execution and completion. This involves coordinating with architects, contractors, subcontractors, and other stakeholders to ensure smooth progress.      Supervision: Senior Site Engineers supervise construction activities on-site, ensuring that work is carried out according to plans, specifications, and quality standards. They oversee the work of subcontractors and construction workers, providing guidance and direction as needed.      Quality Control: They are responsible for ensuring that construction materials and workmanship meet specified quality standards and regulatory requirements. This involves conducting inspections, performing tests, and addressing any issues or discrepancies that arise during the construction process.      Safety Management: Senior Site Engineers prioritize safety on the construction site, implementing and enforcing safety protocols and procedures to prevent accidents and ensure compliance with health and safety regulations.      Progress Reporting: They provide regular progress reports to project stakeholders, including clients, management, and other team members. This may involve documenting project milestones, tracking budget and schedule performance, and addressing any concerns or issues that may arise.      Problem-solving: Senior Site Engineers are tasked with identifying and resolving technical challenges, design conflicts, and other issues that may arise during construction. They must be able to think critically and develop creative solutions to overcome obstacles and keep the project on track. column2: Site engineers may require the following skills to perform their tasks effectively: Technical skills:  It is important for site engineers to have the necessary technical knowledge to work with designs, drawings and models and identify and find solutions for engineering problems. Project management skills:  They require project management skills to evaluate, allocate and oversee work tasks in a project and ensure compliance with relevant standards, regulations and laws. Communication skills:  Effective verbal and written communication skills are essential for site engineers to interact with clients, vendors, suppliers, other engineers, site supervisors and workers. Organisation skills:  Site engineers monitor and evaluate work progress, ensure compliance with project plans and design documents, organise project information and allocate construction resources. Budgeting skills:  They have to estimate the costs of materials and labour and use resources carefully. Leadership skills:  Since the site engineer is in charge of the project and responsible for its outcome, they ought to be decisive, confident and approachable, and able to lead and motivate those working under them. Collaboration skills:  Construction work involves teamwork, and site engineers collaborate with crew members and organise work duties to improve work efficiency. Problem-solving   skills:  Various unforeseen problems can arise at construction sites, and site engineers solve these quickly and effectively. Attention to detail:  To ensure that the construction work proceeds without problems, site engineers pay attention to detail and take stock of even the most minute things. Time-management skills:  Most construction projects have timelines for completion, and site engineers ensure that the project work progresses according to schedule. onsibilities
column11: Project Management, Communication Skills, Technical, Budgeting Skills, Collaboration, Problem Management, Organization Skills, Leadership Skills

column2: Greencentric Commercial Projects is a dynamic firm specializing in sustainable and innovative commercial construction projects. With a commitment to eco-friendly practices and cutting-edge designs, we strive to create spaces that not only meet our clients' needs but also contribute to a greener future. We are currently seeking a dedicated On-Site Engineer to join our team and ensure the successful execution of our projects. Job Title: On-Site Engineer Location:  Surat, Vadodara, Ahmedabad Qualifications: Diploma in Civil/Electrical Engineering or related field. 0-3 Years work Experience (Freshers may apply) Responsibilities: Work Progress Management: Oversee and ensure that construction work progresses according to strict deadlines and project timelines. Implement strategies to optimize productivity and minimize delays, ensuring timely project completion. Adherence to Design Specifications: Ensure that all construction activities are carried out as per the provided drawings, layouts, and specifications. Conduct regular inspections to verify compliance with design requirements and quality standards. Logistics and Material Management: Keep track of the logistics and availability of materials on-site, ensuring that required materials are procured and delivered on time. Coordinate with suppliers and vendors to ensure a smooth flow of materials to the construction site. Work Flow Management: Maintain an uninterrupted workflow on-site by identifying potential bottlenecks and implementing effective solutions. Coordinate with various teams and subcontractors to ensure seamless coordination and cooperation.       Team Management: Manage and supervise blue-collar workers on-site, providing guidance, instruction, and support as needed. Foster a positive and productive work environment, encouraging teamwork and collaboration among on-site teams. Efficiency and Performance Monitoring: Monitor the performance and efficiency of on-site teams, identifying areas for improvement and implementing corrective measures as necessary. Implement best practices and procedures to enhance productivity and ensure quality outcomes. Benefits: Competitive salary and benefits package. Opportunities for career growth and advancement within the company. Exposure to innovative and sustainable construction practices. Collaborative and supportive work environment. Join Greencentric Commercial Projects and be part of a team dedicated to building a greener and more sustainable future. Apply now to take the next step in your career as an On-Site Engineer!

column2: Hello Candidates! Greetings from  Hungry Bird IT Consulting Services Pvt Lt. Hiring for  Site Enginee r for our client at  Hyderabad  location. Experience : 3 to  6 years of experience Qualifications : Bachelor's degree in civil engineering Location : Medipally, Hyderabad Interview Mode:  Face to face Note : Candidates should have Strong technical skills, including experience in layout formation and working with an auto-level Job Description: We are seeking a dedicated and skilled site engineer to join our team. The site engineer will be responsible for overseeing construction projects, ensuring adherence to specifications, managing resources, and maintaining safety standards on-site. Responsibilities: Manage and oversee construction projects from conception to completion. Ensure compliance with project specifications, building codes, and regulations. Coordinate with architects, designers, contractors, and other stakeholders to ensure project success. Supervise construction activities, including site preparation, excavation, foundation installation, and structural work. Conduct regular site inspections to monitor progress, quality, and safety standards. Resolve technical issues, conflicts, and unexpected challenges that may arise during construction. Review and approve project plans, drawings, and specifications. Manage project timelines, budgets, and resources effectively to meet project goals. Maintain accurate project documentation, including reports, logs, and correspondence. Communicate effectively with project team members, clients, and stakeholders to provide updates and address concerns. Qualifications: Bachelor's degree in civil engineering, construction engineering, or related field. Professional certification or licensure preferred (e.g., Professional Engineer). Minimum 3+ years of experience in construction or civil engineering. Proficiency in construction techniques, building codes, and industry standards. Strong technical skills, including knowledge of AutoCAD, Revit, or other relevant software. Excellent communication, leadership, and problem-solving abilities. Ability to work independently and as part of a team in a fast-paced environment. Knowledge of health and safety regulations and best practices. Attention to detail and strong organizational skills. column2: Job Description:  We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced Site Engineer to join our real estate development team. The Site Engineer will be responsible for overseeing layout development and plot development projects, ensuring adherence to design specifications, quality standards, and regulatory requirements. Responsibilities: Coordinate and manage layout development and plot development projects from inception to completion, including site planning, design, construction, and handover. Collaborate with architects, designers, surveyors, and other stakeholders to develop site layouts, plot plans, and infrastructure designs that meet project requirements and regulatory standards. Conduct site surveys and assessments to evaluate site conditions, topography, soil quality, and other factors influencing layout and plot development. Prepare and review engineering drawings, blueprints, and technical specifications for layout design, infrastructure development, and utility installations. Supervise construction activities on-site, including earthwork, grading, road construction, drainage systems, water supply, sewerage, and electrical installations, ensuring compliance with design specifications, safety regulations, and quality standards. Monitor project progress, schedule adherence, and budgetary compliance, identifying and addressing any issues or delays to ensure timely completion of projects. Perform quality control inspections and tests to verify workmanship, materials, and compliance with engineering standards and specifications. Manage subcontractors, vendors, and suppliers involved in layout and plot development projects, ensuring effective coordination and communication to meet project goals and deadlines. Liaise with local authorities, regulatory agencies, and utility providers to obtain necessary permits, approvals, and clearances for layout development and plot development projects. Provide technical expertise and support to project teams, consultants, and stakeholders, resolving technical issues and providing recommendations for design improvements or cost-saving measures. Requirements: Bachelor's degree in Civil Engineering, Construction Management, or related field; professional engineering license or certification is a plus. 3+ years of experience in site engineering, land development, or civil construction, with specific experience in layout development and plot development projects. Proficiency in AutoCAD, Civil 3D, GIS software, and other engineering design tools. Strong knowledge of civil engineering principles, practices, and construction techniques related to site development, grading, drainage, and infrastructure design. Familiarity with regulatory requirements, building codes, zoning ordinances, and environmental regulations governing real estate development projects. Excellent project management skills, with the ability to prioritize tasks, manage resources, and meet project deadlines. Effective communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to collaborate with multidisciplinary teams and stakeholders. Problem-solving mindset with attention to detail and a commitment to delivering high-quality work. Ability to work independently with minimal supervision and adapt to changing project requirements and priorities. Valid driver's license and willingness to travel to project sites as needed. Benefits: Competitive salary commensurate with experience. Comprehensive health, dental, and vision insurance plans. Retirement savings plan with company matching. Paid time off and holidays. Opportunities for professional development and advancement within the company.

column2: Amit Enterprises Housing Ltd is looking for Civil Engineer for Construction Site to join our dynamic team and embark on a rewarding career journey      Designing infrastructure projects:      The Civil Engineer must develop plans and designs for infrastructure projects, taking into account factors such as cost, safety, environmental impact, and construction feasibility      Analyzing data: The Civil Engineer must analyze data, such as survey reports, environmental impact studies, and geotechnical reports, to inform design decisions and ensure that projects meet relevant standards and regulations      Managing projects: The Civil Engineer must manage infrastructure projects from start to finish, including overseeing construction, coordinating with contractors and other stakeholders, and ensuring that projects are completed on time and within budget      Conducting site inspections: The Civil Engineer must conduct site inspections to ensure that construction work is being performed according to plans and specifications, and to identify and address any issues that arise      Ensuring safety and compliance: The Civil Engineer must ensure that infrastructure projects are designed and constructed to meet relevant safety standards and regulations, and that appropriate permits and approvals are obtained      Maintaining infrastructure: The Civil Engineer must oversee maintenance and repairs of existing infrastructure, ensuring that it remains safe and functional for its intended use      To be successful as a Civil Engineer, candidates should have strong analytical and problem-solving skills, as well as excellent communication and project management skills      They should also have a solid understanding of engineering principles and practices, and be familiar with relevant regulations and standards

column2: As an Interior Fit Out Site Engineer, you will play a crucial role in overseeing and managing the execution of interior fit-out projects from conception to completion. You will work closely with project managers, subcontractors, and other stakeholders to ensure that projects are delivered on time, within budget, and to the highest quality standards. Responsibilities: - Interpret architectural drawings, blueprints, and specifications to ensure compliance with project requirements. - Plan, coordinate, and supervise interior fit-out activities on construction sites, including material procurement, installation, and finishing. - Manage project schedules, budgets, and resources to optimize efficiency and minimize delays. - Conduct regular site inspections to monitor progress, identify potential issues, and implement corrective actions as needed. - Ensure compliance with building codes, safety regulations, and quality standards throughout the construction process. - Liaise with clients, architects, subcontractors, and suppliers to address any concerns and maintain positive relationships. - Provide technical guidance and support to project team members - Proactively identify opportunities for process improvement and implement best practices to enhance project delivery. - Keep abreast of industry trends, emerging technologies, and regulatory changes to continuously improve knowledge and skills. Requirements: - Bachelor's degree or diploma in Civil Engineering, Construction Management, or related field. - Proven experience in interior fit-out projects, with a minimum of 2 years in a similar role. - Strong technical expertise in reading and interpreting architectural drawings, specifications, and construction documents. - Excellent project management skills, including scheduling, budgeting, and resource allocation. - Effective communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively with diverse stakeholders. - Detail-oriented with a commitment to quality and precision in work. - Leadership abilities to motivate and guide project teams towards achieving common goals. - Proficiency in construction management software and tools. - Familiarity with relevant building codes, regulations, and safety standards. - Willingness to travel to project sites and work flexible hours as needed. Benefits: - Competitive salary and per site bonus commensurate with experience. - Opportunities for professional development and career advancement. - A dynamic and collaborative work environment with opportunities to work on exciting projects. column2: The Site Engineer at Talrop will be responsible for overseeing day-to-day construction activities, ensuring compliance with project plans and specifications and maintaining a safe and efficient work environment on-site.      This role requires strong technical knowledge, excellent communication skills and the ability to collaborate effectively with project teams and subcontractors.            Responsibilities :              Oversee all on-site construction activities, including site preparation, excavation, foundation work, structural erection, MEP installations and finishing works, to ensure adherence to project plans, specifications and quality standards.                  Implement and enforce quality control measures to ensure that construction activities meet or exceed industry standards and client expectations.              Enforce strict safety protocols and ensure compliance with health and safety regulations to maintain a safe working environment for all personnel on-site.                  Coordinate construction activities to ensure that project milestones and deadlines are met and progress is tracked according to the project schedule.                  Monitor material deliveries, inventory levels and usage on-site and coordinate with procurement teams to ensure timely availability of materials and supplies as per project requirements.          Coordinate with subcontractors, suppliers and vendors to ensure timely mobilisation, effective collaboration and resolution of issues affecting construction progress.                  Maintain accurate records of daily construction activities, including site reports, progress photos, inspection reports and as-built drawings, in compliance with project documentation requirements.                  Identify opportunities for process improvement, innovation and efficiency enhancement on-site and contribute to lessons learned sessions to support ongoing organisational learning and development.          Skills required :              Strong technical knowledge of construction methods, materials and building codes.                  Proficiency in reading and interpreting construction drawings, plans and specifications.                  Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively with multidisciplinary teams and stakeholders.                  Familiarity with construction management software (e.g. Procore, Primavera, Microsoft Project) is a plus.                  Willingness to work on-site and adapt to changing work conditions and schedules.          Qualifications :              Bachelor's degree in Civil Engineering, Construction Management or related field.                  3+ years of experience in construction, supervision of projects.

column2: Job Responsibility of Field Engineer Job Overview Position : Field Engineer Location : Pithampur, MP A Field Engineer will play a crucial role in providing technical support and expertise in the field. He will be responsible for overseeing the installation, maintenance, and troubleshooting of pre engineered building structure at various sites. Working closely with project coordinator, internal teams like logistics, production and external clients, he will ensure that projects are executed efficiently and meet quality standards. This role requires a combination of technical skills, problem-solving abilities, and effective communication. Key Responsibilities   1. Installation and Commissioning: Perform on-site installation, configuration, and commissioning of equipment or systems according to technical specifications and project requirements. Ensure proper setup and functionality before handing over to the client. 2. Technical Support: Provide technical support and assistance to clients and field technicians. Troubleshoot issues, diagnose problems, and implement solutions in a timely manner to minimize downtime and ensure optimal performance. 3. Maintenance and Repair: Conduct routine maintenance checks and inspections to identify potential issues or areas for improvement. Perform repairs, replacements, or upgrades as necessary to maintain equipment reliability and functionality. 4. Documentation: Maintain accurate records of installation activities, service reports, and equipment inventory. Document troubleshooting steps, solutions implemented, and any modifications made during field visits. 5. Quality Assurance: Ensure that all work meets quality standards and complies with relevant regulations and safety guidelines. Conduct quality checks and inspections to verify compliance with specifications and customer expectations. 6. Customer Interaction: Build and maintain positive relationships with clients, contractors, and other stakeholders. Address client inquiries, provide technical guidance, and ensure customer satisfaction throughout the project lifecycle. 7. Training and Knowledge Sharing: Provide training and guidance to field technicians and clients on the proper use, maintenance, and troubleshooting of equipment or systems. Share technical expertise and best practices to improve overall performance and efficiency. 8. Remote Support: Provide remote assistance and troubleshooting support to field technicians and clients as needed. Utilize remote access tools and diagnostic software to identify and resolve technical issues remotely. 9. Continuous Improvement: Identify opportunities for process improvement and efficiency gains in field operations. Collaborate with internal teams to implement changes, streamline workflows, and enhance service delivery. 10. Proven experience in a similar role, preferably in a field service or technical support environment. 11. Strong technical aptitude with hands-on experience in equipment installation, maintenance, and troubleshooting. 12. Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail. 13. Effective communication skills, both verbal and written. 14. Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a dynamic, fast-paced environment. 15. Willingness to travel to various job sites and work flexible hours as needed. 16. Knowledge of relevant industry standards, regulations, and safety protocols. 17. Proficiency in computer skills and familiarity with technical software tools. Experience 2  years and above in similar field.
column11: Installation And Commissioning, Remote Support, Documentation, Customer Interaction, Remote Monitoring, Maintenance and Repair, Continuous Improvement, Technical Support, Quality Assurance

column2: RCC AND FINISHING WORK PREFERRED     JOB PURPOSE: To carry out technical supervision of ongoing Civil & Finishing work at all stages.     DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES: Responsible for all finishing activities such as but not limited to block work & plastering, false ceiling, gypsum walls and painting, tiling and marble works, parquet flooring and landscaping. Preparing weekly and daily target schedules for all type of activities. To check the quality of all the materials received on site and prepare quality reports, defects, if any. Review requirements of the specification and relevant standards and ensure understandings and compliance of work done with the specified requirements of the specification and drawings. Carry out the specified inspection/test in accordance with relevant inspection/test plans, including the works of the subcontractors. Overall, supervision and coordination of General Foreman areas of responsibilities and the allocation of work areas. Follow-up to ensure execution of work is carried out in accordance with approved method statements. Follow-up with General Foreman efficient usage of materials to minimize wastage, and supervise materials storage area. Coordinates and monitors with subcontractors for their daily construction activities and their obligations and liaison with subcontractors. Review and certify the payment certificates for the subcontractors. Prepare Blueprints and Specifications. ... Manage Project Workflow. ... Develop Cost Estimates. ... Inspect Construction Sites. ... Provide Engineering Support. ... Prepare Project Report managing parts of construction projects overseeing building work undertaking surveys setting out sites checking technical designs and drawings to ensure that they are followed correctly supervising contracted staff ensuring project packages meet agreed specifications, budgets and/or timescales liaising with clients, subcontractors and other professional staff, especially quantity surveyors and the overall project manager providing technical advice and solving problems on site preparing site reports and filling in other paperwork liaising with quantity surveyors about the ordering and the pricing of materials ensuring that health and safety and sustainability policies and legislation are adhered to.     Skills/Competencies Comprehensive experience in structural and finishing works (jumping systems, slip forms, peri formworks, BBS checking, marble, ceramic, plaster, false ceiling, cladding works, paint, block works, screed, and waterproofing). Hands on experience in supervision, coordination with activity sequencing and handing over of works. Strong Finishing background with eye to detail. Ability to work with multiple discipline projects. Capable of reading drawings and schematics. Good interpersonal skill & a team player. Excellent Communication Skills .     How to Apply?   For more details contact on 8108192801.
column11: Finishing, RCC, Excel Powerpoint, construction chemical, Plastering, Plaster, Concrete, Marble, Stone

column2: Job Description:  We are seeking a highly experienced Senior Site Engineer to join our team. The ideal candidate will have 5-6 years of experience in site engineering, construction management, and project coordination. The Senior Site Engineer will be responsible for overseeing all aspects of construction activities on-site, ensuring compliance with project plans, specifications, and safety regulations. Responsibilities: Manage and supervise all on-site construction activities, including scheduling, resource allocation, and quality control. Coordinate with project managers, architects, subcontractors, and suppliers to ensure timely and efficient completion of projects. Interpret engineering drawings, plans, and specifications to ensure accuracy and adherence to project requirements. Conduct regular inspections and quality assurance checks to verify workmanship, materials, and compliance with building codes and standards. Monitor and track project progress, milestones, and budget expenditures, reporting any deviations or issues to the project team. Manage subcontractor and vendor relationships, including procurement, contract negotiation, and performance evaluation. Implement and enforce safety policies and procedures to maintain a safe work environment for all personnel on-site. Provide technical guidance and support to junior engineers, foremen, and construction crews as needed. Prepare and maintain accurate documentation, reports, and records related to construction activities, including daily progress reports, site diaries, and as-built drawings. Participate in project meetings, progress reviews, and client presentations as required.
column11: Civil Construction, Project Execution, Site Management, Site Supervision, Site Execution, Civil Engineering, Labour Control, Site Monitoring, Contractor Billing, Project Scheduling

column2: Job Description As a Supervisor for Machine Installation and Start-up in a Process Plant in India, you will play a vital role in overseeing the installation, testing, and commissioning of machinery and equipment within the plant environment. You will lead a team of technicians, ensuring that installations adhere to local regulations, safety standards, and cultural norms while aligning with project timelines and objectives. Responsibilities: Supervise and coordinate the installation, assembly, and alignment of machinery and equipment in compliance with Indian regulatory requirements and industry standards Lead a diverse team of technicians, fostering a collaborative and inclusive work environment while providing necessary training and support. Collaborate with local engineers and stakeholders to review installation plans, ensuring alignment with local regulations, standards, and cultural practices. Conduct thorough pre-commissioning checks and inspections, ensuring compliance with Indian regulatory bodies such as the Bureau of Indian Standards (BIS) and the Directorate General of Factory Advice Service and Labour Institutes (DGFASLI). Plan and oversee the start-up and commissioning process, considering factors such as voltage fluctuations, power supply reliability, and environmental conditions typical in the Indian context. Develop and maintain comprehensive documentation in English and any local languages as necessary, including installation procedures, equipment manuals, and safety protocols. Ensure strict adherence to health, safety, and environmental regulations, incorporating best practices to mitigate risks and promote a culture of safety among the team Monitor installation progress closely, addressing any challenges or delays promptly, and implementing strategies to keep installations on schedule and within budget. Maintain effective communication channels with project managers, stakeholders, and vendors, providing regular updates on progress and addressing any concerns or issues as they arise. Collaborate with local suppliers and vendors to procure materials, tools, and equipment, considering factors such as lead times, quality standards, and cost-effectiveness.   Qualifications Bachelor's degree in Mechanical Engineering, Electrical Engineering, or a related field. Additional certifications or training in project management and Indian regulatory compliance are desirable Minimum 5 years of experience in supervising machine installations in India, preferably within the manufacturing or process industry. Strong understanding of Indian regulatory requirements, including familiarity with BIS standards, DGFASLI regulations, and other relevant guidelines Excellent leadership and communication skills, with the ability to effectively manage a diverse team and communicate with stakeholders at all levels. Proficiency in English and any local languages spoken in the region where the plant is located Commitment to promoting a culture of safety and compliance with local regulations and industry standards. Strong problem-solving abilities, with a proactive approach to addressing challenges and implementing practical solutions Ability to adapt to cultural differences and work effectively in a diverse, multicultural environment. Strong organizational skills and attention to detail, with the ability to manage multiple tasks and priorities effectively. Flexibility to work non-standard hours and travel as required to support installation projects across different regions in India.

column1: SITE ENGINEER ( ASST To PROJECT MANAGER )
column2: ?         Pre-tendering Activities :    He shall go through various tender notices appearing in news papers. Select works from his angle which can be bidded, obtain their details such as work components, location time limit E.M.D., S.D., way of paying EMD and SD, dates of purchase-pre-bid-submission, pre-qualification criteria etc and put up before his superiors the list of such works with their details for their decision regarding bidding.           Check-list for site information :    After getting the decision regarding works to be quoted a checklist giving site details and other relevant information should be got filled in from he site engineer concerned.           Calling quotations for materials :    Rates for various materials shall be gathered by calling quotations.           Tender Cost Working :    On the basis of information gathered from site engineer and rate quotations of materials obtained, workable rates for each item of work in the tender shall be worked out. Total workable tender cost shall then be worked out. By adding the taxes and overheads the    biddable cost    shall be worked out. This cost shall be got approved from superiors/director           Submission of tender :    The tender duly completed along with relevant documents shall be submitted in time to the authority concerned.           Post tender submission activities:    The tender quoted if accepted by the authority for formalities in getting    Work Order    shall be followed up immediately.           Handing over documents to Project Manager :    After getting the work order the sets of copies of accepted tender documents with drawings shall be prepared. One such set shall be handed over to the concerned Project Manager immediately.

column2: Location:  Nagpur Experience:  1-3 Years Education:  Diploma / B.Tech in Civil Engineering We are seeking a talented Junior Engineer with proficiency in AutoCAD and a passion for building construction to join our team in Nagpur. The ideal candidate will assist in the design, drafting, and coordination of building projects, contributing to the successful execution of construction plans. Responsibilities: AutoCAD Drafting:  Create detailed drawings, plans, and layouts using AutoCAD software for building construction projects. Design Support:  Assist in the development and modification of building designs, incorporating architectural, structural, and MEP elements. Coordination:  Collaborate with project engineers, architects, and other stakeholders to ensure alignment of design drawings with project requirements. Quantity Estimation:  Prepare quantity take-offs and material schedules based on design drawings and project specifications. Documentation:  Maintain accurate project documentation, including drawings, revisions, and as-built records. Quality Assurance:  Review drawings for accuracy, completeness, and compliance with relevant codes and standards. Technical Support:  Provide support to project teams, answering queries related to drawings, specifications, and design details. Learning and Development:  Stay updated on industry trends, software updates, and best practices in building design and drafting. Requirements: Diploma or B.Tech in Civil Engineering, with a focus on building construction. 1-3 years of experience in architectural drafting and design, preferably in the construction industry. Proficiency in AutoCAD software, with the ability to create 2D and 3D drawings. Knowledge of building construction techniques, materials, and codes. Strong attention to detail and accuracy in drafting. Good communication and interpersonal skills. Ability to work effectively in a team environment and collaborate with multidisciplinary teams. Eagerness to learn and grow in the field of building design and construction. Advantageous Skills: Familiarity with other design software such as Revit, SketchUp, or Photoshop. Knowledge of BIM (Building Information Modeling) concepts. Experience in construction site supervision or project coordination.

column2: JOB DESCRIPTION FOR CIVIL SUPERVISOR As a Senior Civil Engineer, your primary responsibility is to oversee and manage the construction and maintenance of civil engineering projects (MEP). You will be responsible for coordinating and supervising a team of workers to ensure that projects are completed safely on time, and within budget. Your role will involve a combination of technical skills and leadership abilities. Responsibilities: 1.  Project Planning:  Communicate with engineers and project managers to develop project plans, including timelines, resource requirements. 2.  Team Management:  Supervise and provide guidance to a team of construction workers, ensuring that they are aware of their tasks and responsibilities. Delegate work assignments and monitor progress to ensure adherence to project schedules. 3.  Construction Oversight:  Oversee the construction activities on-site. Conduct regular inspections to identify and address any issues or deviations from plans. 4.  Resource Coordination:  Coordinate the procurement and allocation of resources, such as materials, equipment, and manpower, necessary for the successful execution of projects. Ensure that all required resources are available and utilized efficiently. 5.  Safety Compliance:  Enforce strict adherence to safety protocols and regulations to maintain a safe working environment. 6.  Documentation and Reporting:  Maintain accurate and up-to-date project documentation, including progress reports, daily activity logs. Prepare timely reports on project status, including any challenges or issues encountered. 7.  Client Communication:  Liaise with project holders regarding bill and fund, including engineers, contractors to provide updates on project progress, address concerns, and ensure effective communication throughout the project lifecycle. 8.  Cost Control:  Monitor project expenses, track costs, and identify areas for cost optimization. 9.  Continuous Improvement:  Stay technological advancements in the field of civil engineering. Identify opportunities for process improvement and propose innovative solutions to enhance project efficiency and quality. Requirements: Bachelor's degree in any stream (Science preferred). Should have minimum 3 years exp. in civil supervision. At least complete one Govt. project (Preferred work in JJM). Proven experience as a Civil Supervisor or a similar role in the Govt. Infrastructures. Strong knowledge of civil construction & MEP. Excellent leadership and team management skills. Proficient in Computer knowledge. Sound understanding of Govt. liaise. Effective communication and interpersonal skills. Strong problem-solving and decision-making abilities. Ability to work under pressure and meet project deadlines. Attention to detail and a commitment to delivering the project on time.
column11: civil supervision, Civil Construction, Civil Engineering

column2: Project Management: Planning, organizing, and coordinating all aspects of the project, from start to finish. This involves creating schedules, setting milestones, and assigning tasks to workers.      Resource Management: Allocating and managing resources such as labor, materials, equipment, and tools efficiently to ensure smooth project operations.      Supervision: Monitoring the work of subcontractors, laborers, and other personnel on-site to ensure that they are following project plans, specifications, and safety protocols.      Quality Control: Ensuring that the work being performed meets the required quality standards and specifications. This may involve conducting inspections and tests.      Safety Compliance: Enforcing and promoting a culture of safety on the construction site, ensuring that all workers follow safety regulations and protocols to prevent accidents and injuries.      Problem Solving: Identifying and addressing any issues or challenges that arise during the project, such as unexpected delays, design changes, or budget constraints.      Communication: Maintaining clear and effective communication with project stakeholders, including clients, architects, engineers, and management, to provide progress updates and address any concerns.        Graduate with 0-4 years experience from industries like Flooring/Road Construction / Industrial          Construction/Infrastructure          Exposure to Concrete Polishing          Willing to Work at Site Locations All Over India          Location:    Ready to travel as & when required as per Project Site PAN India

column2: MODI BUILDERS & INFRASTRUCTURES PVT LTD. is looking for Site Managers to join our dynamic team and embark on a rewarding career journey      As a Site Manager, you will be responsible for overseeing the operations and maintenance of a specific site or facility      Your role involves ensuring that the site operates efficiently, meets safety and regulatory standards, and delivers high-quality services to its users or tenants      You will also be responsible for managing personnel, budgets, and resources effectively to achieve organizational goals        Key Responsibilities:        Operations Management: Manage day-to-day operations of the site, including facility maintenance, security, and janitorial services, to ensure smooth functioning      Safety and Compliance: Ensure compliance with safety regulations and standards, conducting regular inspections and implementing corrective actions as necessary to maintain a safe working environment      Tenant or User Relations: Serve as the primary point of contact for tenants or users of the site, addressing their needs, resolving issues, and maintaining positive relationships to promote tenant satisfaction and retention      Budget Management: Develop and manage budgets for site operations, monitoring expenses and identifying cost-saving opportunities while ensuring optimal use of resources      Staff Supervision: Supervise site staff, including maintenance technicians, security personnel, and administrative staff, providing guidance, training, and performance feedback to ensure high productivity and morale      Vendor Management: Coordinate with external vendors and contractors for maintenance, repairs, and other services, negotiating contracts, and ensuring quality and cost-effectiveness of services rendered      Emergency Response: Develop and implement emergency response plans and procedures, conducting drills and training sessions to prepare staff for emergencies such as fires, natural disasters, or security threats      Environmental Sustainability: Implement and promote environmentally sustainable practices at the site, such as energy conservation, waste reduction, and recycling initiatives, to minimize environmental impact      Reporting and Documentation: Maintain accurate records of site activities, including maintenance logs, incident reports, and financial records, and prepare regular reports for management review      Continuous Improvement: Identify opportunities for process improvement and efficiency enhancements, implementing best practices and innovative solutions to optimize site operations

column2: Role & responsibilities     Project Management: Planning, organizing, and coordinating all aspects of the project, from start to finish. This involves creating schedules, setting milestones, and assigning tasks to workers. Resource Management: Allocating and managing resources such as labor, materials, equipment, and tools efficiently to ensure smooth project operations. Supervision: Monitoring the work of subcontractors, laborers, and other personnel on-site to ensure that they are following project plans, specifications, and safety protocols. Quality Control: Ensuring that the work being performed meets the required quality standards and specifications. This may involve conducting inspections and tests. Safety Compliance: Enforcing and promoting a culture of safety on the construction site, ensuring that all workers follow safety regulations and protocols to prevent accidents and injuries. Problem Solving: Identifying and addressing any issues or challenges that arise during the project, such as unexpected delays, design changes, or budget constraints. Communication: Maintaining clear and effective communication with project stakeholders, including clients, architects, engineers, and management, to provide progress updates and address any concerns.
column11: site supervision, Site Execution, Site Management, Site Monitoring

column2: Designing infrastructure projects: The Civil Engineer must develop plans and designs for infrastructure projects, taking into account factors such as cost, safety, environmental impact, and construction feasibility.     Analyzing data: The Civil Engineer must analyze data, such as survey reports, environmental impact studies, and geotechnical reports, to inform design decisions and ensure that projects meet relevant standards and regulations.     Managing projects: The Civil Engineer must manage infrastructure projects from start to finish, including overseeing construction, coordinating with contractors and other stakeholders, and ensuring that projects are completed on time and within budget.     Conducting site inspections: The Civil Engineer must conduct site inspections to ensure that construction work is being performed according to plans and specifications, and to identify and address any issues that arise.     Ensuring safety and compliance: The Civil Engineer must ensure that infrastructure projects are designed and constructed to meet relevant safety standards and regulations, and that appropriate permits and approvals are obtained.     Maintaining infrastructure: The Civil Engineer must oversee maintenance and repairs of existing infrastructure, ensuring that it remains safe and functional for its intended use.To be successful as a Civil Engineer, candidates should have strong analytical and problem-solving skills, as well as excellent communication and project management skills. They should also have a solid understanding of engineering principles and practices, and be familiar with relevant regulations and standards.

column2: Overview: We are seeking a dedicated and experienced Civil Site Supervisor to join our team. The Civil Site Supervisor will be responsible for overseeing all aspects of construction projects, ensuring they are completed safely, on time, and within budget. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in civil engineering, excellent leadership skills, and the ability to effectively communicate with team members, contractors, and clients. Responsibilities: Project Management: Manage and oversee all aspects of construction projects from start to finish, including planning, scheduling, budgeting, and resource allocation. Site Supervision: Supervise and coordinate construction activities on-site to ensure compliance with project specifications, safety standards, and regulatory requirements. Team Leadership: Provide leadership and direction to construction crews, subcontractors, and other personnel involved in the project. Delegate tasks effectively and ensure that all team members understand their roles and responsibilities. Quality Control: Monitor workmanship and quality of materials to ensure that construction meets industry standards and client expectations. Safety Compliance: Enforce safety protocols and procedures to create a safe working environment for all personnel on-site. Conduct regular safety inspections and address any safety concerns or violations promptly. Progress Reporting: Keep accurate records of project progress, including daily reports, inspection logs, and material quantities. Provide regular updates to project stakeholders on the status of construction activities. Problem Solving: Identify and resolve any issues or conflicts that may arise during construction, such as design changes, unexpected site conditions, or delays in material delivery. Client Relations: Maintain positive relationships with clients, architects, engineers, and other stakeholders throughout the project lifecycle. Address client concerns and ensure that their needs are met to the best of your ability. Cost Management: Monitor project costs and expenditures to ensure that construction stays within budget. Identify cost-saving opportunities and implement efficient construction practices where possible. Requirements: Bachelor's degree in Civil Engineering, Construction Management, or related field preferred. Proven experience as a Civil Site Supervisor or similar role in the construction industry. Strong knowledge of construction methods, materials, and techniques. Excellent leadership and communication skills, with the ability to effectively manage and motivate a diverse team. Thorough understanding of safety regulations and best practices in construction. Proficiency in project management software and Microsoft Office Suite. Ability to read and interpret blueprints, drawings, and specifications. Valid driver's license and willingness to travel to different job sites as needed. Certification in First Aid/CPR and OSHA 30-Hour Construction Safety Training a plus.
column11: Execution, Communication Skills, Quality Management, Labour Management, Construction knowledge

column2: Responsible for Fabrication, testing and erection of process and utility piping during execution of a project in close and efficient coordination between site engineering manager, site planning engineer, piping contractor and engineering contractor (EPCM).      Overview/ Responsibilities:          As a Piping Engineer , you will be expected to: contractor critically along with planning engineer deputed at site during construction phase     Identifies planned activities for various contractors / subcontractors for short term and medium term Holds meetings with counterpart/ project manager to ascertain that they are providing adequate men and machinery to complete the work as per planned activities     Ensures that persons deployed by the contractor are having adequate skills and experience to carry out the requisite work (welder qualification; IBR certification) Interfaces with detailed engineering contractor - wherever necessary- to resolve the technical issues and help the progress of piping fabrication/ erection     Close watch on any design change request or specification waivers requested by contractor and accepting/ rejecting them through proper change management mechanism and maintains records for all such changes approved during execution of the project             Understands and explains contract terms to all concerned and deviations if any are brought to the notice of project manager and resolved accordingly.      Supervision and Progress Monitoring Close supervision of actual fabrication, testing and erection. Ensures that all the quality checks are carried out as per the project specifications/ quality plans and proper records are maintained.      Interacts with lead lead engineers of construction contractor to monitor progress that is achieved vis -a- vis planned progress. Raises the flags wherever delays are anticipated and ensure that contractors take necessary corrective / pre-emptive actions to adhere to schedule      Safety & Environment Works very closely with project manager, site construction manager, site safety engineer and construction contractor so that project safety and environment policy is adhered to in totality during all phases of construction; pre commissioning and commissioning.      Statutory Approvals Assists project manager and site construction manager in preparing necessary documentation for obtaining various statutory approvals      Cost Optimisation Always looks for opportunities to optimize the quantities and materials to minimize the cost in consultation with Project Manager/RCM.      Reports Generates periodic reports highlighting areas of concern and identifying the actions which need to be taken and shares the same with project manager and site construction manager.      Bachelor s degree in engineering (Mechanical) with a specialization in piping (preferred; but not a must)      Minimum 18 to 20 years of experience in the field of management of piping fabrication and erection in an EPC environment for chemical / petrochemical/ refinery units.      Exposure to working as an owner s engineer will be an advantage.      He must have some knowledge of mechanical, chemical, civil, electrical and instrumentation engineering so as to discuss and understand requirements and problems with engineers in these fields.      He must be aware of various standards, codes and practices.          Technical /Functional Expertise:            Good knowledge of all the stages of project execution activities (process plant) with an emphasis on piping fabrication, testing and erection activities        Excellent proficiency in reading and understanding all the construction drawings related to piping (isometric, hook ups, standard and special supports, piping GAs, underground drawings, 3D model)     Insight into construction and erection under other disciplines (instrumentation, civil, mechanical, electrical etc) and their interdependence during construction is a must     Good working knowledge of planning, detailed engineering , management of changes during detailed construction     Good knowledge of overall sequence and methodology of EPC execution of a chemical project     Aware of all environment regulations and statutory requirements     Reasonably good knowledge of various national and international design codes and practices (including those for safety)     Very good knowledge of various statutory requirements (PESO, IBR regulations, factory inspector approvals , DISH approvals etc)      Excellent command over written and verbal communication     Excellent management skills
column11: Fabrication, Change management, Construction, Instrumentation, EPC, Site planning, Refinery, Machinery, Monitoring, Petrochemical

column2: We are looking to employ a dedicated and experienced Site Supervisor to oversee construction projects and supervise the construction team.      The Site Supervisor s responsibilities include ordering building supplies, scheduling equipment maintenance as needed, and training new construction employees.      You should also be able to perform first aid in emergencies.      To be successful as a Site Supervisor, you should be detail-oriented and knowledgeable of building codes and construction safety regulations.      Ultimately, an outstanding Site Supervisor should be able to interpret building plans as well as demonstrate exceptional leadership, communication, and problem-solving skills.      Site Supervisor Responsibilities:      Inspecting construction sites regularly to identify and eliminate potential safety hazards.      Supervising and instructing the construction team as well as subcontractors.      Educating site workers on construction safety regulations and accident protocol.      Enforcing site safety rules to minimize work-related accidents and injuries.      Handling site accidents in accordance with established accident protocol.      Maintaining an accurate record of construction employee attendance.      Evaluating the performance of construction employees and instituting disciplinary measures as needed.      Analyzing blueprints to ensure that construction projects meet design, safety, and budget specifications.      Recommending changes to construction operations or procedures to increase efficiency.      Site Supervisor Requirements:      Bachelor s degree in Construction Management, Construction Science, Civil Engineering or related field is preferred.      Proven experience working as a Site Supervisor.      Sound knowledge of building codes and construction safety regulations.      Working knowledge of construction tools and equipment.      The ability to interpret blueprints.      Outstanding leadership skills.      Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.      Excellent organizational and communication skills.
column11: Construction, Construction operations, Analytical, Scheduling, Construction safety, Equipment maintenance, Budgeting, Construction management, Civil engineering, Site Supervisor

column2: Project Planning: Project Engineers participate in the initial project planning phase     They work with stakeholders to define project objectives, scope, and deliverables     They develop project schedules, budgets, and resource allocation plans     Design and Development: Depending on the field (civil engineering, mechanical engineering, electrical engineering, etc), Project Engineers may be involved in designing systems, structures, components, or products     They collaborate with design teams, draft plans, and ensure compliance with relevant codes and standards     Coordination: Project Engineers serve as the point of contact between different teams, departments, and stakeholders involved in the project     They facilitate communication and collaboration to ensure everyone is working toward the same goals     Resource Management: Project Engineers allocate and manage resources such as personnel, materials, equipment, and budget     They monitor resource utilization and make adjustments as needed to keep the project on track     Risk Management: Identifying potential risks and developing strategies to mitigate them is a crucial aspect of a Project Engineer's role     They anticipate challenges, implement risk reduction measures, and develop contingency plans     Quality Assurance: Project Engineers are responsible for maintaining the quality of work throughout the project lifecycle     They establish quality control processes, conduct inspections, and ensure that work meets specifications and standards

budgetary constraints      Progress Tracking and Reporting: Monitor project progress against the established schedule and milestones      Generate regular reports, including progress updates, cost status, and resource utilization      Highlight any deviations from the plan and propose corrective actions      Billing and Invoicing: Prepare accurate billing statements and invoices based on the project milestones and contractual agreements      Coordinate with the finance department to ensure timely payment collection and resolve any billing-related issues      Documentation: Maintain project documentation, including project plans, cost estimates, progress reports, and change orders      Ensure all project-related documentation is up-to-date, organized, and easily accessible      Stakeholder Communication: Liaise with project stakeholders, such as clients, contractors, and suppliers, to provide regular updates on project status, costs, and billing matters      Address any queries or concerns raised by stakeholders promptly and professionally        Qualifications:        Education:A bachelor's degree in engineering, construction management, or a related field is typically required      Additional certifications or courses in project management, cost estimation, or planning can be advantageous      Technical Skills: Proficiency in project management software tools (eg, Primavera P6, Microsoft Project) and cost estimation software      Strong knowledge of project planning techniques, scheduling, and resource management

column2: Job Description       ?Ensure quality and accuracy of designs. Offer suggestions to assist in the efficiency of works. Produce Hand sketches & Carry out and check design calculations. Ensure compliance with project Design Criteria/Client Brief/Approved Concept.     ?Check documentation complies with design. Attend design, clients, architects and site meetings. Ensure compliance with program constraints and budget; and maintain Quality Procedure Manual. Other duties and responsibilities as reasonably required by the Team Leader/Division Manager.     ?Job Responsibility: As a result of the continuing growth of our Design and Engineering business, our Civil and Structural Engineering team in Bangalore, Chennai and Mumbai are seeking to recruit an experienced Principal Structural Engineer. This new appointment is part of our aspiration to develop and grow our structural team in India. This role will allow the right candidate to play a leading role in some of the most challenging and exciting engineering projects in the world. The successful candidate will have a proven track record in the management and production of engineering / technical deliverables on a range of multi-disciplinary projects of varying scales and levels of complexity. You will be responsible for overall Civil and Structural Engineering technical delivery within the Bangalore, Chennai and Mumbai Offices, providing all necessary technical direction, resourcing, mentoring and assurance of structural engineering within Bangalore, Chennai and Mumbai offices.      Credibility, competence, agility and technical excellence are a given as the role requires close working with our internal and external clients, decision makers, industry stakeholders and other consultants to develop robust design solutions through collaborative and proactive management of client demands - providing leadership from both a technical delivery and people management perspective is imperative. You will be a Structural Engineer with a proven track record of successful technical and commercial delivery of design projects from feasibility through to completion of construction/handover. You will be required to demonstrate a developed understanding of the market and industry and ability to focus our business to take full advantage of market conditions and have experience in assisting with the preparation of bids and tendering opportunities, where required. Our offices provides multi-disciplinary design and engineering services and integrated solutions across a wide range of sectors. This appointment offers a challenging and rewarding opportunity to apply knowledge, experience and problem solving skills to assist with leading and developing our business, from a technical perspective.     ?Desired Profile: --Candidate must possess at least a Bachelors Degree, Post Graduate Diploma, Professional Degree, Masters Degree, Engineering (Civil) or equivalent. --At least 5 years of working experience in the related field is required for this position.      --Preferably Senior Executives specializing in Engineering - Civil/Construction/Structural or equivalent.

Assist site managers and other site staff in preparing site specific EHS Risk Assessment, method statements, emergency response plans, etc.         Identify site specific Customer EHS requirements and support site team in fulfilling the same.          Ensure contractor s EHS engagement based on their past EHS Evaluation roadmap, meetings, walk through, promotional program etc.         Conduct site kick off meeting with Contractor and site team before start of work activities.         Check all tools and tackles, equipment of Contractor before use.         Conduct site walk downs, identify unsafe act/conditions and take necessary actions.         Verify Permit to Work compliance, conduct work specific Toolbox Talk, carry out last minute risk assessment before start of work.         Verify the healthiness of various equipment, tools, lifting tools/tackles etc. used at site.      ?         Identify training needs, prepare EHS training calendar for the duration of site and monitor the implementation of training plan. Conduct trainings at start of site and regular intervals.     ?         Communicate to SM / PM any changes in legal and other requirements and ensure Legal register is kept updated throughout the duration of the contract.         Monthly EHS performance reporting to BU EHS.     ?         Assist the site management in planning and implementing mitigating measures necessary with respect to EHS. Assist the Project team to ensure EHS targets & guidelines are implemented.         Enforce EHS requirements at site. Wherever imminent risk to the life, stop the work.           ?

column2: Qualification:        B.E. Civil         Purpose:   Responsible to complete and handover the allotted building in given schedule with standard SOP.   To ensure overall Execution of work and provide technical support to subordinates.   To complete assigned building with required quality parameters on time.     Main Responsibilities   1) Monitoring    To execute all ongoing activities with help of subordinates as per SOP.   To monitor junior staff contractors manpower to achieve scheduled dates.   To find out bottlenecks prior to executing upcoming activities and discuss the same with seniors concerns.     2) Training Development    To train explain proper specified working methodology to the contractors workers.     3) Planning   To prepare schedule of activities and plan to complete as per the final dates.    To review the plan of resources on timely basis - manpower, material machinery.     4) Billing   To check contractors bill on weekly basis or as per work progress.   To do the work done entry on weekly basis in ERP.     5) Quality control   To communicate start up project activities specified methodology to contractor subordinates.   To study contractors work order, company Quality Management ProcessDrawing carefully to avoid non compliances.   To prepare compliance report of QA/QC department and to complete activities in 7 days.     6) Documentation   To maintain daily work progress report manpower report.   To maintain all drawing folder, records in proper manner as per GFC.   To keep record of billing work done files in secured manner.     7) Safety   To implement the safety plan prepared by safety officer at site.    To ensure all tools and equipment are adequate and safe for use.   To ensure safety guidelines being followed at work locations including provisions of construction safety manual prepared by Safety officer.    To ensure all workers are wearing right type of safety gears like helmets, jackets, gloves, etc And maintain record of the same.   To ensure child labour is not engaged at site   To facilitate safety audit to be conducted by safety officer.    To issue work permit to contractors based on undertaking and application submitted by contractor.    To keep building building premises clean neat manner.   To participate in the safety review with safety officer PM.   To be primarily responsible from SKYi for safety of all the people at allotted work location.    To enforce stop work for a activity / contractor / location in case safety guidelines are not being followed.   To comply with safety observation / non compliance issued by safety officer before recommencement of particular activity.     8) Reconciliation   To avoid wastage of material like cement, sand, tile, steel excess than the specified limit.    To maintain proper record of the issued material do proper reconciliation.   To support audit person at the time of monthly stock checking reconciliation.

column2: Trustegic is looking for SHIFT ENGINEER to join our dynamic team and embark on a rewarding career journey      A Shift Engineer, also known as a Shift Technician or Maintenance Engineer, is responsible for overseeing the operations and maintenance of equipment, systems, and facilities during a specific shift      Their role involves monitoring, troubleshooting, and maintaining the smooth functioning of machinery and infrastructure      Here are some key responsibilities of a Shift Engineer:Equipment Monitoring and Maintenance: Shift Engineers continuously monitor the performance of equipment, machinery, and systems within their assigned area      They conduct regular inspections, perform preventive maintenance tasks, and address any issues or malfunctions that may arise      This includes repairing or replacing faulty components, conducting routine lubrication and calibration, and ensuring equipment is operating within specified parameters      Troubleshooting and Repair: When equipment malfunctions or breaks down, Shift Engineers are responsible for diagnosing and troubleshooting the problem      They use their technical expertise and problem-solving skills to identify the root cause of issues and implement effective solutions      This may involve repairing or replacing faulty parts, adjusting settings, or coordinating with external contractors for more complex repairs      Safety and Compliance: Shift Engineers ensure compliance with safety protocols and regulations      They conduct regular safety inspections, identify and address potential hazards, and take corrective actions to mitigate risks      They also follow standard operating procedures and adhere to relevant regulations and guidelines      Emergency Response: In the event of an emergency or equipment failure, Shift Engineers are responsible for taking immediate action to resolve the issue      They assess the situation, implement emergency procedures, and coordinate with other team members or external resources to minimize downtime and ensure the safety of personnel and equipment      Record Keeping and Documentation: Shift Engineers maintain accurate records of maintenance activities, equipment performance, repairs, and other relevant information      They document work orders, log maintenance activities, update equipment manuals, and create reports on equipment downtime, maintenance costs, and productivity metrics
column11: standard operating procedures, repair, preventive maintenance, maintenance engineering, equipment maintenance, engineering, breakdown maintenance, operations, plant maintenance, maintenance activities, mechanical maintenance, machinery, inspection

column2: We are looking to employ a dedicated and experienced site supervisor to oversee construction projects and supervise the construction team.     The site supervisors responsibilities include ordering building supplies, scheduling equipment maintenance as needed, and training new construction employees.      You should also be able to perform first aid in emergencies.      To be successful as a site supervisor, you should be detail-oriented and knowledgeable of building codes and construction safety regulations.     Ultimately, an outstanding site supervisor should be able to interpret building plans as well as demonstrate exceptional leadership, communication, and problem-solving skills.            Job Requirement           Inspecting construction sites regularly to identify and eliminate potential safety hazards.         Supervising and instructing the construction team as well as subcontractors.         Maintaining the records of inward material.         Handling site accidents in accordance with established accident protocol.         Maintaining an accurate record of construction employee attendance.         Evaluating the performance of construction employees and instituting disciplinary measures as needed.         Analyzing blueprints to ensure that construction projects meet design, safety, and budget specifications.         Recommending changes to construction operations or procedures to increase efficiency.         Ensure the attendance of all the labours and workers.         Maintain the work as per the prescribed guideline         Ensure the work quality as per the commitment.         Ensure the timeline of the project is as per the requirement.     Completion of a post-secondary education construction training program.     Bachelors degree in construction management, construction science, civil engineering, or a related field is preferred.     Proven experience working as a site supervisor.     CPR and first aid certifications.     Sound knowledge of building codes and construction safety regulations.     Working knowledge of construction tools and equipment.     The ability to interpret blueprints.     Outstanding leadership skills.     Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.     Excellent organisational and communication skills
