column2: The Site Supervisor will play a crucial role in ensuring the successful execution of projects, overseeing construction activities, and ensuring adherence to safety and quality standards. If you are a skilled leader with a solid background in construction and a passion for delivering outstanding results, this position offers an excellent opportunity to grow your career within our dynamic organization.       Responsibilities:     1. Leadership and Management:   - Supervise and lead a team of construction workers, subcontractors, and other staff members efficiently and effectively.   - Assign tasks and duties to team members and ensure they are carried out to meet project deadlines.   - Lead by example, motivating and inspiring team members to strive for excellence in performance, productivity, and quality.   - Conduct regular performance evaluations, provide feedback, and mentor team members for continuous improvement.   - Develop and nurture a positive and collaborative work environment.     2. Project Planning and Execution:   - Collaborate with project managers to develop detailed project plans, considering project requirements, timelines, and resources.   - Coordinate and schedule construction activities, ensuring all parties involved are aware of their responsibilities and deadlines.   - Oversee the procurement and delivery of necessary equipment, materials, and tools.   - Monitor project progress, identify and resolve any issues or conflicts, and ensure projects are delivered on time and within budget.   - Conduct regular inspections, quality control checks, and enforce compliance with safety regulations and company policies.     3. Communication and Collaboration:   - Establish effective communication channels with project stakeholders, including clients, architects, engineers, and other contractors.   - Provide regular updates to project managers and other team members regarding project progress, challenges, and risks.   - Resolve conflicts or disputes that may arise during construction activities, ensuring open and transparent communication.   - Collaborate with the project management team to troubleshoot and find solutions to any unexpected challenges during construction.     4. Safety and Compliance:   - Ensure all construction activities comply with safety regulations, building codes, and legal requirements.   - Identify potential hazards and take immediate action to mitigate risks, maintaining a safe work environment for all workers.   - Promote and enforce a strong safety culture among all team members, emphasizing the importance of following safety protocols and procedures.       Qualifications:     - A minimum of X years of experience in construction, with a proven track record as a site supervisor or similar leadership role.   - Sound knowledge of construction processes, best practices, and building codes.   - Strong leadership and communication skills to effectively manage and motivate teams.   - Exceptional organizational and problem-solving abilities to manage multiple tasks simultaneously.   - Excellent attention to detail and ability to ensure the highest standard of quality.   - Ability to read and interpret project plans, blueprints, and technical drawings.   - Proficiency in using construction management software and technology tools.
column11: Procurement, Site management, Manager Quality Assurance, Project management, Billing, Project planning, Manager Quality Control, Continuous improvement, Construction management, Civil engineering

column2: Site management is responsible of providing complete project execution support through project life cycle globally.      Vanderlande is the global market leader in baggage handling systems for airports, and sorting systems for parcel and postal services. The company is also a leading supplier of warehouse automation solutions. With a consistently increasing order intake of more than 2.8 billion euros, it has established a global reputation over the past six decades as a highly reliable partner for value-added automated material handling solutions.      We are looking for a Site Supervisor for Global projects. You will be part of the team that Lead and Support project execution across the Globe.              Your position:          As a Site Supervisor your role is to lead the site execution work and supervise multiple Site Supervisors (Mechanical/ Electrical) and multiple teams of contractors for mechanical and electrical work. And, in parallel, he will work with the project, procurement, Safety, Engineering, and Field Quality team for better Planning, Site Procurements, Safety Implementation, Engineering changes, and to maintain Vanderlande's standard of execution.          Job Description:          Supervision of the Mechanical, electrical and control installation, guide, and train in Electro-Mechanical installation teams.      Inspect and diagnose complex mechanical/electrical systems      Interpret engineering drawings in reference to layout, location, and operation of the system(s).      Should have hand on experience with AutoCAD, Navis and E. Plan drawing.      Should possess conceptual knowledge of PLC systems (Siemens), different type of hardware s, Communication protocols (Profinet, Ethernet, Profibus, ASI).      Should have knowledge of different types of Switch gears, Drives and RLC circuits.      Should have knowledge of I/O testing.      Support the commissioning, testing and integration of material handling system      Managing the quality inspections for the installed equipment with focus on the electrical installation.      You ensure in close coordination with our engineers that the equipment is installed in accordance with the specification.      Support for the site handover and conduct surveys for installation areas.      Aware of our contract and responsibilities and identify deviations.      Reporting progress to the site manager and project manager.      Join progress meetings      Responsible for the electrical and control installation progress on site and ensure to meet the program milestones      Responsible for the site safety and quality of the installed electrical and control equipment      Responsible for daily, weekly, and monthly installation reports and toolbox talk with supervisor team.      Cooperate with your project manager in the establishment of policies and procedures related to Field Support              Desired profile:          Bachelor's degree in electrical/ Mechanical engineering, mechatronics.      6 to 8 years experience in handling WS/ Parcel or Airport system.      Experience of different type of sorters (Line/Loop Sorters) are preferable.      General PLC programming or troubleshooting certification      Safety certification line IOSH, Emergency preparedness training.          Travel:          Need to Travel 70% or more.          Base Location:          Pune India.          Mandatory Skills:          Leadership and presentation skills including relentless problem solving, results orientation      Should have positive approach, right attitude etc.      Ability to effectively lead and work under pressure,      Ability to work constructively with all stakeholders, building both internal and external relationships.      Proficiency in the application of computerized systems, including standard business applications (i.e., MS Office)      Effective verbal and written communications skills      Negotiation skill and commercial experience to manage contract scope changes directly with clients, suppliers      Demonstrated organizational skills, and company ethics      Strong bias for following processes and continual process improvement

column2: Roles and Responsibilities In this role, you will administer physical construction execution operations for the site. The Site supervisor should have good experience in Residential and commercial building construction including civil, finishing, interior, fit-outs, exterior, infrastructure, etc. The Site supervisors should have the ability to read and understand the Architectural-RCC-MEP Drawings. Coordination with contractor, site team, and Seniors to timely completion of site activities, etc. The Site supervisor must have extensive knowledge of RCC (Reinforcement Concrete) structure execution and its sequences, which should be checked and supervised accordingly. The Site supervisor Should have the ability to execute and check step-by-step Civil and finishing sequences and quality of work such as checking of various superstructure membranes shuttering work, Columns/Beam/Slab/etc. Membranes concreting work line-level-plumb etc., Overall Finishing work quality checking as per thumb rules. Ensure that the assigned work is completed as per the schedule by coordinating amongst the team members, contractors, and consultants. The site supervisor should have knowledge of taking measurements of various civil and finishing work activities, Contractor Bill checking, and measurement verification. Maintain all the desired records at the site like inventory management, RIF register, drawing register, non-compliance register, etc. Identify slippages/delays and initiate corrective action. Knowledge of construction safety and its precautions. Organizing materials and ensuring sites are safe and clean. Providing technical advice and suggestions for improvement on particular projects. Completing quality assurance and providing feedback to the team. Ensure minimum Wastage during civil and finishing work executions on site. Management of Day-to-day operation of various construction activities at the site and Daily report to the Project Head at the Head office. Above is the scope of work but not limited to your post, even then any other work assigned by the Head of the Department will come under the Site supervisor and he has to do it responsibly. Preferably having good knowledge of computer operation and practice in Software MS Office includes Word-Excel-Power point, Internet, etc.  Desired Candidate Profile Experienced Supervisors having good experience in Residential and Commercial building construction including civil, finishing, interior, fit-outs, exterior, infrastructure, etc. Job Benefits & Perks

column2: Skills           MS office             Autocad             Leadership                     1. Quality Control: Conducting quality inspections of finished products or structures to ensure they meet established standards and specifications. This includes checking for defects, verifying measurements, and assessing the overall appearance.           2. Project Coordination: Collaborating with project managers, architects, engineers, and other stakeholders to coordinate the finishing phase of construction or manufacturing projects. This involves creating work schedules, coordinating resources, and ensuring timely completion.           3. Material Selection: Recommending appropriate finishing materials, such as paints, coatings, flooring, and fixtures, based on project requirements, budget constraints, and aesthetic considerations. Ensuring that the chosen materials meet quality standards and are compatible with the project specifications.           4. Supervision: Managing and supervising a team of workers involved in the finishing phase. This includes assigning tasks, providing guidance, monitoring progress, and ensuring compliance with safety regulations and project guidelines.           5. Troubleshooting: Identifying and resolving any issues or challenges that arise during the finishing phase. This may involve addressing defects, coordinating rework, or implementing corrective measures to achieve the desired quality standards.           6. Documentation: Maintaining accurate records and documentation related to the finishing phase, such as inspection reports, quality control records, and material specifications. Ensuring compliance with legal and regulatory requirements.           7. Communication: Regularly communicating with project stakeholders, including clients, contractors, and suppliers, to provide progress updates, address concerns, and manage expectations. Actively participating in meetings and discussions related to the projects finishing phase.           8. Continuous Improvement: Identifying opportunities for process improvements, cost-saving measures, or enhanced efficiency in the finishing phase. Implementing best practices, new technologies, or innovative techniques to optimize the quality and productivity of the finishing processes.           9. Health and Safety: Ensuring a safe working environment for the finishing team by adhering to health and safety guidelines, promoting the use of personal protective equipment, and addressing potential hazards or risks in the workplace.           10. Budget Management: Monitoring and managing the budget allocated for the finishing phase. Tracking expenses, controlling costs, and making recommendations to optimize resource utilization without compromising quality.           Qualification : BE Civil, or any equivalent degree.     ?
column11: AutoCAD, Project management, Billing, MEP, Material selection, Manager Quality Control, MS Office, Troubleshooting, Continuous improvement, Monitoring

column2: Project Management: Planning, organizing, and coordinating all aspects of the project, from start to finish. This involves creating schedules, setting milestones, and assigning tasks to workers.      Resource Management: Allocating and managing resources such as labor, materials, equipment, and tools efficiently to ensure smooth project operations.      Supervision: Monitoring the work of subcontractors, laborers, and other personnel on-site to ensure that they are following project plans, specifications, and safety protocols.      Quality Control: Ensuring that the work being performed meets the required quality standards and specifications. This may involve conducting inspections and tests.      Safety Compliance: Enforcing and promoting a culture of safety on the construction site, ensuring that all workers follow safety regulations and protocols to prevent accidents and injuries.      Problem Solving: Identifying and addressing any issues or challenges that arise during the project, such as unexpected delays, design changes, or budget constraints.      Communication: Maintaining clear and effective communication with project stakeholders, including clients, architects, engineers, and management, to provide progress updates and address any concerns.        Graduate with 4-10 years experience in relevant Industries like Flooring/Road Construction/Industrial Construction/Infrastructure          Exposure to Concrete Polishing          Willing to Work at Site Locations All Over India          Location: Ready to travel as & when required as per Project Site PAN India

column2: We are seeking an experienced and capable Civil Foreman/Supervisor to oversee and manage civil construction projects      The ideal candidate should have 10-15 years of relevant experience in the construction industry, with a proven track record of successfully leading teams and delivering projects on time and within budget      As a Civil Foreman/Supervisor, you will play a pivotal role in ensuring the efficient and safe execution of construction activities            Responsibilities:      Project Planning and Coordination:        Collaborate with project managers and stakeholders to understand project scope, objectives, and timelines.      Assist in creating detailed work schedules and resource allocation plans.      Coordinate with other teams, subcontractors, and suppliers to ensure smooth project execution.        Team Management and Leadership:        Supervise and lead a team of construction workers and subcontractors.      Assign tasks and responsibilities to team members, providing clear instructions and guidance.      Ensure that the team maintains high levels of productivity and work quality.        Construction Execution:        Oversee the implementation of civil construction activities as per approved plans and specifications.      Monitor progress and ensure that work is carried out efficiently and in compliance with safety standards.      Address any issues or challenges that arise during the construction process.        Quality Control and Safety:        Implement and enforce quality control measures to ensure work meets the required standards.      Promote and maintain a safe working environment, adhering to all safety regulations and practices.      Conduct regular safety inspections and address safety concerns promptly.        Material and Equipment Management:        Coordinate with procurement teams to ensure timely availability of construction materials and equipment.      Manage inventory and oversee the proper utilization of resources to minimize wastage.        Documentation and Reporting:        Maintain accurate and up-to-date records of work progress, labor, and material usage.      Prepare regular progress reports and communicate project status to higher management.        Problem Solving and Decision Making:        Identify and resolve construction-related issues in a timely and effective manner.      Make informed decisions to keep the project on track and within budget.        Requirements:        Proven experience as a Civil Foreman/Supervisor in the construction industry (10-15 years).      Strong knowledge of civil construction practices, techniques, and materials.      Ability to read and interpret construction plans and drawings.      Excellent leadership and communication skills.      Demonstrated ability to manage and motivate a diverse workforce.      Understanding of safety regulations and procedures.      Diploma or degree in Civil Engineering or a related field preferred.

column2: Role & responsibilities  -  you will be responsible for conducting surveys and providing accurate measurements and data for construction of road projects. This is a mid-level position requiring 4 to 5 years of experience. The job responsibilities will include -    Conduct detailed surveys of land intended for road construction, including topographic surveys and boundary delineation. Utilize surveying equipment such as total stations, GPS receivers, and drones to accurately measure and map terrain. Assess the suitability of land for road construction, identifying potential obstacles, drainage issues, and environmental concerns. Set alignment and grading for roads in coordination with engineering plans and specifications. Establish control points, benchmarks, and reference markers to guide construction activities. Measure and record quantities of materials required for road construction, such as asphalt, gravel, and concrete. Monitor construction progress to ensure compliance with approved plans and specifications. Conduct quality control checks on construction materials and workmanship. Maintain accurate records of survey data, construction progress, and any deviations from original plans. Preferred candidate profile  -   Bachelor's degree in surveying, civil engineering, or related field. Proven experience in land surveying, particularly in road construction projects. Proficiency in using surveying equipment and software for data collection and analysis. Strong knowledge of surveying techniques, principles, and practices. Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills. Attention to detail and accuracy in survey measurements and data interpretation. Effective communication and teamwork skills. Perks and benefits  -  Best in the industry  .

column2: This role involves supervisors to manage and coordinate projects, oversee installation and commissioning activities along with managing site team and subcontractors and ensuring safety practices at work place.         Main Responsibilities:           Safety Inspections:    Conduct regular inspections of the work area to identify and correct potential safety hazards.       Enforcement of Safety Policies:    Enforce adherence to safety protocols and procedures established by regulatory agencies and company policies.       Training and Education   : Conduct toolbox talk and provide safety training to employees and contractors on safe working practices and procedures.       Accident Investigation:    Investigate accidents or incidents to determine their root cause and implement corrective actions to prevent recurrence.       Safety Documentation   : Maintain records of safety inspections, training sessions, and incidents. Implementation of Safety compliance adherence and Daily toolbox talk with the installation vendor.       Safety Equipment Management   : Ensure availability and proper use of safety equipment like helmets, harnesses, goggles, etc       Emergency Response Planning:    Develop and implement emergency response plans for various scenarios like fires, chemical spills, or injuries.       Coordination:    Coordination between contractor the client and to collaborate with project managers, engineers, and contractors to address safety concerns and implement safety measures.       Safety Meetings:    Conduct regular safety meetings with site team and management to discuss safety issues and improvements.       Review:    Material verification as per the approved makes and PDI checklist and review of storage conditions for material and installation activities.       Planning:    Work-front allocation and site planning by witnessing all functionality tests conducted by the vendor.         Qualifications and Skills:         A degree or diploma in Occupational Health and Safety from a recognized institute.     4-6 years of experience in supervision and site coordination of MEP projects , electrical installation, construction activities in industries or similar field is preferred.     Understanding of Safety regulations and codes set forth by relevant authorities (OSHA, ANSI, etc).     Strong verbal and written communication skills to effectively convey Safety procedures and concerns.     Ability to identify Safety risks and develop solutions to mitigate them.     Keen observation skills to spot potential hazards and ensure compliance with Safety standards.     Capability to lead and motivate teams towards a culture of Safety and compliance.         Skills:         Well-versed in preparing Gantt chart, project trackers, MS Office, Excel, PMS applications for documentation and reporting.
column11: Accident investigation, Excel, Compliance, Safety training, Consulting, MEP, Occupational health, Site planning, ANSI, Safety Supervisor

column2: Roles and Responsibilities   We are seeking a qualified Civil and Structural Supervisor to oversee construction projects within the oil and gas industry. The ideal candidate will have 3-6 years of relevant work experience and a strong understanding of civil and structural engineering principles. Responsibilities: Supervise and coordinate civil and structural construction activities, ensuring adherence to project specifications, safety standards, and quality requirements. Manage and lead a team of construction workers, subcontractors, and vendors to achieve project milestones within budget and schedule constraints. Conduct regular inspections and audits to monitor work progress, identify potential issues, and implement corrective actions as necessary. Review and approve construction drawings, designs, and engineering documents to ensure compliance with industry standards and regulatory requirements. Collaborate with project managers, engineers, and other stakeholders to resolve technical challenges, optimize construction processes, and mitigate risks. Prepare reports, progress updates, and documentation to communicate project status, achievements, and challenges to senior management and clients. Foster a culture of safety, quality, and continuous improvement among the construction team, promoting best practices and lessons learned. Stay updated on industry trends, technologies, and best practices related to civil and structural engineering in the oil and gas sector. Qualifications: Bachelor's degree in Civil Engineering, Structural Engineering, or a related field. 3-6 years of relevant experience in civil and structural construction, preferably within the oil and gas industry. Strong knowledge of construction techniques, materials, and equipment used in civil and structural projects. Familiarity with relevant codes, standards, and regulations governing construction activities in the oil and gas sector (e.g., API, ASCE, ACI). Excellent leadership, communication, and interpersonal skills, with the ability to effectively collaborate with multidisciplinary teams. Proficiency in project management tools and software for scheduling, budgeting, and reporting (e.g., Primavera, Microsoft Project, AutoCAD). Commitment to safety, quality, and environmental stewardship in all aspects of construction operations Job Benefits & Perks
column11: Civil Supervision, structural supervision, Supervision

column2: Site management is responsible of providing complete project execution support through project life cycle globally.     Vanderlande is the global market leader in baggage handling systems for airports, and sorting systems for parcel and postal services. The company is also a leading supplier of warehouse automation solutions. With a consistently increasing order intake of more than 2.8 billion euros, it has established a global reputation over the past six decades as a highly reliable partner for value-added automated material handling solutions.     We are looking for a Site Supervisor/ Site Manager for Global projects. You will be part of the team that Lead and Support project execution across the Globe.             Your position:          As a Site Supervisor your role is to lead the site execution work and supervise multiple Site Supervisors (Mechanical/ Electrical) and multiple teams of contractors for mechanical and electrical work. And, in parallel, he will work with the project, procurement, Safety, Engineering, and Field Quality team for better Planning, Site Procurements, Safety Implementation, Engineering changes, and to maintain Vanderlande's standard of execution.         Job Description:         Supervision of the Mechanical, electrical and control installation, guide, and train in Electro-Mechanical installation teams.     Inspect and diagnose complex mechanical/electrical systems     Interpret engineering drawings in reference to layout, location, and operation of the system(s).     Should have hand on experience with AutoCAD, Navis and E. Plan drawing.     Should possess conceptual knowledge of PLC systems (Siemens), different type of hardware s, Communication protocols (Profinet, Ethernet, Profibus, ASI).     Should have knowledge of different types of Switch gears, Drives and RLC circuits.     Should have knowledge of I/O testing.     Support the commissioning, testing and integration of material handling system     Managing the quality inspections for the installed equipment with focus on the electrical installation.     You ensure in close coordination with our engineers that the equipment is installed in accordance with the specification.     Support for the site handover and conduct surveys for installation areas.     Aware of our contract and responsibilities and identify deviations.     Reporting progress to the site manager and project manager.     Join progress meetings     Responsible for the electrical and control installation progress on site and ensure to meet the program milestones     Responsible for the site safety and quality of the installed electrical and control equipment     Responsible for daily, weekly, and monthly installation reports and toolbox talk with supervisor team.     Cooperate with your project manager in the establishment of policies and procedures related to Field Support             Desired profile:         Bachelor's degree in electrical/ Mechanical engineering, mechatronics.     10 to 11 years experience in handling WS/ Parcel or Airport system.     Experience of different type of sorters (Line/Loop Sorters) are preferable.     General PLC programming or troubleshooting certification.     Safety certification line IOSH, Emergency preparedness training.         Travel:         Need to Travel 70% or more.         Base Location:         Pune India.         Mandatory Skills:         Leadership and presentation skills including relentless problem solving, results orientation     Should have positive approach, right attitude etc.     Ability to effectively lead and work under pressure,     Ability to work constructively with all stakeholders, building both internal and external relationships.     Proficiency in the application of computerized systems, including standard business applications (i.e., MS Office)     Effective verbal and written communications skills     Negotiation skill and commercial experience to manage contract scope changes directly with clients, suppliers.     Demonstrated organizational skills, and company ethics.     Strong bias for following processes and continual process improvement.     Strong sense of time urgency for critical-path project items, milestones, and key project deliverables

column2: Runwal Group is looking for Supervisor - Finishing to join our dynamic team and embark on a rewarding career journey             Team Supervision    : The Supervisor manages and directs the Finishing department team, which may include technicians, inspectors, and operators. They assign tasks, provide guidance, and ensure that work is completed efficiently and according to schedule.            Quality Control    : They oversee quality control measures in the Finishing department to ensure that products meet established quality standards and specifications. This includes conducting inspections, reviewing product samples, and addressing any defects or deviations from quality requirements.            Process Monitoring    : The Supervisor monitors finishing processes and equipment to ensure they are operating effectively and efficiently. They troubleshoot issues, identify opportunities for process improvement, and implement corrective actions as needed.            Inventory Management    : They manage inventory levels of finishing materials, supplies, and components needed for production. They coordinate with procurement and logistics teams to ensure timely delivery of materials and prevent shortages or overstock situations.            Equipment Maintenance    : The Supervisor ensures that finishing equipment and machinery are properly maintained and serviced. They schedule routine maintenance tasks, coordinate repairs, and ensure that equipment downtime is minimized to maintain production efficiency.            Safety Compliance    : They enforce safety protocols and regulations within the Finishing department to maintain a safe work environment for employees. They conduct safety training, perform safety inspections, and address any safety concerns or hazards promptly.            Training and Development    : The Supervisor provides training to new employees and ongoing training and development opportunities to existing team members. They ensure that employees are knowledgeable about finishing processes, quality standards, and safety procedures.            Production Planning and Scheduling      : They collaborate with production planners and scheduling teams to coordinate finishing activities and ensure that production targets are met. They prioritize tasks, allocate resources, and adjust schedules as needed to meet changing production demands.

column2: Some key responsibilities of a project manager include: Project Planning:  Developing a comprehensive project plan that outlines the scope, objectives, timeline, resources for the project. Design Compliance:  The PM shall ensure that the construction work aligns with the design intent and drawings. They shall review drawings, specifications, and other project documents to verify that the design is being implemented correctly. Any Non-Compliance shall be raised with the Architects/clients for appropriate action. Team Management:  Building and leading a project team, assigning tasks, and ensuring that team members have the necessary resources and support to complete their work. Coordination and Communication:  PM shall act as a liaison between the Interior Architects, build partners, and other project stakeholders & suppliers for any matter related to scope of work. They shall facilitate communication and collaboration between the stakeholders and highlight any changes or challenges that arise during the Interior fit out phase.  Risk Management:  Identifying potential risks to the project and developing strategies to mitigate them. Budget Management:  Monitoring project expenses and ensuring that the project stays within budget. Quality Control:  Ensuring that the project deliverables meet the required quality standards. Responsible for quality audits during the construction phase. Ensure that the materials, finishes, and installations are per specifications. Any discrepancies or issues shall be raised to the Architect/Client through a weekly report mechanism. Timeline Management:  Monitoring project timelines and making adjustments as necessary to ensure that the project stays on track. Documentation:  Keeping accurate records of all project-related activities, including meetings, decisions, and changes to the project plan. Problem-solving:  Addressing any issues or conflicts that arise during the project and finding solutions to keep the project moving forward. Advising the client on contractual matters including price variations as submitted by the contractor. Certifying all contractor bills. A full-time resource for daily execution work at the site, with monitoring conducted directly by a senior part-time resource available on a callout basis as needed.
column11: Project Execution, Site Management, Civil Project Management, Site Supervision

column2: Roles & Responsibilities As a senior horticulturist, you would typically have a range of responsibilities that involve overseeing various aspects of plant cultivation, landscaping, executing projects as per AUTOCAD design, supervise junior horticulturists etc. Here are some common roles and responsibilities for senior horticulturists: Planning,Design and Execution:  You might be involved in designing and executing landscapes. This involves selecting suitable plants considering soil types, drainage, and climate conditions, executing landscapes as per AUTOCAD and drawings presented by clients and creating aesthetically pleasing and functional layouts. Plant Selection and Care:  Senior horticulturists often choose plants that are suitable for specific environments and purposes, such as ornamental gardens, urban landscaping, or agricultural production. You would oversee planting, watering, fertilizing, and pest management to ensure plant health and growth. Supervision and Training:  In a senior role, you might supervise teams of horticulturists, gardeners, or landscaping staff. This includes providing guidance, training, and support to ensure that tasks are completed effectively and according to best practices. Budgeting and Resource Management:  You may be responsible for budgeting and managing resources such as plants, equipment, and personnel. This involves cost analysis, procurement, inventory management, and allocating resources efficiently to meet project goals. Environmental Conservation:  Senior horticulturists play a key role in promoting environmental sustainability and conservation. This can include implementing practices such as water conservation, organic farming, habitat restoration, and biodiversity conservation. Education and Outreach:  Many senior horticulturists engage in educational activities such as conducting workshops, giving presentations, writing articles, or participating in community outreach programs. This helps educate the public about gardening, environmental stewardship, and sustainable agriculture. Regulatory Compliance:  Depending on the industry and location, senior horticulturists may need to ensure compliance with regulations related to plant health, pest control, environmental protection, and land use. Preferred candidate profile  : Diploma in Agriculture ,B.Sc in Horticulture, M.Sc in Horticulture Perks and benefits   Salary , Travel allowances

column2: About the Role: The JM Supervisor is responsible for managing a team of technicians and delivering quality Termite services, optimising material consumption and service excellence through them. The incumbent will report to the OM / AOM/ Sr OE and will have to work as part of a multi-functional team and this involves collaboration with the internal team and external stakeholders. Job Responsibilities: Manage a team of technicians and deliver Service Excellence through a team.  Ensure contractual obligations to our customers are met; ensuring consistently high standards of workmanship are delivered.  Supervision of Termite jobs, SMEs jobs in absence of TSPO jobs, and supporting Solo Technicians if required (Should not be utilised for Office work)  Issue of materials, chemical, Fuel and monitoring & optimising consumption.  Verify physical stock and ensure the same is matching with NAV once in 15 days. Prepare Bags and Materials for technicians one day in advance for next day's schedule, by taking the next day schedule from Planner daily @ 3 pm  Allocate technician for daily deployment in coordination with SPs as per OTOZ  Expected reduction in material consumption at site and in route to optimum utilisation of resources  Inform BM/OM for non moving material each month. Monitor material expiry dates and inform OM/BM min 3-4 months in advance. Update OE on surplus stock / near to expiry & Prepare indents  Physical stock taking at branch and at customer sites  Ensure store remains clean and in neat condition  PPE distribution check and issue  Check service quality when on supervision & surprise visits  Supervise termite jobs and optimise ToS for termite jobs  Improve quality of Termite jobs to reduce complaints  Encourage more technicians to submit leads Key Result Areas: Control & reduction in material cost  Effective utilisation of Squad and Improve Termite ToS  TSPO- Complaint reduction  Increase in nos. of Technicians submitting leads  Streamline PPEs usages and stores material issue & receipt  Competencies (Skills essential to the role): Proven for his skills in various PMS  SCP operating knowledge  Assertive, Self Confident and Team player  Positive Attitude  Takes pride in their work  Ability to work Independently  Leadership skills for getting work done, persuasive  Well Groomed  Educational Qualification / Other Requirement: Minimum 10th pass (prefered 10+2), can read & write in local language (English prefered ) Successfully completed L1 Training Program (L2 Preferred)  Preferably possess two wheeler with valid driving license  Working knowledge of computers will be an added advantage

column2: Overview:  As the Project /Construction head, you will be responsible for leading and managing all aspects of residential construction projects from inception to completion. This role requires a blend of technical expertise, project management skills, and leadership abilities to ensure the successful execution of residential developments. Key Responsibilities: Project  Planning and Execution: Develop       and implement comprehensive project plans for residential construction       projects, including scheduling, budgeting, and resource allocation. Oversee       all phases of construction, from site preparation to final handover,       ensuring adherence to quality standards, timelines, and budgetary       constraints. Coordinate       with architects, engineers, contractors, and subcontractors to optimize       construction processes and achieve project goals. Budgeting      and Cost Management: Prepare       and manage project budgets, monitoring expenses, and controlling costs       throughout the construction lifecycle. Review       and approve project expenditures, change orders, and invoices to ensure       financial accountability and transparency. Identify       cost-saving opportunities and value engineering solutions without       compromising quality or safety standards. Quality      Assurance and Compliance: Establish       and enforce quality standards for residential construction work,       materials, and finishes, ensuring compliance with building codes,       regulations, and industry best practices. Conduct       regular inspections and quality checks to maintain the highest standards       of craftsmanship and construction integrity. Address       any quality issues or deficiencies promptly, implementing corrective       measures as necessary. Team      Leadership and Development: Lead       and inspire project teams, including site supervisors, foremen, and       construction workers, fostering a culture of collaboration,       accountability, and excellence. Provide       guidance, mentorship, and support to team members, promoting professional       growth and development. Foster       positive working relationships with internal and external stakeholders,       facilitating effective communication and collaboration. Risk      Management and Safety: Identify       potential risks and hazards associated with residential construction       projects, implementing proactive measures to mitigate risks and ensure a       safe working environment. Enforce       safety protocols and regulatory compliance on-site, conducting regular       safety inspections and promoting a culture of safety awareness and       accountability. Respond       promptly to any safety incidents or emergencies, coordinating with       relevant authorities and stakeholders to address issues and implement       corrective actions Requirements: Bachelor's      degree in Civil Engineering, Construction Management, or related field (Masters      Degree an added advantage). Proven      experience (X years) in residential construction project management, with      a strong track record of successful project delivery. In-depth      knowledge of residential construction processes, building codes,  regulations, and industry standards. Excellent   leadership, communication, and interpersonal skills, with the ability to  effectively manage and motivate project teams. Proficiency  in project management software and tools. Strong      problem-solving abilities and decision-making skills, with the ability to      multitask and prioritize tasks in a dynamic environment.

column2: The successful applicant will need to have a sound and relevant educational grounding and ideally have at least a few years of commercial construction experience as a QS or Estimator, or ideally, as both.     ?     You will need to be experienced with working on relevant projects, such as, commercial or residential refurbishment or fit-out. The candidate should be experienced with estimation, tendering, contracts, projects, coordination and material procurement. They must be be well versed with Construction Project Management Software like Microsoft Project or Costing.     The main role of a Quantity Surveyor is to provide commercial support to senior surveying staff on one or a number of projects to ensure that projects are procured, delivered within budget and to the highest quality whilst exceeding our customers expectations.      You will be responsible for the delivery of the project to meet its financial targets. You need to demonstrate good working knowledge of contract conditions, procurement of packages, demonstrate the management of project risks and ability to foster productive relationships and can thrive in a fast paced environment.     You will be accurately valuing, certifying and issuing any relevant payment notices for the subcontract works in accordance with the conditions of their subcontract.      Ensure that external valuations are submitted in accordance with conditions of the main contract and that payments are received by the due date. Complete CVC reports, ensuring they accurately reflect the current position on site and the final profit projection.           Responsibilities       Reviewing construction plans and preparing quantity requirements.         Scrutinizing maintenance and material costs, as well as contracts to ensure the best deals.         Liaising with site managers, clients, contractors, and subcontractors.         Preparing reports, analyses, contracts, budgets, risk assessment, and other documents.         Advising managers and clients on improvements and new strategies.         Keeping track of materials and ordering more when required.         Documenting any changes in design and updating budgets.         Establishing and maintaining professional relationships with external and internal stakeholders.         Traveling from the office to various sites as required.         Qualifications       Bachelors degree in Quantity Surveying, Engineering, Management, or similar.         Construction estimating or finance experienced is advantageous.         Strong analytical and critical thinking skills.         Sound knowledge of construction.         Excellent negotiating and interpersonal skills.         Ability to organize, plan, and strategize.         A valid drivers license.         Great networking abilities.

column2: Safety first - Going home safe and well:                    You will be an advocate of Mace's value of Safety First, and be accountable for leading and maintaining exceptional safety, quality, cost, programme, sustainability and project compliance standards.                  You will possess knowledge of local Health and Safety rules and regulations relevant to project portfolio.                You will promote a diverse and inclusive working environment, and understand the importance of the wellbeing of the people you manage.                  Client focus - Deliver on our promise:                    You will work as part of the Construction Delivery Team, taking direction from the Project senior leadership team and other Construction Managers.                  You will build relationships with stakeholders, both internally and externally.                You will build a strong working relationship with your clients, and support the construction lead in turning the client s vision into a deliverable onsite plan.                  Integrity - Always do the right thing:                    You will assist in the control and coordination of specific areas or packages, and ensuring they meet quality and safe working standards.                  You will support the Construction Delivery Team in influencing the long term development of strategy for a function or Business Unit (BU), creating a sustainable business future.                  You will commit to making a positive impact for our people, our clients, and our planet, and take ownership for holding others to account who do not uphold the Mace values.                    Create opportunity for our people to excel:                    You will support other Managers and junior members of your project team and provide an environment to share knowledge and experience.                  You will actively network, innovate, and seek understanding of best practice, utilising the full depth of knowledge of Mace Group, the Centres of Excellence, Mace Way Control Centre and Knowledge Hub.                You will provide support to Delivery Teams, creating a culture of ownership, promoting roles and responsibilities.                  You ll need to have:                    Bachelor's degree in civil with master's from NICMAR/RICS.               Experience of leading a project of a similar nature. Experience in the successful delivery phase of projects and programmes in the construction sector.                  Construction management expertise. Experience of building relationships with key stakeholders.                  Knowledge of how carbon and sustainability considerations will shape the outlook of the projects you are working on.

column2: Description      As our new    Lead Quantity Surveyor- Workplac    e (Mumbai), you will work along with the project team during the pre-tender and execution phase. You will be majorly responsible for tendering, project cost control along with documentation related to project and compliance.        What you'll do:          You will be responsible for creating BOQ estimates based on sets drawing and further prepare a detailed budget for the same.          You will do a market analysis in order to know the current rates of the materials before floating tender and inviting quotations.          You will be responsible for monitoring and controlling the cost of projects from concept to completion.          You will need to be knowledgeable of vendors / suppliers and provide support for comparative and analysis in vendor selection as needed.          You will do periodic analysis on the status of projects with respect to cost and analyse for alternative solutions to manage project budgets.          You will maintain all the documents for total compliance related to design, contractors, legal and other matters as per company standards.        Requirements        Who you are:          You are a QS professional with minimum 6 years of experience in the building construction industry.          You have relevant experience of managing corporate/ workplace interior fit-out projects.          You have a diploma or degree in quantity surveying/ construction management or a related discipline.          You have the knowledge of individual trades and subcontractors relevant to interior fit-outs.          You are tech-savvy, and have experience in successfully adopting digital and technology initiatives.          You have the ability to work in a fast paced environment without compromising on quality and customer satisfaction.          You work well under pressure and have the ability to work independently with minimal supervision.          You will be a subscriber to the Company s core values: teamwork, integrity and excellence.

column2: We are seeking a talented Contracts Head with expertise in residential construction projects to lead our contract management efforts. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in negotiating and managing contracts related to residential development, ensuring compliance with legal requirements and project specifications. They will play a crucial role in maximizing project efficiency, minimizing risks, and fostering positive relationships with clients, contractors, and other stakeholders. Responsibilities: Develop and implement contract management strategies tailored to residential construction projects, including drafting, reviewing, and negotiating contracts with clients, subcontractors, suppliers, and other third parties. Collaborate with project managers, architects, engineers, and legal counsel to ensure that contract terms align with project objectives, budgetary constraints, and regulatory requirements. Conduct comprehensive risk assessments for each project, identifying potential liabilities, contingencies, and risk mitigation measures to safeguard the organization's interests. Monitor contract performance throughout the project lifecycle, tracking milestones, deliverables, and payments to ensure compliance with contractual obligations. Proactively identify and address contractual issues, disputes, and change orders, working closely with internal and external stakeholders to achieve timely resolutions. Develop and maintain contract management procedures, templates, and documentation, ensuring consistency, accuracy, and compliance with organizational policies and industry standards. Stay abreast of relevant laws, regulations, and industry trends affecting residential construction contracts, providing guidance and recommendations to internal teams as needed. Foster positive relationships with clients, subcontractors, and suppliers through effective communication, conflict resolution, and adherence to ethical business practices. Provide training and support to project teams and other departments on contract-related matters, promoting a culture of contract compliance and risk management. Collaborate with finance and accounting teams to ensure accurate billing, invoicing, and cost tracking for contracted services and materials.
column11: Contract Management, Labour Contract, Contracts Planning, Planning, Contract Administration, Contracts

column2: Project Management: Manage the finishing phase of construction projects, including planning, scheduling, and coordinating activities to ensure timely completion within budget constraints.              Quality Control: Implement and enforce quality control measures to ensure that finishing work meets specified standards and client expectations. Conduct regular inspections and audits to identify and address any defects or deficiencies.              Coordination with Subcontractors: Coordinate with subcontractors, suppliers, and other stakeholders involved in finishing work, including carpenters, painters, flooring specialists, and interior designers. Ensure that all work is coordinated effectively to avoid conflicts and delays.              Material Procurement and Management: Procure and manage materials and supplies required for finishing work, including finishes, fixtures, fittings, and decorative elements. Ensure that materials are sourced cost-effectively and in accordance with project specifications.              Budget Management: Monitor and manage the budget for finishing work, tracking expenses and controlling costs to ensure that projects are completed within budgetary constraints.              Client Communication: Serve as a point of contact for clients regarding finishing work, providing regular updates on project progress, addressing any concerns or requests, and ensuring client satisfaction.              Documentation and Reporting: Maintain accurate records of finishing activities, including progress reports, documentation of changes, and correspondence with stakeholders. Prepare and present reports to management as required.              Safety Compliance: Ensure that all finishing work is carried out in compliance with safety regulations and best practices. Implement and enforce safety protocols to prevent accidents and injuries. column2: We are seeking a skilled and detail-oriented Estimator to join our construction team. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in construction estimating, with expertise in analyzing project requirements, developing cost estimates, and ensuring accuracy throughout the bidding process. As an Estimator, you will play a crucial role in helping our company secure profitable projects and deliver exceptional construction services to our clients.                                             ?                   Key Responsibilities:                                 Analyze project blueprints, specifications, and other documentation to understand project requirements and scope.                             Conduct thorough material takeoffs and quantity surveys to determine the materials, labor, and equipment needed for each project phase.                             Collaborate with project managers, engineers, subcontractors, and suppliers to gather accurate cost data and pricing information.                             Prepare detailed and accurate cost estimates, including labor, materials, equipment, subcontractor bids, permits, and overhead costs.                             Utilize estimating software and tools to develop comprehensive cost breakdowns, pricing schedules, and bid proposals.                             Review and evaluate subcontractor and vendor bids to ensure competitiveness and adherence to project specifications.                             Coordinate with project teams to clarify project requirements, resolve discrepancies, and refine cost estimates as needed.                             Present and defend cost estimates during internal review meetings and client presentations.                             Assist in negotiating and finalizing contracts with clients, subcontractors, and suppliers.                             Monitor project budgets, expenses, and changes to ensure cost control and profitability.                             Track industry trends, market prices, and cost factors to inform future estimating practices and strategies.                             Maintain accurate records of estimating data, project documentation, and bid correspondence.                             Collaborate with the procurement team to source and qualify new suppliers and subcontractors.                             Participate in pre-construction meetings, site visits, and project planning sessions as required.                             Adhere to company policies, procedures, and safety standards at all times.                             Continuously seek opportunities to improve estimating processes, workflows, and accuracy.                                 Why we think this job is great:                                 It's a 100% remote position where you ll work from home                             You ll have the resources you need to learn, lead, and deliver results                                     Qualifications:                                 Bachelor's degree in Construction Management, Engineering, or related field (preferred).                             Proven experience as an Estimator in the construction industry.                             Proficiency in construction estimating software and Microsoft Office Suite.                             Strong analytical skills and attention to detail.                             Excellent communication, negotiation, and interpersonal skills.                             Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced environment.                             Knowledge of construction methods, materials, and building codes.                             Familiarity with project management principles and practices.                             Understanding of bid preparation, contract administration, and project cost control.                             Certification in estimating or related fields is a plus                         .                             Able to support a Work from Home setup                             Own PC/laptop (Minimum of i3 processor, 4 gig RAM)                             Internet speed no lower than 10 Mbps download, 10 Mbps upload

column2: Job Description: We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced Project Coordinator to join our team for a prestigious high-rise luxury residential project in South Mumbai. The ideal candidate will possess technical expertise in RCC structures, finishes, MEPF trades coordination, as well as a thorough understanding of site logistics, planning, risk management, and strategy for fast-track construction techniques and innovative construction methods. The Project Coordinator will play a crucial role in ensuring the successful execution of the project from inception to completion. Key Responsibilities: 1. Technical Coordination: - Coordinate with architects, engineers, consultants, and contractors to ensure proper coordination of RCC structures, finishes, MEPF trades, and other technical aspects. - Review construction drawings, specifications, and documents to identify and resolve any discrepancies or conflicts. - Monitor the progress of consultant deliverables in line with Project Master Schedule and ongoing construction activities and ensure adherence to quality standards and project specifications. 2. Site Logistics and Planning: - Develop and implement site logistics plans to optimize the use of resources, equipment, and manpower. - Coordinate with site management teams to plan and schedule construction activities, material deliveries, and equipment mobilization. - Anticipate and mitigate potential construction-related challenges and obstacles to ensure smooth project execution. 3. Strategy for Fast-Track Construction Techniques: - Identify opportunities for implementing fast-track construction techniques to expedite project timelines while maintaining quality and safety standards. - Collaborate with project stakeholders to develop innovative construction methods and strategies to enhance efficiency and productivity. 4. Formwork Planning: - Evaluate and select appropriate types of formwork systems based on project requirements, structural design, and construction methodology. - Develop formwork plans and schedules to ensure timely installation, removal, and reusability of formwork systems. 5. Risk Management: - Identify potential risks and uncertainties associated with the project and develop risk mitigation strategies. - Conduct regular risk assessments and implement measures to minimize the impact of identified risks on project objectives. - Collaborate with project stakeholders to ensure compliance with safety regulations and protocols to mitigate construction-related risks. Requirements: - Bachelors degree in civil engineering or architecture or related field. Masters degree in project management or PMP preferred. - Middle east or international market project delivery experience will be preferred. - Minimum of  15 to 18 years  of experience in project coordination or management, preferably in high-rise residential construction projects. - Strong technical knowledge of RCC structures, finishes, MEPF trades, and construction methods. - Proficiency in project management software and tools. - Excellent communication, leadership, and interpersonal skills. - Ability to work effectively in a fast-paced environment and manage multiple priorities simultaneously. - Proven track record of delivering projects on time and within budget. If you possess the required skills and experience and are passionate about contributing to the success of prestigious luxury residential projects, we encourage you to apply for this exciting opportunity. Join us in shaping the skyline of South Mumbai with iconic and exceptional developments. To apply, please submit your resume on amey.matephod@runwalgroup.in . We thank all applicants for their interest, however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

column2: Roles and Responsibilities  As a Piping Supervisor in the oil and gas industry, you will play a crucial role in overseeing and managing piping construction and installation activities on-site. With 3-6 years of work experience, you will demonstrate a solid understanding of piping systems, construction techniques, and safety protocols within the industry. Responsibilities: Supervise and coordinate the installation, maintenance, and repair of piping systems according to project specifications, codes, and standards. Provide guidance and direction to the piping team, ensuring adherence to schedules and quality standards. Conduct regular inspections to ensure compliance with safety regulations and project requirements. Collaborate with engineering teams to interpret design drawings and resolve any discrepancies or issues during construction. Monitor material usage, inventory, and procurement to ensure efficient project execution. Maintain accurate records of work progress, manpower allocation, and equipment utilization. Conduct toolbox talks and safety meetings to promote a culture of safety among team members. Resolve conflicts and address any disciplinary issues within the piping team as necessary. Liaise with client representatives and project managers to provide updates on project status and address any concerns or requests. Continuously identify opportunities for improvement in processes, procedures, and productivity. Qualifications: Bachelor's degree or diploma in Mechanical Engineering or relevant field (preferred). 3-6 years of experience in piping construction and supervision within the oil and gas industry (preferred) Proficiency in reading and interpreting piping drawings, isometric drawings, and P&IDs. Strong knowledge of piping materials, fittings, welding techniques, and fabrication methods. Excellent leadership and communication skills, with the ability to effectively coordinate and motivate a diverse team. Familiarity with industry standards and regulations such as ASME, ANSI, and API. Certifications in relevant areas such as OSHA 30-Hour Construction Safety, First Aid/CPR, and Confined Space Entry (preferred). Proficiency in project management software and MS Office applications Job Benefits & Perks

column2: Leadership: Supervisors are responsible for leading and managing a team of employees     They provide direction, guidance, and support to ensure that team members work effectively and efficiently     Team Management: They oversee the day-to-day activities of their team, including task assignment, scheduling, and workload management     They ensure that team members are meeting their goals and deadlines     Training and Development: Supervisors often play a role in training new employees and providing ongoing development opportunities for their team members     This may involve on-the-job training, coaching, or recommending additional training or education     Performance Evaluation: They are typically responsible for evaluating the performance of their team members     This includes conducting regular performance reviews, providing feedback, and addressing performance issues or concerns     Problem Solving: Supervisors are expected to handle and resolve issues or conflicts that arise within the team     They may need to find solutions to operational problems and ensure a smooth workflow

column2: Below are the role and responsibility for Estimation Manager  Estimation Management: Lead the estimation team in preparing accurate and detailed cost estimates for construction projects, encompassing materials, labor, equipment and overhead costs. Analyze project specifications, architectural drawings and other relevant documents to create comprehensive and competitive estimates. Collaborate with architects, engineers and project managers to ensure accurate estimation aligned with project requirements. Cost Control and Analysis: Monitor project costs throughout the construction phase, comparing actual expenditures against estimated costs. Identify cost-saving opportunities and potential areas of overruns and collaborate with project teams to implement corrective actions. Prepare regular cost analysis reports for management review, highlighting trends, variances and cost forecasts. Change Order Management: Evaluate and process change orders, modifications and variations to contracts, ensuring proper documentation and alignment with project objectives. Collaborate with project teams to assess the impact of changes on project timelines, costs and deliverables. Risk Mitigation: Identify and assess potential risks associated with estimation accuracy, contract terms and cost control. Develop strategies to mitigate risks and ensure that projects are executed within budgetary and contractual boundaries. ERP: Update all required data on ERP (HiRise). Get required approvals through ERP. Stakeholder Communication: Communicate effectively with other department, vendors, subcontractors and clients to address estimation and contract-related matters. Provide timely updates on cost projections, contract negotiations and project financial performance.   Experience in Estimation ,Budgeting, Billing and Invoicing etc. in reputed real estate company.  Interested Candidate can send   CV on sonali.v@tejraj.in
column11: Estimation

column2: LOHAAR ENGINEERING & CONSTRUCTION PVT. LTD.? is looking for Construction Estimator? to join our dynamic team and embark on a rewarding career journey       Cost Estimation: Analyze project specifications, blueprints, and other construction documents to estimate the costs of labor, materials, equipment, and subcontractor services required for the project      Quantity Takeoffs: Perform quantity takeoffs, which involve quantifying the amount of materials and labor needed for each aspect of the construction project      Pricing and Bidding: Source pricing for materials and subcontractor services, solicit and compare bids, and negotiate with suppliers and subcontractors to secure favorable terms and prices      Cost Database Management: Maintain a database of historical cost data to support accurate estimating and track cost trends over time      Budget Development: Collaborate with project managers and clients to develop project budgets, taking into account various cost elements and contingencies      Value Engineering: Identify cost-saving and value-adding opportunities to optimize the project's financial efficiency      Cost Analysis: Analyze cost breakdowns, identify cost drivers, and assess project risks and uncertainties      Proposal Preparation: Prepare detailed cost proposals and estimates, including comprehensive documentation of assumptions, methodologies, and cost justifications      Change Order Evaluation: Evaluate change orders and modifications to existing construction projects, providing cost assessments and recommendations
column11: Construction, Bidding, Database management, Estimator, Value engineering, Finance, Proposal preparation, Cost estimation, Cost analysis, Cost

column2: An IT Recruiter is responsible for sourcing, attracting, and hiring top-quality IT talent for an organization. The primary responsibilities of this role include:      Sourcing and identifying potential candidates: The IT Recruiter is responsible for sourcing and identifying potential candidates through various channels such as job boards, professional networks, and employee referrals.      Screening and interviewing candidates: The IT Recruiter will screen and interview candidates to assess their technical abilities, work experience, and overall fit for the organization.      Building and maintaining a pipeline of qualified candidates: The IT Recruiter will build and maintain a pipeline of qualified candidates for current and future job openings.      Negotiating offers: The IT Recruiter will negotiate offers with successful candidates, ensuring that compensation and benefits packages are competitive and in line with industry standards.      Onboarding and integration: The IT Recruiter will support the onboarding and integration process for new hires, ensuring that they have a smooth transition into their new role and organization.      Reporting and data analysis: The IT Recruiter will collect and analyze data on recruiting metrics and provide regular reports to management on their findings.      The ideal candidate for this role should have strong interpersonal and communication skills, as well as experience in IT recruitment.      They should have a good understanding of various technical roles and technologies, and be able to quickly assess the technical abilities of potential candidates.      Experience in IT recruitment, sourcing, and talent acquisition.      Familiarity with various applicant tracking systems (ATS) and candidate sourcing tools is also desirable."

column2: A surveyor in a classification society plays a crucial role in ensuring the safety, compliance, and quality of ships and marine structures. The main responsibilities are aimed at verifying that vessels meet international and classification society standards.         ?             Key Accountabilities               Technical Expertise:         Provide expert technical advice to clients, shipowners, and manufacturers on matters related to classification, design, construction, and maintenance.     Stay abreast of the latest industry technologies, innovations, and advancements to ensure the application of cutting-edge knowledge in surveys.             Regulatory Compliance:         Ensure strict adherence to classification society rules, international regulations, and statutory requirements during surveys and inspections.     Collaborate with regulatory bodies to interpret and apply new regulations as they arise.             Problem-Solving:         Act as a troubleshooter, addressing technical issues and challenges that may arise during surveys or in the course of client interactions.     Provide practical and effective solutions to clients while maintaining compliance with classification standards.             Quality Assurance:         Implement quality assurance measures in survey processes to uphold the highest standards of accuracy and reliability in inspection reports.     Participate in internal quality audits and contribute to the continuous improvement of surveying procedures.             Client Education:         Educate clients on classification society processes, rules, and the importance of compliance for safety and operational efficiency.             Documentation and Reporting:         Develop and maintain standardized templates for inspection reports, ensuring consistency and clarity in reporting.     Integrate digital tools for efficient documentation management and reporting.             Collaboration and Teamwork:         Collaborate with colleagues, both within the classification society and externally, to share knowledge, experiences, and best practices.     Actively participate in team meetings and contribute to a collaborative work environment.             Continuous Professional Development:         Engage in ongoing professional development to stay current with evolving industry standards, technologies, and best practices.     Pursue relevant certifications or qualifications to enhance expertise.             Ethical Conduct:         Uphold the highest ethical standards in all professional interactions, ensuring integrity, transparency, and fairness in survey processes.                   Education         Master s Degree in Naval Engineering           Qualifications         Minimum 3 years experience working as a Junior Surveyor or minimum 5 years experience in the engineering or survey fields within the marine industry or other applicable industry to their specialization.     Proficiency in the English language commensurate with the scope of classification, statutory certification, related services and, before assignment, with their future work.     Ability to develop a working knowledge of RINA Rules, Guides, statutory regulations, and related instructions, as well as the RINA Employee Safety Policy.     Ability to understand engineering plans and have a basic knowledge of shipbuilding practices and ship operations.       Ability to perform new building surveys:       to assess the suitability of certified materials and products supplied for the new building,to assess that hull, machinery and equipment have been built in compliance with rules and regulations by means of compulsory inspections, tests and trials,to identify the deficiencies to be rectified (if any) and assess whether immediate repair is necessary or a recommendation may be issued with an appropriate due date,to issue Certificates, Reports, Records and Status in compliance with rules and regulations.       Ability to perform ship in service surveys:       to assess that hull, machinery and equipment have been maintained in compliance with rules and regulations by means of compulsory overall inspections, tests and trials,     to identify the deficiencies to be rectified (if any) and assess whether immediate repair is necessary or a recommendation may be issued with an appropriate due date,     to follow-up as required by rules and regulations any repair work or due     to previous outstanding recommendations,     to assess whether the deficiencies identified (if any) may be linked with potential failure of the Ship Management System,     to endorse Certificates, issue Reports and Status in compliance with rules and regulations.     Knowledge of ships engineering systems and machinery.     Knowledge of computer programs or software packages related to job responsibilities.     Knowledge of related technical interfaces required for group project work.     Candidates with Chief Engineer experience and previous Auditor experience in ISM, ISPS, MLC will be preferred.         Competencies         MAKE EFFECTIVE DECISIONS - Structure activities according to priorities, actions, resources and constraint     ADDRESS THE WAY - Have a big picture of different situations and reinterpret it in a perspective way     MANAGE EMOTIONS - Recognise ones and others emotions and express and regulate ones reactions     CLIENT INTIMACY - Embrace internal and external client needs, expectations, and requirements to ensure maximum satisfaction     EARN TRUST - Take everyones opinion into account and remain open to diversity     PROMOTE SUSTAINABLE DEVELOPMENT - Promote commitment by keeping promises as a Role Model     THINK FORWARD - Capitalise on experiences and translate them into action plans for the future     PIONEER CHANGE - Actively embrace change and benefit from the new circumstances     BUILD NETWORK - Forge trust relationships, across departments, and outside the organization                 At RINA, we endeavor to create a work environment where every single person is valued and encouraged to develop new ideas. We provide equal employment opportunities and are committed to creating a workplace where everyone feels respected and safe from discrimination or harassment of any kind. We are also compliant to the Italian Law n. 68/99.
